Very good headphones. Pros: Very good sound quality. Very comfy. Reasonable price. Typical good build quality from Sennheiser.

Cons: None.
Four Stars. Good sound isolation, but ears do get warm after30-60 minutes. Great sound!

Great sound, but UNCOMFORTABLE!. I have to agree with many of the reviewers who have given these earphones low marks for comfort -- the sound is great, but it just doesn't make up for the fact that the ear pads are very hard and they really aren't large enough to cover the ear.  Very uncomfortable to use for more than about 30 minutes or so.  I am very disappointed, especially after reading the many GOOD reviews.  These people must have really small, really hard heads.

Not Great, But Worth the Money. Took some getting use to, because I'm accustomed to a brighter, more detailed sound. But the warmth and creaminess makes for a pleasant listening experience. Older analog recordings sound better with these cans as it masks the imperfections and smoothens everything out. Not really good for the studio where definition and detail are paramount. Good upgrade for those coming out of cheap headsets.

ok. They feel cheap and flimsy. They aren't very comfortable, as they're very tight and the cushions are really crappy feeling. The range of motion is decent, not as good as Audio Technica though. Lack of removable cable is lame. Sound quality is decent. Overall I'd much rather buy a pair of M40x's, or even an older pair of M50 cans.

Nice headphone.. nice sound..  but bulky. Its a very nice headphone... nice sound... but I found it very heavy.. after using for about an hour of so, I used to get head ache.. so stopped using it.. but I will still recommend it for its good quality and also for a short time use...
Good sound but grips the head too tightly. Great sound, but I didn't realize these grip the head so tightly when I ordered them online. Or maybe I just have a big skull?

over all good, not for active people. purchased these after reading a lot of reviews. choice was between senn. 280 pro or the 595's. I wanted to wear these while snowboarding or going to the gym, let me say there a whole lot bulkier then i thought. strictly made for home use, or travel. the sound qaulity is great and songs sound so much better then you thought. this being my first set of nice headphones i cant say too much.

Well made, good sound, excellent attenuation. Very nice, solidly built headphones.
The sound quality is generally excellent, with deep base [e.g. double bases sound very solid and well defined] and smooth middle and highs.
I use these with a Sansui Quad receiver and classical LPs and CDs.
The sound attenuation is impressive/

Natural Sounding. These HD 280 Pro headphones are comparable to Sony MDR-7510. The audio is clean and neutral. Audio detail comes out clean but the bass is a little bit dry. I'm told in time the bass will get fuller with use.

HD 280 Pro headphones are good for any audio with fine detail. Also, if your mixing these are sound accurate.

I can recommend these headphones.

Great headphones for a good price.. Everything about these headphones is good. They're comfortable, have a very decent cord, sound great, and are relatively inexpensive for their quality range. The first thing I listened to was Pink Floyd's "Breath", and at the very beginning, I didn't even realize that the pumping heartbeat was part of the music. I thought that I was hearing the blood pump through my ears in anticipation. The range is excellent.

If you like wearing large headphones. If you like wearing large headphones, then these are the ones for you.  They wrap your head in the sounds that you are listening to.  They have a good amount of noise cancellation aspects to them as well.

Worth it. If you have roommates or are up late and don't want to wake the house, then these are great.  They have good sound and are really comfortable.  I would probably get another of the same if these broke.  I work nights and have used these all night on a day off so I wouldn't wake others up.  I'm not an audiophile, but I do appreciate good sound quality.  For the price, these are worth it.

Great headphones!. Great headphones, let it run for atleast 100 hours, (aka burn-in) effect, then it sounds very good.

Only thing i do not like, it is very uncomfortable, very tight on the head. Hope Sennheiser will some design review on these headphones.

Other than that it is great!

Uncomfortable. I needed closed-ear headphones for noise isolation (working in a lab) and also good sound. These model has both. The ambient noise was reduced significantly (equipment noise, people talking). The sound was very good, noticeably better than my cheaper HD-515. Other nice things are a coiled cord, decent materials and design.
However these headphones are very uncomfortable because of the pressure on the head. Plus I wear glasses so be aware that this may be a factor. I tried them in different positions for a couple of hours, then finally gave up with a huge headache. Will be returning, unfortunately.
Good for mixing. I wasn't blown away by the sound these produce but they make a good general quality sound...good enough for me to trust them during mixing.

Yes.. These headphones sounds really good for the price. The bass is boomy just like you want it, but doesn't overpower the mids or the treble. Just try them on some jazz or Nujabes. You can hear everything. My main genre of choice is metal and it works perfect for that too.

The soundstage isn't huge but it's better than IEMs for sure.

They fold up nicely, and aren't uncomfortable at all.
If something would happen to these I would buy Sennheiser again.. These provide good sound and are durable!

Very solid performance and value.. I gave it 4 stars because of the sound quality. It's good, but not great. Now, in terms of noise isolation, it's pretty good. I use it for drumming and it fits me well.

Great Headphones. I have a set of Bose QC 15's and these sound as good if not better. The around the ear muffs do a good job of noise isolation. The sound is great with no distortion. The cord is very long and I am concerned about the weight of the cord causing premature failure at the connecting end as I leave these attached to my laptop all the time and the cord is hanging unsupported. I highly recommend these for the price.

Comfy and Compatible. The HD 280 Pro headphones are comfortable and passively block outside sound.

The 64 Ohms resistance is low enough to work with all my devices.

There's no volume adjuster on the cable or headphones, which is good, since those tend to break on me.

The ear cushions cover my whole ear and are actually pretty comfortable. I would not get these for taking .... These headphones sound very clear and crisp. The ear cushions cover my whole ear and are actually pretty comfortable.

I would not get these for taking around outside though because they look kind of funny on. Unless you have a really wide head these stick out kind of funny.

Nice sound though and good for at the computer.

Sennheiser 280 HD. Total audiophile here.  I have Infiniy fronts, MBQuart center, klipsch surrounds, and a 500w 12" Klipsch Sub for my home stereo ($4000 system.) these headphones combined with a good quality soundcard/amp will work excellent as surround sound headphones .... Really accurate studio sound quality headphones! Oh my God! These are amazing.. For the price, there are no better headphones out there. Nice fit (I don't have big hair) and great sound. I'm sure that there are headphones out there that sound better, but they are twice or three times the price, possibly more. You will not be disappointed. BTW, I am coming from a pair of Sony MDR-V200 phones. Nice, but the HD-280 blows them away.

Great traditional closed headphones.. Sennheiser HD-280 Professional Headphones I had to order a second set because first had a faulty cable--perhaps not fully tested before packaging at factory. Very good flat response--using bass and treble controls on my Fisher tube amp at midpoints. (I am not using headphones amp.) Very complete frequency range response. You can hear minute details in music and voice. Very good isolation from external room noise. Comfortable and stay put. You would have to buy speakers costing thousands to get sound this good.

Comfortable to wear. These things hurt my ears, MUSICALLY!!! Comfortable to wear, but the audio sounded like it was coming out of a tin can. Awful sound reproduction. HD-280. The HD-280 did excatly as promised, great sound and confort while blocking out external noise.  I would highly recommend these headphones.

Great sound, like the passive noise reduction.. Bought these for work where the office can get a bit loud at times and I needed noise sound reduction. Tight sound but so is the fit. I liked the sound produced by these headphones but the severe clamping force made them quite uncomfortable after only a short period of time. Maybe they would feel better with a longer period of stretching (say a month) but they were a gift so I did not have more time to experiment.  Given this condition, I would only recommend this headphone to people with very small heads..
Three Stars. decent but my soul by ludacris get much better sound at around the same price

One Star. The audio isn't so good, I would have expected much better. Returned it.

Perfect for noisy office.. I bought these for use in my noisy office and even though they are not "noise cancelling" they do a great job of it! They are also very comfortable to wear and sound great.

sound quality is pretty good, and this could just be because the .... sound quality is pretty good, and this could just be because the headphone's new, but the headphones clamp down on the head too tight, making it uncomfortable to wear it for a long time. Excellent headphones at an affordable price. I don't have a lot of experience with over-the-ear headphones but these meet and exceed all of my expectations. The full earcup design eliminates most of the unwanted outside noise yet are very comfortable to wear for extended periods of time. Frequency response is spot on with crystal clear highs; full, warm mid-range, and plenty of deep, rich bass without sounding artificially enhanced. My music never sounded so good. I find myself running the EQ flatter than normal because these headphones don't require boosting certain frequencies - very flat response.

CLAMPING TORTURE DEVICE. This is the most uncomfortable headphone I've ever worn. Good isloation, good material and decent sound quality. But very very uncomfortable. Would not recommend to anyone who is looking to wear these for a long period of time. 2 out of 5.

Sound is great and cancel most outside noises - or buffers them .... Sound is great and cancel most outside noises - or buffers them enough that you don't pay attention. I love the fit and very comfortable. I have a small head, and these actually fit me on the smallest setting.  I wear a hearing aid and it doesn't squeal when I'm wearing these.  If you're going from cheap to mid priced headphones, these will amaze you.

I love Sennheiser headphones (and swear by my HD650s). I love Sennheiser headphones (and swear by my HD650s) , and was hoping these would be a solid option for my office.  The ear cups are way too small for me, and are incredibly uncomfortable.  The sound quality was sub-par (granted I'm spoiled by the 650s) and ultimately I had to return them.

Such a great set. I don't have words to describe how content I am with these headphones. Lows, mids, highs, all crystal clear. Great bass, very comfortable to wear for long periods, and I like the curled wiring.
Traded back in for my Sonys. Uncomfortable for extended uses. Great sounding cans except hi end sounds a bit too sizzling to me. Not very comfortable for extended wear usage.
Dope. Clean. Accurate. Perfect Price. Great for mixing and mastering on a DIY budget. Comfortable. I was able to wear for hours at a time with little discomfort

noise isolation only fair. The headphones have nice audio quality, are comfortable to wear, but the isolation from room noise is only so-so; it seems that comfort and noise suppression are mutually exclusive. I do like the heavy, single cord. But at $100, these headphones are not a great value.

Parts are replaceable which is a huge option that I have not seen offered by other brands.  These are not throw away headphones.  They are keepers!

Pros:
- Extended frequency response and warm, natural sound reproduction
- Around-the-ear design with padded earcups
- Earpads, headband padding, and audio cord are easily replaceable, ensuring long life

Check out the rest of the list for other great Sennheiser headphones: http://boldlist.net/top-5-over-ear-Sennheiser-headphones.php
Sennheiser HD-280 - Great Headphones. The HD-280 are excellent headphones for a reasonable price.  The sound reproduction is true professional quality.

Do not hesitate to buy these HD280 Pro.. Very near to a religious experience.  Truly.  They are that good. And I am only listening to MP3.  I can only imagine how astounding they would be with true source music.

Perfect for mixing duties. I have a small electronic music studio, but I live in a shared house and can't run monitor speakers.. been using HD280 Pro cans forever, do I bought them again when my old ones died.  Great, flat reproduction, perfect for mixing and finalization.  I hope Sennheiser never stops making these!

... headphones are form fitting to my head which I like, old school looking is what I like growing .... Sennheiser HD-280 PRO headphones are form fitting to my head which I like, old school looking is what I like growing up in the late 70's early 80's, they sound great, would recommend for sure but everybody hears differently, what sounds good to me may not to you....nevertheless they are Sennheiser's need I say more?

these headphones combined with a good quality soundcard/amp will work excellent as surround sound headphones .... Really accurate studio sound quality headphones! Definitely not for those looking for an exaggerated colored sound out of the box. That said, these headphones combined with a good quality soundcard/amp will work excellent as surround sound headphones! I have had many gaming headsets including the Astros A40's. The Sennheiser HD 280 pro is my preferred wired gaming headset when used with a amp and external mic! A great all around headphone!

Great traditional closed headphones.. Sennheiser HD-280 Professional Headphones I had to order a second set because first had a faulty cable--perhaps not fully tested before packaging at factory. Very good flat response--using bass and treble controls on my Fisher tube amp at midpoints. (I am not using headphones amp.) Very complete frequency range response. You can hear minute details in music and voice. Very good isolation from external room noise. Comfortable and stay put. You would have to buy speakers costing thousands to get sound this good.

over all good, not for active people. purchased these after reading a lot of reviews. choice was between senn. 280 pro or the 595's. I wanted to wear these while snowboarding or going to the gym, let me say there a whole lot bulkier then i thought. strictly made for home use, or travel. the sound qaulity is great and songs sound so much better then you thought. this being my first set of nice headphones i cant say too much.

Comfortable to wear. These things hurt my ears, MUSICALLY!!! Comfortable to wear, but the audio sounded like it was coming out of a tin can. Awful sound reproduction. I returned these and bought the Audio Technica ATH M50X. I compared the Sennheiser HD 280 and Audio Technicas to the same MP3 player. A Zune MP3 player and a professional Wheatstone broadcast audio mixer.  I did not touch any EQ settings. The Audio Technica ATH M50's sounded so nice and smooth. The technical specs for both headphones are not consistent and not complete. Impedance mismatch??? Not sure.

Natural Sounding. These HD 280 Pro headphones are comparable to Sony MDR-7510. The audio is clean and neutral. Audio detail comes out clean but the bass is a little bit dry. I'm told in time the bass will get fuller with use.

HD 280 Pro headphones are good for any audio with fine detail. Also, if your mixing these are sound accurate.

I can recommend these headphones.

Sennheiser HD 280 Pro. These headphones have a great sound quality for the price. They fit comfortably and can be folded for storage.

HD-280. The HD-280 did excatly as promised, great sound and confort while blocking out external noise.  I would highly recommend these headphones.

Great Accurate Sound Reproduction. The Sennheiser HD-280 PRO Headphones are very accurate headphones and have fantastic sound quality.  They do not color the sound like other headphones so they can be used as monitors for recording purposes. They are comfortable and fit securely while sealing out exterior noise.  Parts are replaceable which is a huge option that I have not seen offered by other brands.  These are not throw away headphones.  They are keepers!

Comfy and Compatible. The HD 280 Pro headphones are comfortable and passively block outside sound.

The 64 Ohms resistance is low enough to work with all my devices.

There's no volume adjuster on the cable or headphones, which is good, since those tend to break on me.

Great sound for the money. Sound is pretty darn good on these! They don't have extreme bass, but the sound is "right" - not like a lot of headphones that put an emphasis on bass, but neglect the rest. Very balanced. Highly recommended! I would also recommend a headphone amp for these if you have a weak output, like my Dell laptop.

CLAMPING TORTURE DEVICE. This is the most uncomfortable headphone I've ever worn. Good isloation, good material and decent sound quality. But very very uncomfortable. Would not recommend to anyone who is looking to wear these for a long period of time. 2 out of 5.

Great Headphones. Great headphones. Great sound isolation, accurate sound reproduction.
They're also build very well, would recommend to anybody that needs a pair of headphones for a studio setting.

Good - met review expectations. I really like these headphones, I purchased them based on a recommendation from my son as he also has them.  I like them and they met every expectation I had. I would definitely recommend them to others, the only thing I wish they had was a bag for transport.
Bought for Hubbie. He is thrilled.  Said the sound is amazing! Clear, crisp and comfortable.  He would recommend this headset to all of his friends.

Tight sound but so is the fit. I liked the sound produced by these headphones but the severe clamping force made them quite uncomfortable after only a short period of time.  I tried stretching them out over a soccer ball for about 5 days and they felt a bit better but not by much.  Maybe they would feel better with a longer period of stretching (say a month) but they were a gift so I did not have more time to experiment.  Given this condition, I would only recommend this headphone to people with very small heads..

Amazing for price. I've used them on HD TV/stereo system for 2 years and they have handled dropping, walking on, kicking, yanking out with foot and daily use watching TV in quiet mode. Better than my HD stereo system with 5 speakers.
I'm totally amazed and would like to get another pair but my 30 year old Nikko won't die.
Very nice head fit on both wife's and my head, several hours at a time. Nicely adjustable, no breaking or cracking, or splitting.
Ideal headset for the use.
I'm very pleased and would recommend them... actually have recommended them several times.

Phenomal sound at a great price.. Pros:

Cons:

Would I recommend to a friend? Yes.
HD-280. The HD-280 did excatly as promised, great sound and confort while blocking out external noise.  I would highly recommend these headphones.

Would recommend

The sound is great on this headset. The sound is great on this headset.and the only reason I gave it a 4star is because the way its design..its a little too bulky for my head...otherwise sound is great and noise cancelling is superb.

Amazing Sound at a Fair Price. I was using an old $40 pair of noise-cancelling headphones for podcast recording, and I had no idea how bad I really had it.  These babies are an entirely different world on an entirely different level, and I'm told they compete SOUNDLY with far more expensive sets.

Why would you spend two hundred bucks on a junk pair of Beats if you're keeping them at your computer desk?  Save money and get these badboys for WAY better sound.
Five Stars. These headphones work well for basic recording and for cancelling out outside noise when listening to music.

Good headphones. These headphones were just as described.  Good sound, and fairly decent noise cancellation...although nowhere near what one would consider "top rate" in that department (noise cancelling).  But they get the job done, and are fairly comfortable for wearing long hours.

Very good. There is only one reason I do not put 5 starts on it, and maybe I am wrong, but to me, with 5-stars noise-cancelling headphones I should not hear conversations going on around me without any music on.

Using these headphones and some light (but continuous) music, you should not hear any conversations going on around you, that deserves 4 stars.

Pretty Good Phones. I bought these just to hear what a good set of passive phones would do, compared to a good set of active noise-cancelling headphones like the Audio-Technica. Turns out that for me, at least, there is no comparison.  There's nothing wrong with the Sennheisers, but their claimed 32 DB (passive) noise reduction is not anywhere as good in practice as the AT. When I listen in my noisy apartment, with the typical airco and refrigerator and washer/dryer running, I hear a lot of rumble with the Sennheisers but the AT tunes it all out.
Really awesome wired headphones. Seriously, the sound on these are incredible. Truly noise cancelling. Also has really nice base. I absolutely love these headphones!

comments.comment:
Too much static, poor head fit.. Two problems: I was unable to completely tune out all the background static and hiss from the headset. I tried multiple channels and the tune knob, as well as putting the wall wart on different circuits, but there was always a hiss.

I was also unable to get a comfortable fit with the headset. They were always slipping out of place at the slightest head movement, which completely changed the sound.

I'm usually a Sennheiser fan but these weren't usable.

comments.comment: Decent sound, mediocre transmission/reception. These headphones provide Sennheiser audio quality, but FM static and interference. Not even just FM, but poor FM reception. As soon as the headphones move two meters or so from the receiver, static and hissing regularly interrupt the audio. So, for users who plan never to stray more than a meter or 1.5 meters from the transmitter with their headphones, these might warrant a four star rating. For everyone else, it's hard to warrant a high rating when otherwise good audio is made awful by poor wireless transmission.

comments.comment:
Very good. I am very mechanically-challenged, so I was dreading any kind of installation, but the manual refers you to a video that explains it all very clearly (and the narrator's English accent is great).  Basically, you just charge it overnight, plug it into Audio Out, and you're ready to go.

The headphones are comfortable and the volume is clear and adjustable and audible up to 300 feet.  If you're watching with another person, you can install an adapter so they have audio.  Easy-peasy and the price is right.  Recommended.

comments.comment: FCC Mandated Auto-Off is annoying. The range is great, they sound alright for RF, but if you don't have any sound coming through your headphones for a while the base automatically turns off. You'd think it'd send a "hey headphones, turn off too!" signal, but no, it just turns off, so your headphones blare loud static. I figured it was worth pointing out that the auto-off is FCC mandated for anything that uses RF, but that Sennheiser dropped the ball by making the headphones blare static without a paired dock.

ngram_comments: Perfect TV Headset. Work really good. Sound quality is great. Now I can play my pc games in peace and my wife can watch her TV without blaring the audio.
Not good for laying down. Sound quality is good and so is the range for a large bedroom. However I take off 2 stars because they slip off easily and aren't comfortable to wear while laying down.
Good for night TV watching. The sound quality is good, and they feel very comfortable. I can fall asleep on your back and wake up without  ear pain.

Decent sound, mediocre transmission/reception. These headphones provide Sennheiser audio quality, but FM static and interference. Not even just FM, but poor FM reception. As soon as the headphones move two meters or so from the receiver, static and hissing regularly interrupt the audio. So, for users who plan never to stray more than a meter or 1.5 meters from the transmitter with their headphones, these might warrant a four star rating. For everyone else, it's hard to warrant a high rating when otherwise good audio is made awful by poor wireless transmission.

Augmentation for old ears.... Although I bought this set of headphones for my mother-in-law, I think that I will enjoy using it myself.  The sound quality is much better than that from my previous pair.

Great sound for all!!. This was returned because we would have needed another piece of equipment to place on the TV to work.  Also when sitting next to my partner, I could hear the sound.  The quality of the sound was great.

Nice clear strong sound.. Nice quality, great sound, very little static, and works anywhere in the house. Doesn't mute the TV when in use. Exactly what I wanted. A little uncomfortable when used for long periods of time.

Perfect for anything tv related. I game and stream all the time, my father also likes to watch sports on the surround sound setup every night around the same time, I bought him these and they've not had a single pickup ever. Even after hundreds of hours of listing. The sound quality is quite good for this price point, the highs are slightly harsh but never distort and the open back nature allows a nice wide sound stage.
Sounds good to me. Keeps the sound of what I'm viewing on TV away from my wife.  That's it's only use for me. The sound quality is good, and I'm quite happy with my purchase.

Good quality, once you get it working.. Took way more work to get it set up than necessary. But once I did, worked great. Sound is very good. The next great test is to see if we can run two headphones off it at the same time.

Headphones Very Uncomfortable and Sound Quality a Huge Disappointment. These are the most uncomfortable headphones I have ever tried!  And the sound quality of the unit is terrible.  AND, when you turn up the volume on the tv, it cause the headphones to have a hollow, echoing sound!  ...Very disappointed in this product and I strongly recommend you do not buy it - you will end up returning it.  I think you have to pay about twice as much to get a quality headphone.
Four Stars. Works well sound quality isn't what Id expect from Sennheiser.
Sennheuiser RF Headphones. Comfortable headset, good sound quality, fair price. I have some hearing loss coupled with poor TV speakers made viewing difficult. This product makes viewing 100% better

FCC Mandated Auto-Off is annoying. The range is great, they sound alright for RF, but if you don't have any sound coming through your headphones for a while the base automatically turns off. Has good range. I wear it outside mowing and washing .... Very loose fitting. Falls off my big head if you bend over. Has no adjustment for holding it tighter to head. Has good range. I wear it outside mowing and washing cars and listen to music on Pandora through Roku or the evening news when grilling outdoors but it will not stay on so I wear a headband around it to keep it on. Good volume adjustment and clear sound.

They're just OK. They work but they are not noise canceling. We got these so my husband can watch TV while I work or sleep but they don't fit snug to the ears so I can still hear the sound somewhat. For the money you shouldn't be able to hear anything. Such a shame, too, because this is generally a good brand for headphones.

Decent sound, mediocre transmission/reception. These headphones provide Sennheiser audio quality, but FM static and interference. Not even just FM, but poor FM reception. As soon as the headphones move two meters or so from the receiver, static and hissing regularly interrupt the audio. So, for users who plan never to stray more than a meter or 1.5 meters from the transmitter with their headphones, these might warrant a four star rating. For everyone else, it's hard to warrant a high rating when otherwise good audio is made awful by poor wireless transmission.

I could never expect better performance. Just received the unit.  The included AAA batteries were not included, but considering the price this is not a significant problem.  The unit set up and started working just as advertised.  The headphones are more comfortable than expected being on ear phones.  Sound reproduction in the headphones is quite good and I'm hearing audio sounds than never were heard over the TV speakers.  For the price I could never expect better performance.

Does its job, beware of the static. It's good enough for quite night TV viewing. It's essentially an FM radio with a dial at the headphone, so if you sleep with it, sometime the headpiece rubs on the bed the wrong way could tune out the clear sound. Further, when the TV stops producing sound for a short while, the transmitter turns itself off, causing the headphone to play really loud static.

Perfect for anything tv related. I game and stream all the time, my father also likes to watch sports on the surround sound setup every night around the same time, I bought him these and they've not had a single pickup ever. Even after hundreds of hours of listing. The sound quality is quite good for this price point, the highs are slightly harsh but never distort and the open back nature allows a nice wide sound stage.
Sounds good to me. Keeps the sound of what I'm viewing on TV away from my wife.  That's it's only use for me. The sound quality is good, and I'm quite happy with my purchase.
Good Product. It came in well packaged and as advertised. I'm very happy with them. They have great sound.

Worked great for 2.5 yrs and then quit.. Good sound, clear voice for TV. Was really disappointed when it stopped broadcasting after ONLY 2.5 years. The charging light works, so its not the charger. The green light indicating broadcast is out, and all I get is static. When I tried to adjust the tuning dial, still from top to bottom, all I got was static. It's a shame it quit, I'm a regular customer who bought many Sennheiser products...won't be buying these RF headphones again from them.

Good quality, once you get it working.. Took way more work to get it set up than necessary. But once I did, worked great. Sound is very good. The next great test is to see if we can run two headphones off it at the same time.
Sennheuiser RF Headphones. Comfortable headset, good sound quality, fair price. I have some hearing loss coupled with poor TV speakers made viewing difficult. This product makes viewing 100% better
Nifty. Love these, very handy. Not the best sound quality for music. Good for audiobooks and the like.

Good headphones.. Bought this because I like watching movies on TV and wife likes to read.  She can't read when she overhears the audio from my shows.  So I gave in and bought this product.

Good sound.  Plenty of volume if needed (I use about 1/3 volume).  Enough treble to hear conversations.
good sound. I just wish they made wireless ear .... These are working very well, good sound. I just wish they made wireless ear buds so you could lay sideways on your pillow with them on.
This is it.. Works as advertised. Thank you.  Good clear rich sound.

Great so far!. Just received this today.  Was easy to set up without actually reading the directions.  Easy to quickly grab headphones to put on.  No unplugging any cords or pressing buttons to get it started.  Ear cups are not as comfy as previous models and just sort of sit flat over your ears.  Sound of the tv is very good and seems very clear.

Good quality, depends on application.. As far as these type of headsets go, I guess these are good.  The sound quality is good but they allow too much noise to escape them while listening.  It defeats the purpose a bit since I was hoping to use these in the bedroom while my wife is sleeping or vise versa.  Also, if you pause what you're watching for too long, you get extremely loud white noise/hissing coming from the headphones.

Good sound - terrible design.. I both like and HATE these headphones. The sound is very good, the big problem is the darn things won't stay on my head. The very slightest movement or tilt of my head and they FALL OFF.  No matter how I adjust them, that is the one that slides  up and down but that doesn't allow any tightening. Had they made the cushions over the ear instead of on the ear they would fit much better.

Line of sight audio. Main reason I purchased these was because of the price point and the name. Well truth be told you got to be pretty close to get good sound quality. Overall not such a great product. Switch positioning are also in a very bad place.
Good sound, great range. Good sound, great range. The one issue is they are not comfortable after several hours. Stop using them at work for this reason.
Great headphones -- wireless. Good frequency response.. These headphones are bad a$$. Sound is awesome. No wires. A lot of different options to hook into your TV or souround system.

Great Value & Sound. These have been in use for almost one year, less a month. sound quality is rock sold Sennheiser. Signal goes in and out in some areas of the home, but good for the $$ and not a huge issue.  Getting good time between charges. I use them at night. My hearing is shot thanks to rock shows in the '70s, 80s, 90, ect., so it's nice to hear details and dialog easily. I'd buy them again.

A lot of headphones for the money without sacrificing quality!. I've been a Sennheiser fan for years. The headphones I always used the RS130 model which they no longer make so I decided to try the RS120 model. Much to my surprise they work and sound just as good as the RS130's which have surround sound.  These 120's sound clear and I don't hear any hissing or humming. I recommend these highly and a bargain at the price!

"on the ear" isn't my thing. Sennheiser makes high quality products.  This one is pretty good, but clearly not top shelf.  The sound quality is average.  As well, the "on the ear" style is apparently not my thing.  It kind of hurts my ears a bit.  I'd much rather have a set of "over the ear" headphones.
Two Stars. Bulky but sound quality is very good...then they quit working after a few months.

Sound great!. Sound great!
Revised - sound is good, but seems to have a lot of interference and is difficult to tune the frequency.

Major improvement in TV sound.. Really make a difference in listening to TV shows.  All the dialog is distinctly clear and the stereo sound is much better than even my surround sound system with very good speakers (Bose).  Sometimes when adjusting the volume, you can accidently move the Tuning control and lose all sound completely.  Just be careful.  The headphone stand is a little awkward and you have to be careful to make sure that the charging LED comes on or they are not being recharged.

Excellent reception - Good Fidelity - Good Value-Good at Spouse Blocking. Very good reception in multiple rooms and outside the house.  Good fidelity--better than a more expensive Sound Bar, for one person. Always recharges.  Side benefit is that you cannot hear you spouse and have a good visual excuse to not response to 1001 questions or whaver!

good but to loose a fit.. Ggreat sound but they keep slipping off my head, no way to adjust them for tightness. rang the company and they were no help with the problem. Maybe I need velcro on my ears.

Good product work as expected. Connected it today comes with long sound cord for me to connect from one side of my 71 tv to the other side audio out. did need to adjust the tune on speaker and on base due to static at first but once adjusted sound is good. More comfortable for the ears than the brookstone I purchased and returned.
Sound is good but it is hard to tune in and has .... Sound is good but it is hard to tune in and has almost 2 seconds lag when you watch TV.Don't buy. You can try bluetooth headphones.
Easy peasy!. Easy installation!  Works great!  Very good sound.

You get what you pay for. When I first received these I really liked them. The sound was good and the reception was great! I could walk outside my house and take the trash out in the alley and still listen to my music. Over time I noticed I was receiving more and more noise and interference... Then one day they just stopped working. I tried changing the batteries and reconnecting everything... It was dead and there was no reviving it.
Sounds quality average. Quality of sound is not very good. I guess you need to put more money if you want good sound. Bose wireless didn't exist yet when I bought this one.

The 80's called and they want their sound back.. How would I rate this? Not well. I'm not an audiophile, but I remember a my first Sony Walkman in the late 80's. Maybe it was 1988 maybe, 1989, but either way, when I put on these headphones, that what it took me back to. Not in a good way. My iPod EarPods sound better. Seriously. These are awful. Save you money.

Very good and comfortable. Very good and comfortable, wish the headset had separate volume controls for each ear, some hearing impaired people could adjust one ear over the other to balance sound since their may be an imbalance of sensitivity.

The sound quality is good enough, but I am using these with a .... The sound quality is good enough, but I am using these with a computer. If there is no sound playing for 3-5 minutes, the headphones disconnect and it blasts static through the headphones. This needs ti either be configurable of fixed.

they have good sound reproduction including good base response. I use these headphones with my electronic drums. they have good sound reproduction including good base response. they are light and comfortable. they have a little hiss when no sound is present. they are a good product for the price.
Good sound.  Comfortable fit.. Like the sound quality.  Ease of setup.

Perfect for families with a sleeping baby. Bought this to be able to watch TV in the evening after the baby goes to sleep.  Great quality and sound.  As good as having a theater quality surround sound system.  Comfortable to wear and very easy to hook up to the tv.

the sound is pretty good until the next time you use them. A little high maintenance to get the proper sound adjustment, i.e., to avoid static or sudden loud volume.  Once you get it set correctly, the sound is pretty good until the next time you use them.  All in all, however, I like them.
but sound quality is very good.. I wish the headphones fit a little tighter to the head, but sound quality is very good.

Sound quality is great and the product does exactly what it says it .... Sound quality is great and the product does exactly what it says it does.  Good directions and good value.  Sound quality is comparable to more expensive models.
Five Stars. Have two pair of these. Work without interference and have decent range.
Five Stars. These are excellent over the ear headphones. Wireless reception anywhere in house. Would definitely recommend to others.
Five Stars. I have 2 of them and they work great.
Five Stars. It works great, this is the second one I've purchased.  I intend to get another one in the future.
Five Stars. I have been very satisfied with the convenience of use and performance.
Five Stars. My wife listens to TV at night while I sleep.  She loves these!
Five Stars. Love it for watching movies on my computer.
Five Stars. Excelent product. I can listen in all rooms of the house
Five Stars. Works excellent. A step forward in sound quality from normal TV standadrd format.
Five Stars. Always great as expected.  Would order again.  Came in timely matter.
Five Stars. I have never been disappointed with a product from Sennheiser
Five Stars. great product and price. My wife loves them
Five Stars. Had doubts but this really works. Save money by buying one with minor scratches not problem really works
Five Stars. Keeps me from play my computer too loud.
Five Stars. great product as advertised had one like it for 10 years
Five Stars. work perfect for my mother in law that has hearing impairment....she loves them.
Four Stars. they have a tendency to just drop out after about 2 hours of use
Four Stars. item received as described and in a timely manner
Four Stars. Sound good easy install not quite the volume I expected .
Four Stars. Works great! I had to renew the batteries with fresh ones.
Four Stars. works good for tv. Would buy better quality for music
Four Stars. Works well sound quality isn't what Id expect from Sennheiser.
Four Stars. USE THEM A LOT AND THEY WORK GREAT
Four Stars. These are great for me with my hearing loss.
Four Stars. Work pretty good as wireless headphones for listening to the TV.  Sometimes get an echo.
Four Stars. Works but some interfeerance due to FM radio -
Four Stars. Good value but sometimes I wonder if I should have spent more and got a better headset
Four Stars. Good price and work almost perfectly - some popping noise but could be my computer.

Arrived on time and so far they are working far .... Arrived on time and so far they are working far.  They were a fift for an ederly fellow who is hard of hearing and these help his family get peace at night.

Got these for my mother to wear in the evening .... Got these for my mother to wear in the evening to watch TV - she recently developed a hearing problem and even with her hearing aids, TV dialogue is hard for her to make out.  With these, she hear everything!

RF Feedback Hissing is omnipresent. I got these for my dad because he tends to keep my mom up late at night while she tries to sleep with the TV blaring. Despite the fine tuning adjustment, here is quite a bit of RF feedback. He didn't notice because he was starting to get hard of hearing. I wouldn't buy it again.

I can hear clearly now with my  Sennheiser RS120 On-Ear Wireless RF Headphones.... We have purchased two of these headphones. I have a hard time hearing the television. With his headset I can hear clearly. I enjoy the excellent sound quality of the headphones. Great bass and stereo effect. My wife liked the product so much, I ordered her one too. The dog appreciates it when we mute the sound on the TV and just listen through the headsets! I would highly recommend this headphone set.

Life-changing!. "Life-changing" is not too strong a term for how I feel now that my hard-of-hearing hubs is wearing these! I work from home as a writer, and since hubs retired, the TV is on a LOT and it's LOUD. Thankfully hubs agreed to try these. He reports that he's actually able to hear the TV better than he ever has, and I have wonderful, blissful SILENCE.

I was afraid these might be difficult to install but no - easy and quick, with good video instructions. They were basically "plug and play".

Both him and his wife love the headset and according to them their marriage might .... Bought for my father, who is hard of hearing.  Both him and his wife love the headset and according to them their marriage might just last another 40 years because of this headset.

Helps Me. I am hard of hearing and this works great for me. My first one bit the dust so now I have two headphones that I alternate using! This means I have one for my sister when she comes as she is hard of hearing too!
it's the best option for those hard of hearing. Grandma complains of a lot of static. Even still, it's the best option for those hard of hearing.

I have a hard of hearing father who was always .... I have a hard of hearing father who was always asking us to turn the tv up to full blast. Ever since I got him these, he's been able to hear every word.

This was very easy to set up and works brilliantly. This was very easy to set up and works brilliantly.  My father-in-law is hard of hearing, and his wife wanted to be able to watch TV at a reasonable volume but still have him be able to hear it.  This solved the problem.  Very nice product.  I have other Sennheiser headphones that I use, and it seems that they make good products all the way around.
Got these for my husband and he just loves them .... Got these for my husband and he just loves them. He is hard of hearing so he doesn't have to have the TV blaring

Good product, great sound.. These actually worked really well.  The sound is great.  They work on the FM band, so there was occasional interference (a neighbor also has a set so initially we overlapped with him but changing the headphone "channel" worked fine).  All in all a good item.

Updated it from 4 to 5 stars.  The sound is So much better than th tv speaker ever was.

Worst of 3 sets I've owned. I've now owned 3 of these types of headphones for the TV. This one was so bad, we returned it within 30 days. The two Sony headphones both work great. Was really unimpressed with these. It has multiple 'channels' and tuner controls - that should tell you something right there. The others don't have tuner controls and don't need them - they  just work. For $10 more, our Sony wireless RF headphones are SOOO much better.

Augmentation for old ears.... Although I bought this set of headphones for my mother-in-law, I think that I will enjoy using it myself.  The sound quality is much better than that from my previous pair.
Sennheiser higher quality products are a better buy for your dollar. Too much static for me.  And a little heavy.  Not even using them now.  Otherwise good quality of the physical product.

Good sound - terrible design.. I both like and HATE these headphones. The sound is very good, the big problem is the darn things won't stay on my head. The very slightest movement or tilt of my head and they FALL OFF.  No matter how I adjust them, that is the one that slides  up and down but that doesn't allow any tightening. Had they made the cushions over the ear instead of on the ear they would fit much better.

My review of this purchase. These work great. Much better distance than what you can get with Bluetooth. I use these when I am outside working in the yard and want to listen to the sound coming from my computer.

Major improvement in TV sound.. Really make a difference in listening to TV shows.  All the dialog is distinctly clear and the stereo sound is much better than even my surround sound system with very good speakers (Bose).  Sometimes when adjusting the volume, you can accidently move the Tuning control and lose all sound completely.  Just be careful.  The headphone stand is a little awkward and you have to be careful to make sure that the charging LED comes on or they are not being recharged.
These work well for my 65 year old ears.. Not the best you can buy but a good value for the price. They help my old ears hear the dialog on TV much better.
Sit Still. Ok for watching TV but fall off my head when doing chores. They replaced my old Sonies and sound better and cost half as much.
Excellent headset. Replaced my Sony brand wireless set with these and found the sound so much better by far.

Trouble with fine tuning!. This was so disappointing. I brought this to replace a pair of old wireless headphone expecting this brand will be much better. After several weeks of use and trying to adjust it everywhich way, I still cannot tune it where it has a decent volume without the stastics. Would not recommend it.  If it requires an engineer to make it work, it should list so.

Nice Wireless Headset. Excellent Headset = my only problem is that the switch for honing in to TV sound gets moved if I lean my head back in my recliner = fixed that with a DOT Band-Aid = no problems since.

buy these, they are great. I don't know what some other reviewers were saying about problems getting these to work. I took it out of the box and plugged it in to charge. I connected to smart tv with RCA plugs, turned headphones on, and that was total install. No tv adjustments or anything. Sound quality is excellent. Headphones are comfortable but will slip if I look down. Definitely not too tight.

Excellent product, replacement for my older version that was .... Excellent product, replacement for my older version that was beginning to fade out. This headset is comfortable and the sound and range exceed my previous model.

Excellent! The connectivity is flawless and the sound. Excellent! The connectivity is flawless and the sound... well, it's a Sennheiser! so no need to say more there... I'm a professional musician and record producer... I own several Sennheiser products and I can honestly say they did not disappointed on this item. Just great!

Very comfortable. Easy to charge. Very comfortable. Easy to charge, just hang the headphones on the receiver/transmitter stand. Like most wireless phones I've tried/own these have a small amount of background noise (buzz), but it is not nearly as distracting as several other brands I own. Sound quality is excellent.

I can hear clearly now with my  Sennheiser RS120 On-Ear Wireless RF Headphones.... We have purchased two of these headphones. I have a hard time hearing the television. With his headset I can hear clearly. I enjoy the excellent sound quality of the headphones. Great bass and stereo effect. My wife liked the product so much, I ordered her one too. The dog appreciates it when we mute the sound on the TV and just listen through the headsets! I would highly recommend this headphone set.

Excellent reception - Good Fidelity - Good Value-Good at Spouse Blocking. Very good reception in multiple rooms and outside the house.  Good fidelity--better than a more expensive Sound Bar, for one person. Always recharges.  Side benefit is that you cannot hear you spouse and have a good visual excuse to not response to 1001 questions or whaver!

Excellent Sound Quality!. I have been really impressed with this wireless headphone set. They're extremely comfortable to wear. And the sound quality is about as close to perfect as a headset can get. The only downside to this headphone set is that it doesn't balance quite right on a person's head. If you hold your head still--no problem. But if you lean forward, you'll be grabbing the headset. The reason? Because they'll be falling off your head. Other than that, I love them and still give them a five-star rating.
Five Stars. Works excellent. A step forward in sound quality from normal TV standadrd format.

Excellent sound quality. Excellent sound quality. Unfortunately my TV doesn't have an analog audio output (only fiber optic) and I have to send them back.
If you have an audio output this is the headphone you need.

They are very light with excellent sound which is great. Had about a month. They are very light with excellent sound which is great. One of the few headsets that I have seen with both a volume and clarity control. Very easy to use.

battery life is excellent and works well. Bought 2 pair - one for the Den so I could blast ME out without blasting wife out and one for the bedroom after hours... battery life is excellent and works well, only drawback is not over the ear and sounds bleeds out to bother my wife after hours ...

Excellent sound quality, but one quirk.. Works great for my dad.  Excellent sound.  The main problem is that when the audio signal goes off for a bit, the headphones "disconnect" and go into a very loud static.  Really annoying and a terrible thing to "miss" when designing something this expensive.

Other than that, these headphones are very comfortable and work well.  My dad is happy.

Great headphones. I love these headphones, they have excellent sound.  I use them with my theatre setup.  Sometimes I forget I have them on, and i've also been able to take the dog in the backyard, and still hear my show.  I recommend them highly.  It's completely quiet in the house when my wife wants to sleep early.
Excellent headset. Replaced my Sony brand wireless set with these and found the sound so much better by far.

Good basic earphones. I have had this model for more than a year and I am generally happy with it. It is relatively easy to tune. I use it when watching TV late and night, so I can't speak as to how it handles music.  It seems to lose its form and doesn't fit right on the charger sometimes. So you will have reform it so it fits properly on the charger. One good thing is that the charger has a light so you can see when it is sitting properly in the cradle and charging.

And I like them because I don't have to listen to the .... My wife loves these. She uses them every time she is on the treadmill and watching TV. And I like them because I don't have to listen to the shows she watches when I'm watching a different channel on another TV.
Good for night TV watching. The sound quality is good, and they feel very comfortable. I can fall asleep on your back and wake up without  ear pain.
Great product.. I have been using two headphone bought couple of years back. They still work. Best headphone for tv watching.

Junk. Fall off  head easy... the left ear speaker no longer works after a few years of use. Never dropped. Never listened to anything loud. Had em connected to TV for watching after hrs. I'd put these in the trash if it didn't make me feel guilty.

Good headphones.. Bought this because I like watching movies on TV and wife likes to read.  She can't read when she overhears the audio from my shows.  So I gave in and bought this product.

Good sound.  Plenty of volume if needed (I use about 1/3 volume).  Enough treble to hear conversations.
Best headphones for watching TV. These headphones are wonderful and work great. We didn't like the ear pads though so we replaced them with the Nature Replacment Ear Pads and are much happier.
Sit Still. Ok for watching TV but fall off my head when doing chores. They replaced my old Sonies and sound better and cost half as much.

Work great when watching TV and not wanting to bother anyone else.. These work great when watching TV and not wanting to bother anyone else.  Headphones are a little firm and I would probably pay a little more to upgrade, but Im more than happy with its performance.
Good for watching TV and not disturbing anyone else.. I prefer the around the ear style, but these are okay.
Reasonable price for a good product.. I got these because I get complaints that I turn the volume too high while watching tv and the work so well I bought another set for the bedroom.

comments.comment:
Good for creation, BAD for music. comfortable, heavy cable. Mine had had an issue, but the product is good.

Don't buy for music, it WILL disappoint, it exaggerates mid/high. Not about clarity, it gets annoying fast.

For creation work, its light and comfortable

Wish I could change the cable. The one that comes with it is kind of heavy.

comments.comment: These Sony headphones are for real.. I have at least a dozen high-end headphones. These are up there with the best. They are closed back, so they are very punchy. I like that. Midrange sounds are well balanced, highs are crystal clear. Threes are well balanced cans. Worth every penny.

comments.comment:
Not comfortable for long time wearing. Pros:
 1) The headphone is clear and precious with sound reproduction.
 2) folderable and with a pouch for storage and protection.

Cons:
1) the cover for over ear is too shallow , the inside facet is pressed on the the ear. Not comfortable for long time wearing.
 2) looks fragile.

comments.comment: good, not great. good headphones, not great.  frequency response is really good but not impressed with this model.  will keep for talent use but will not use for myself.

comments.comment: Poor quality. I have this headphone for a little more than two years and even though I've been taking care of it, the right channel is gone. I wished that this was more durable, but I guess it was made like that. That's why I gave three stars.

comments.comment: you'll blow the integrity and have to replace them like I did. Very reliable and compact for pro audio use. But if you blast tone into them, you'll blow the integrity and have to replace them like I did. Use an already bad pair when testing since this can't handle larger dB's.

comments.comment: Fit and finish isn't top notch, but very good.. Really nice headphones, but the fit and finish isn't as nice as the MDR7505 versions that they are replacing. Still work great though and sound very good.

comments.comment: Pretty Good for mixing audio. Pretty Good for mixing audio. It feels like it is missing a some high end range sounds though but that could be because I only used the smaller headphone Jack. Durable even thought the cushion pops off once in a while. I would recommend!

comments.comment: Great for a week. These headphones were great, but after a week of light use the right side went out. The overall build quality was ok so maby i was just unlucky.

comments.discussion_name: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

comments.comment: Well balanced. These really do sound very good. They sound balanced and are comfortable to wear.  Look they are not the best headphones out there at any price like some claim, but they really do sound very, very good, and they are are bargain for what you are getting.  If you like the big artificial bass, these may not be for you. These have natural sounding bass. Of course you can always pump up the tone on your receiver to accentuate the bass. IMHO, you really can not go wrong with these.
comments.related_to: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone
comments.discussion_name: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

comments.comment: Great Reference Headphones. After using these for a few months now, they sound great and have been holding up very well.  I love the sound quality from these headphones as there is really no processing going on within the device.  You are going to hear the material you are listening to as it was meant to be heard.  No extra bass or sound processing.  These are the industry standard for a reason!
comments.related_to: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone
comments.discussion_name: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

comments.comment:
Awesome sound o/p. Awesome sound o/p.
Long cord.
Good packaging.
Nice design, folds up easier to carry around.
But as a lot of people already suggested, not that comfortable when worn for longer periods
I can't wear these more than 1/2 hr, ears heat up a lot.
comments.related_to: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

comments.comment:
Ex-Bose Customer. In my opinion, for consumer usage, the Bose QC15 sound better. The sound is rounder, but they are also three times more expensive.

The extremely flat and balanced response from the 7606 was a surprise and took a while to get used too. I can definitely see the appeal for sound engineers where flatness is king, but for a consumer its nice to have some of the kinks ironed out.

Still, I'm never going back to Bose. The cans provide enough sound canceling, there are no batteries, and the sound quality is excellent.

Sound quality is excellent...I'm not an audiophile, and my hearing isn't good enough to pick up subtle differences between sounds quality and other more expensive headsets (was a Bose owner until I left the dang things on a plane)... These do just fine...I use them for playing guitar...listening to music...watching TV occasionally...no complaints. Well made and fold up into a nice compact form factor for travelling. There are lighter phones out there, but these feel good on the head for over an hour, in my experience.

comments.comment:
best in class. Those complaining about weak bass and high end with these should realize Sony designed these for voice work.  They are used by field engineers and studio engineers when working on film and videos.  Being tuned to voice range, portable design, and excellent isolation make them a favorite for field audio pickup.

I've been using them for three years and they are a workhorse set.

Highly recommended.

comments.comment:
Way better than anything else in this price range. I love these headphones. They are so much better than the Beats crap and other trendy brands people go so crazy over.

The frequency response is flat and accurate, so you get what you are supposed to without any overly exaggerated frequencies, The bass is solid and accurate without being overpowering, The mids are clear and the highs are clean.

ngram_comments: and they are light and comfortable. But I was less than impressed with the .... Decent quality of sound, and they are light and comfortable. But I was less than impressed with the reduction of external noise provided.

Great Reference Headphones. After using these for a few months now, they sound great and have been holding up very well.  I love the sound quality from these headphones as there is really no processing going on within the device.  You are going to hear the material you are listening to as it was meant to be heard.  No extra bass or sound processing.  These are the industry standard for a reason!
Four Stars. Like them very much. Wonderful sound quality and fairly priced. Not the most comfortable though.

Very Happy Except for the Price. An excellent product that makes music sound great and lets you hear things that you may have never heard before without the use of a high-quality headphone. Just drop the price by about $30 and then I'll rate it as a 5-star product.

Right Ear went Dead. I loved these headphones. Great noise cancellation, amazing quality sound, good design. Obviously the product reviews speak for themselves.

I owned them for a few years but used them only occasionally as these were a luxury buy. Few times a month for video or sound editing, couple of flights..... I hadn't used them for a long time and one day I plugged them in and the right side was dead.

These were great headphones but damn....don't think it's worth it to buy them a second time around.

Ex-Bose Customer. In my opinion, for consumer usage, the Bose QC15 sound better. The sound is rounder, but they are also three times more expensive.

The extremely flat and balanced response from the 7606 was a surprise and took a while to get used too. I can definitely see the appeal for sound engineers where flatness is king, but for a consumer its nice to have some of the kinks ironed out.

Still, I'm never going back to Bose. The cans provide enough sound canceling, there are no batteries, and the sound quality is excellent.
Four Stars. Excellent sound quality, but the bass is weak for my liking.

good sound for the price which is why I'm using .... It's definitely a step down in sound quality compared to my Ultrasone Hfi-780.  Overall though, good sound for the price which is why I'm using this for my DJing gigs (leaving my Ultrasone at home). :)

Great Sound, Mediocre Quality and Comfort. These headphones sound very good. Amazing, even. They have a nice, long coiled cord. I just expected a better build quality from Sony. They seemed cheap. They were not as comfortable as I had hoped. I already own a pair of Sony on-ear portables with active noise cancellation. These were to be for home use. I give them high marks for sound, but the comfort and quality did not meet my expectations.

Fantastic sound. Short and simple: I love these headphones. The only problem I have is that the coiled cord beings to uncurl and knot up in some places (after a few times on rolling in back up). The pads have started to flake a bit too. Amazing sound quality nonetheless. Perfect for audio mixing and editing.

Extraordinary value for money!. I was recommended these by a headphone enthusiast who uses headphones costing over a thousand dollars and they do not disappoint! Big, beautiful sound, Sony quality, and light & comfortable. I can't believe Sony charges so little for these great 'phones.
Reliable quality and very good sound. Great buy for the price. Second pair I've owned. Reliable quality and very good sound. Great buy for the price!
... little too big for my head (and I feel like my head is big). A little too big for my head (and I feel like my head is big), but perfect quality physically and soundwise.
Great sound & reasonable price. Great sound and built quality, highly recommended! It's a little big for portable use, for home use is perfect. A must buy!

The bass is a little weak.. The sound quality isn't breathtaking, but they cancel sound quite well, and they look nice. I definitely don't regret the purchase. Sometimes the sound feels a little tinny, lacking the bass I love so much; but that's really my only complaint.

No sound adjustment capability, no mic. These headphones aren't for everyday listening.  The quality was excellent, but lack of basic music control features on the wire was very frustrating (reaching into pocket to stop music or make it louder is not acceptable for users these days.  But they are called Professional, so I am sure the intended user anticipates it.

Quality has dropped?. Sound is not loud enough for proper DJaying.
A year later, the leather earcups are all frayed and tattered.

Great Value - Great sound. This is the second pair of these I have purchased.  They are the best "inexpensive" phones out there.  The sound is extremely accurate and high quality.
You can wear them all day and not feel any pain.  I wear glasses, and needed to find ear phones that would not hurt after an hour or so.  These phones do not squeeze so hard that they crush your eyeglasses into your head.  Great comfort.

Comfortable. Sounds great. High quality headphone. Sounds great.  Only be better if it was cordless.  The heavy cumbersome coiled cord cannot be detached, and it is quite heavy & bothersome.  I would have preferred a detachable cord so I could replace it with shorter/lighter cord.
This head set is a perfect match of quality. This head set is a perfect match of quality, price and usability, providing excellent sound quality and wearing comfort for the user.
excellent headphones!. Beautiful sound and well made.  Very comfortable also.  Thanks for making a great quality product!  This is my second pair, as the first ones were stolen.

Great comfortable headphones.. We have a few of them, I find them very comfortable, they don't press hard on your ears, and the sound quality is really good. primarily using them in the recording studio, keeps outer sounds out while sound is on but if there is no sound on you can still hear the background a little.
Nice. Nice sound quality, comfortable over the ears and the long cord is perfect for gamers who can't sit still

Love it, sounds great!. These are working great for us mixing our church services. We don't push the performance limits of headphones but if you need some quality built headphones that sound great, these are the ones!

The sound quality is good. The ability to block outside noise is marginal .... I've had these for about a year. The sound quality is good. The ability to block outside noise is marginal at best. The ear cup "faux leather" skins have already torn, which has no effect on utility, but with the foam exposed, I'm sure they will degrade quickly from now. I have new "knock off" pads on order: The Sony replacements are quite expensive, particularly considering their short life.

Very Pleased with These Headphones. Bought these Sony MDR7506 headphone as a result of amazon.com customer reviews.  Was very pleased with the sound quality and the price was great.  They fully met my expectations.

Best headphones for the price. Sound is amazing on these headphones. Very clear, very analytical sound. Cannot find headphones with equal sound quality for the same price. Mine broke after a couple years, but I bought another as the other brands could not compete. Only thing is they are closed ear, and can hurt your ears if wearing glasses and wearing the headphones for long periods. But I bought these for the sound quality.

Overall thumbs up. pros:
1) very comfortable
2) great sound quality
3) Seems very well made (but time will tell)

cons:
1) placement of the cable (left versus right ear) is not reversible
2) sound isolation isn't that great.  I'm guessing it's only 6-10db.
GREAT Sound & Quality. Professional sound mixer here and LOVE these headphones. Durable, reliable and overall great fit for many different environments.
High Quality. Wow, great sound and great fidelity for a very reasonable price

GREAT SOUND AT A GOOD PRICE. I bought this on the recommendation of a friend who is into high fidelity on a grand scale. The ear pads are comfortable and the sound quality if unbelievable. I love mine.
