I sent them back.

Hear it all.. I can hear!

Purchased this for audio/video editing, voice communication, and streaming.  It's used by the pros, it's cheaper than the popular junk, and they get the job done.

I can hear things in songs, games, and voice chat that I never heard before. Excellent quality -- both build and sound production.
Best Quality and Value for the cost. Excellent sound, great build, comfy fit, lightweight - crisp highs, deep bass, smooth midrange - overall a fantastic set of cans

Sturdy, sound quality is not bad. Been using them for many years and plan to for a few more.

Pros: Sturdy, sound quality is not bad, cord length is a big plus.
Cons: When you just buy them, for a few weeks the ear pads (or whatever they are called) can feel stiff/uncomfortable. Don't worry, they will become softer as you use them more.
Bigger con - the cheap material (black film) on the ear pads eventually starts to shed in small bits.

Comfortable and Good Sound Quality. I used to own a pair of Sony headphones many years ago and kept it for years. Since then I've tried so many headphones. I found Sony is still the best for me. Sound quality is good for practice and rehearsals. I can wear them for hours without feeling any discomfort. Chord length is perfect -- no extension needed.

Could Be More Comfortable On The Ears. Excellent headphones but I think it may be possible to make the headphones more comfortable on the ears; They do not feel soft on the ears; They feel hard/firm; Maybe use memory foam.  Sound quality seems fine.  I use these for music recording, listening, and for listening to binaural beats when astral projecting (having out of body experiences).

I heard these were like professional quality but i found them to be way .... I heard these were like professional quality but i found them to be way less then that. I got a 20 dollar set of Behringer headphones that sound much better. These have a tinny sound to them, as well as when listening with them, i hear what sounds like an old 33 1/3 record scraping sound through them.  I do like the heavy duty cord but thats not worth a thing if the sound quality is jacked.

Excellent!!!. Got a pair of these for my sound booth in my home studio.  Everyone who uses them, whether for vocal recording or percussion loves these headphones!  Some musicians actually have brought their own MDR7506's to record and when they realize I already have a pair in the booth they are glad to see I know quality.  I'm glad Sony is still making these!

I feel very comfortable while wearing this headphones. I feel very comfortable while wearing this headphones.  The sounds quality is very good.  I would recommend it for home use.  I like this so much, I bought the second one for my brother.

Bad ergonomics. Audio quality is fine.  However, the cans are too shallow and after 20 minutes of use my ears really hurt.  Further, the foam material makes crinkly sounds against my ears if I move my head.  Very distracting.

Overall, these are not usable.

Good sound but not comfortable.. Got this to monitor my recordings.

For sound quality, it's a good buy for this price. Very balance sound with correct high and low frequencies.

But is very uncomfortable. I can't keep this for more than 5 minutes on my head.

Disappointed with Quality. Always been a Sony fan but have to admit I'm very disappointed with these. Sound was decent while they lasted but left channel just quit working right in the middle of mixing down a recording. Bought a pair of Sennheiser HD 280 pros that are my go to head phones now. Sorry Sony, but you let me down.
Sony quality. These are decent headphones. When I used to listen to the headphones at the store they sounded clearer than these but overal I don't regret the purchase.
Worked very well.. Awesome sound quality.  Deep Lows and great mid tones. The Highs were very good too!  I like them enough that I would  recommend these headphones to purchase.

Another Quality SONY product. I owned a similar set of headphones since 1982 and they were always great sounding (MDR-V600). They finally broke when one of the plastic hinges went bad. After 31 years I'd say that I hope getting 1/2 that time would be great. They certainly have the sonic quality you'd expect from this type of headphone (MDR7506).
Good quality, rich-sounding. I really like these headphones- the sound is fantastic and the build quality is very good.  I really like how they fold up into a more compact size- nice design!
Not bad. For the price you are getting good quality sound. Proper base but mids and highs can be a little too much from time to time. Honestly it a get what you pay for situation.

too tight for larger heads. it was a bit tight, could have been more flexible. as you see in the image it comes together, it wants to do that to my face too. wire was really long. wouldnt't recommend for medium-large heads for long use. sound quality was good
Great headphones at a bargain price. Great headphones at a bargain price. These are comfortable to wear for long periods, and they delivery clear, high-quality sound.

Stunning. I was simply amazed by the overall quality, sound dynamics, and the accuracy of the bass and treble response of these headphones.  I consider myself a picky audiophile and hence have very high standards when it comes to audio equipment.  Dollar for dollar these headphones are probably the best purchase I have made in over 30 years.  You can almost "see into the music", the sound is that clear.  And comfort is excellent as well.  I've worn these for hours with absolutely no fatigue or discomfort.  These phones richly deserve an A+ rating.
Not Recommended!. Not recommended.  Sound quality is sub standard

Highest quality headphones at a reasonable price.. For the price these are probably the best headphones I've ever had. Sony is good at providing quality headphones without charging you hundreds of dollars. They don't have the sound of a pair of Beats, but they're close and you won't freak out if you drop them because they don't cost a whole paycheck. My only problem with them is that they crush my ears and it hurts to keep them on for extended periods of time. And I don't have particularly big ears.

great value, great sound, great product. For this price you can't beat 'em.
Sound quality is excellent...I'm not an audiophile, and my hearing isn't good enough to pick up subtle differences between sounds quality and other more expensive headsets (was a Bose owner until I left the dang things on a plane)... These do just fine...I use them for playing guitar...listening to music...watching TV occasionally...no complaints. Well made and fold up into a nice compact form factor for travelling. There are lighter phones out there, but these feel good on the head for over an hour, in my experience.

exaggerated frequency response curve. After reading so many reviews I decided to get a set. To be honest, I'm disappointed. The mechanical design and construction are excellent. These are obviously quality headphones. I just don't care for the frequency response. I am used to the AKG K240 series which has a very smooth, flat frequency response. The highs and mid-lows on the Sonys sound very exaggerated to my ears. Maybe OK for listening to some types of music but not what I want for mixing or critical listening,

Best headphone on the market. One of the best headphones I've ever had. Truly professional, Don't even need to turn on any noise cancelling button. Once in, it blocks everything and the sound quality is just... pure. Can't even talk about the price, can't compare it to overprice you know what; and every (literally EVERY) part of that headphone is changeable if something happens to it. I highly recommend it, it's worth every dollar and a good investment.
its also not very comfortable. decent quality sound, but it keeps turning itself in all the time which makes it cumbersome to have in the ears. its also not very comfortable

but they are perfect for home listening and recording and have satisfied my .... My boyfriend bought these headphones for home recording, to use on his Nord keyboard so he doesn't wake the baby, and for listening to vinyl in bed. The sound quality is clear to the point that they pick up on way more of the scratches and dust bumps on a record than our speakers do. The tones are rich and reflect the price point - they're not $300 headphones, but they are perfect for home listening and recording and have satisfied my audiophile musician boyfriend.

Sound quality is so much better than the earbuds that I've been using. Sound quality is so much better than the earbuds that I've been using.  They are comfortable and fold in a convenient way for storage.  I use this model for both listening to digital music and electric guitar patched through an effects processor.  Sony is still a brand that I can trust.

SOLID! I love these.... These are some of my favorite headphones... They sound great and aren't bass heavy like many others are. They run a little hotter than many other headphones I have like my AKG's. Great quality at a great  price. These work better than many other headphones costing significantly more.

good sound, gives music clear definition, very pleased. Enjoying these very much.  Made me appreciate music all over again.  Would love to get this soundstage and quality on long lasting blue tooth.  All things considered very reasonably priced.  Lightweight and comfortable. Ear cups almost flat enough to sleep with ear against the pillow. Ear cups somewhat flip-floppy which leads you to wonder if they are durable enough.  But, so far these provide the best listening experience in the house.
Four Stars. Excelent sound quality, not as comfortable as Sennheiser hd 518 , and small for my ears

Great sound quality. The sound quality is great, and is exactly what I wanted to connect to my computer; did not want the additional steps of pairing and charging wireless/Bluetooth headphones. Wow. I've had many sets of higher-priced ($250+)headphones over the years, but none compare to these.  The build quality, comfort, and sound quality (especially the fast bass) of these really shine.

Good- but HYPED. These headphones have fantastic build-quality and REALLY clear sound! Sadly, the highs are actually almost LOUD and the bass is just too pronounced. They'd definitely be useful for closed-back vocal monitoring, but I can't say I'd recommend these for mixing.

Excellent headphones. Virtually identical with the MDRV6 I have used for about 15 years before the cord insulation

I'm sorry Sony about this product is really bad it sounds terrible absolutely has no sound pretty low .... I'm sorry Sony about this product is really bad it sounds terrible absolutely has no sound pretty low quality I don't  know who rated for this 5-star but somebody is deaf . :)

Not great. Very low volume intake and sound reproduction was .... Not great. Very low volume intake and sound reproduction was about what I would expect for the money maybe a little less.

Great with all genres of music. If ya like EDM, you will love these when the base drops.

Great sound. Could use more padding.. They sound great. No complaints on the sound. The headband could be a bit softer, though. When I use them I put a little piece of foam I cut between the pad and my head.

I want to love these headphones but they have 2 glaring downsides. These headphones sound great. A little bright, and lacking slightly in bass (however, the detailed bass makes up for it a bit at loud volumes).

Best Headphones Of All Time.. Best headphones ever made as far as I can tell.  Sure, they don't have a giant hip logo on the side, but for me they feel pleasantly retro and have great sound.

Very good. Very good sound. very reliable, durable. sliiightly old fashioned design and if you waer for long time your ears may get wet, but overall it is great product.

Extraordinary value for money!. I was recommended these by a headphone enthusiast who uses headphones costing over a thousand dollars and they do not disappoint! Big, beautiful sound, Sony quality, and light & comfortable. I can't believe Sony charges so little for these great 'phones.
Reliable quality and very good sound. Great buy for the price. Second pair I've owned. Reliable quality and very good sound. Great buy for the price!
These sound very good. A great addition to my studio. These sound very good.  A great addition to my studio.
Great sound & reasonable price. Great sound and built quality, highly recommended! It's a little big for portable use, for home use is perfect. A must buy!

The sound on these is great. I bought them to use with my phone. The sound on these is great. I bought them to use with my phone, and the cord is unfortunately too heavy and unwieldy for comfortable walking use.

sound great. Got for my wife her only complaint is the cord not being straight, but she must like them because she always has them on

Well balanced. These really do sound very good. They sound balanced and are comfortable to wear. The tones are rich and reflect the price point - they're not $300 headphones, but they are perfect for home listening and recording and have satisfied my audiophile musician boyfriend.

Very Happy Except for the Price. An excellent product that makes music sound great and lets you hear things that you may have never heard before without the use of a high-quality headphone. Just drop the price by about $30 and then I'll rate it as a 5-star product.

Great Sound, Mediocre Quality and Comfort. These headphones sound very good. Amazing, even. They have a nice, long coiled cord. I just expected a better build quality from Sony. They seemed cheap. They were not as comfortable as I had hoped. I already own a pair of Sony on-ear portables with active noise cancellation. These were to be for home use. I give them high marks for sound, but the comfort and quality did not meet my expectations.
Great sound & reasonable price. Great sound and built quality, highly recommended! It's a little big for portable use, for home use is perfect. A must buy!

Great Value - Great sound. This is the second pair of these I have purchased.  They are the best "inexpensive" phones out there.  The sound is extremely accurate and high quality.
You can wear them all day and not feel any pain.  I wear glasses, and needed to find ear phones that would not hurt after an hour or so.  These phones do not squeeze so hard that they crush your eyeglasses into your head.  Great comfort.

Comfortable. Sounds great. High quality headphone. Sounds great.  Only be better if it was cordless.  The heavy cumbersome coiled cord cannot be detached, and it is quite heavy & bothersome.  I would have preferred a detachable cord so I could replace it with shorter/lighter cord.
High Quality. Wow, great sound and great fidelity for a very reasonable price

GREAT SOUND AT A GOOD PRICE. I bought this on the recommendation of a friend who is into high fidelity on a grand scale. The ear pads are comfortable and the sound quality if unbelievable. I love mine.
Best Quality and Value for the cost. Excellent sound, great build, comfy fit, lightweight - crisp highs, deep bass, smooth midrange - overall a fantastic set of cans

Good sound but not comfortable.. Got this to monitor my recordings.

For sound quality, it's a good buy for this price. Very balance sound with correct high and low frequencies.

But is very uncomfortable. I can't keep this for more than 5 minutes on my head.
Worked very well.. Awesome sound quality.  Deep Lows and great mid tones. The Highs were very good too!  I like them enough that I would  recommend these headphones to purchase.
As advertised but no volume control. These are high quality headphones but they don't have a volume control so just be aware that you are subject to the outputs volume

High-Quality At an Affordable Price. These are a great set of affordable high-quality over the ear headphones. Very comfortable and reliable, also come with a 3.5mm adapter. Although not a negative, I don't care too much for the cord with these headphones. It's too long and gets "jumbled-up" a lot of the time. Would have also been nice if the cord could be replaced/swapped. However, these to preferences of mine don't negate the performance and quality of these headphones. A good buy!
Not bad. For the price you are getting good quality sound. Proper base but mids and highs can be a little too much from time to time. Honestly it a get what you pay for situation.
Great headphones at a bargain price. Great headphones at a bargain price. These are comfortable to wear for long periods, and they delivery clear, high-quality sound.

Stunning. I was simply amazed by the overall quality, sound dynamics, and the accuracy of the bass and treble response of these headphones.  I consider myself a picky audiophile and hence have very high standards when it comes to audio equipment.  Dollar for dollar these headphones are probably the best purchase I have made in over 30 years.  You can almost "see into the music", the sound is that clear.  And comfort is excellent as well.  I've worn these for hours with absolutely no fatigue or discomfort.  These phones richly deserve an A+ rating.

Highest quality headphones at a reasonable price.. For the price these are probably the best headphones I've ever had. Sony is good at providing quality headphones without charging you hundreds of dollars. They don't have the sound of a pair of Beats, but they're close and you won't freak out if you drop them because they don't cost a whole paycheck. My only problem with them is that they crush my ears and it hurts to keep them on for extended periods of time. And I don't have particularly big ears.

exaggerated frequency response curve. After reading so many reviews I decided to get a set. To be honest, I'm disappointed. The mechanical design and construction are excellent. These are obviously quality headphones. I just don't care for the frequency response. I am used to the AKG K240 series which has a very smooth, flat frequency response. The highs and mid-lows on the Sonys sound very exaggerated to my ears. Maybe OK for listening to some types of music but not what I want for mixing or critical listening,

Best headphone on the market. One of the best headphones I've ever had. Truly professional, Don't even need to turn on any noise cancelling button. Once in, it blocks everything and the sound quality is just... pure. Can't even talk about the price, can't compare it to overprice you know what; and every (literally EVERY) part of that headphone is changeable if something happens to it. I highly recommend it, it's worth every dollar and a good investment.
Wow. I've had many sets of higher-priced ($250+)headphones over the years, but none compare to these.  The build quality, comfort, and sound quality (especially the fast bass) of these really shine.

Good- but HYPED. These headphones have fantastic build-quality and REALLY clear sound! Sadly, the highs are actually almost LOUD and the bass is just too pronounced. They'd definitely be useful for closed-back vocal monitoring, but I can't say I'd recommend these for mixing.
Take a look at the Koss UR55 for that task.

Excellent headphones. Virtually identical with the MDRV6 I have used for about 15 years before the cord insulation
failed, the 7506 seems to be a bit sturdier then the V6 with equally high quality sound.
Arrived promptly in the usual SONY nice package. The bag included is very useful for
storing either these phones or an iPod with earbuds for travel.
A bargain compared to very high priced Sennheiser phones I have owned for little
difference in sound.

Five Stars. It was so nice I bought a pair for my wife
She loves them too
Five Stars. BEST QUALITY USED BY THE PROS, SKIP THE 2000% MARK UP FOR DR DRE.
Five Stars. Just perfect. Accurate and shut out all external distractions in a noisy office.
Five Stars. These headphones are the best bang for your buck on planet earth. Great sound stage, good bassline.
Five Stars. terrific sound only complain is the cable could unhook
Five Stars. Great headphone, I could use  little more of higher frequencies, love the extra long cable, very comfortable
Five Stars. Excellent Sounds, I use them during FPS gaming.
Five Stars. The perfect headphones. Low impedance, great feel, amazing price.
good, not great. good headphones, not great.  frequency response is really good but not impressed with this model.  will keep for talent use but will not use for myself.

Great for mastering your music!. I love the flat and true frequency response I get in the Studio with these headphones.  Great when I got to do lots of work late at night in my home studio and making sure the mastering is as good as the music I'm working with.

The headphones you need.. If you are on the fence about these, then stop here. I have had many pairs of studio headphones now including AudioTechnica's. These are amazing. The frequency response won't leave you needing any more. 10/10

exaggerated frequency response curve. After reading so many reviews I decided to get a set. To be honest, I'm disappointed. The mechanical design and construction are excellent. These are obviously quality headphones. I just don't care for the frequency response. I am used to the AKG K240 series which has a very smooth, flat frequency response. The highs and mid-lows on the Sonys sound very exaggerated to my ears. Maybe OK for listening to some types of music but not what I want for mixing or critical listening,

Way better than anything else in this price range. I love these headphones. They are so much better than the Beats crap and other trendy brands people go so crazy over.

Whether you are using them plugged into your mixing console for live sound/recording or you just plug them into your phone, the sound is fantastic. The frequency response is flat and accurate, so you get what you are supposed to without any overly exaggerated frequencies, The bass is solid and accurate without being overpowering, The mids are clear and the highs are clean.

comments.comment: Amazing sound and clarity!. I bought these as a gift to go with my huaband's kindle. The sound is absolutely amazing; I am definitely going to have to grab a pair of these for myself to use on the computer!!

comments.comment: Great value. I have both the HD202 and the momentum($220) headphones from sennheiser, and except for a 200 dollar price difference there is no noticeable loss in sound quality. I read about this unit in several online magazines and they are always listed as one of the best units for under 50$.

comments.comment: Fine for the purpose. I got these for my teenaged kids, who leave a trail of mangled earbuds behind them. comments.comment: So near and yet so wtf were they thinking?. While the anticipated sound quality is as was anticipated/expected for a Sennheiser, the plastic over-head strap is WAY TOO TIGHT for my average-sized head. This headphone would probably be just fine for a nine-year-old's smaller skull, but for the average adult it is fiercely uncomfortable to wear for any length of time. I am literally astonished at Sennheiser for having released this product into the world with its egregious ear-to-ear clamping headband.

sound good.

comments.comment: Durable, lasting, affordable, comfortable. I've had these headphones for quite a few (at least 5) years now, and they're still going strong. If you're looking for over-ear, noise-cancelling headphones that are affordable, you can't go wrong with these.  I've used them for both drumming and gaming and still switch them on and off between the two.

These headphones feel tight on my head upon opening the item, but when I adjust them,  it's like wearing a cloud.  The sound on my music is very clear and the bass and acoustics are so much better than what I expected.  My music lists ranges from house music like Ferry Corsten to metal bands like Korn, Otep,  and Nightwish. These headphones are not hype,  especially for this price.

comments.comment:
BUILT-IN OBSOLESCENCE. The headphones worked alright for a year, though the sound level was not as powerful as I expected, and the mechanism for winding the long wire was cheap and inconvenient.

The biggest puzzle is that the headphones stopped working one year after purchase.  I inspected the wire and found no tear on it.  Just stopped.  Makes you wonder if this isn't a built-in obsolescence.  In any case, I will shop for a different brand now, so they may well have helped their competitor unintentionally.

comments.comment:
Recommended for everyone but me. They seem well enough made, they work fine, and they're a bargain.  I recommend them for almost anyone who isn't me.

"Huh?", I hear you cry.

I have an unusually large head -- buying hats is a challenge.  These headphones were tight enough on me that they were painful after 10 seconds or so.  It was weird -- I felt the pain in my jaw.  I'm passing them on to my kid, and have ordered different headphones for myself.  But, most people should have no issue.

Seriously, these are a great value at $40. At $20 (today's price), assuming they bear any resemblance to the old models, they are a ridiculous value.

comments.comment:
Love. Amazing headphones for an amazing price.

I am always looking for good studio headphones with little to no boost and keep coming back to these.
They offer high quality sound, that doesn't clip or distort. The extra long cord is dourable, and is great for studio use.
My only complaint is that they are a little bit too small to be completely 'around ear' phones for me and partially rest against my ears. Not a problem for short use of up to 3 hours, but prolonged use can result in ear aches.

100% would recommend,  and plan on buying more.

comments.comment: Can't recommend. Wires break.. We've seen the wire break right where it enters the ear cup on three different headphones from three different users. The strain relief is simply inadequate even with careful handling, which itself is a pain on something you are constantly moving around. I would give one star except for the price and vety sound quality (no surprise, weaker on bass). Mine only work after a year thanks to a soldering repair. It's a shame: two pennies' worth of rubber strain relief would fix the problem. I have liked Sennheiser for many years and am disappointed.

comments.comment:

ngram_comments: Great value. I have both the HD202 and the momentum($220) headphones from sennheiser, and except for a 200 dollar price difference there is no noticeable loss in sound quality. I have also owned $200 Sony noise canceling headphone and JBL ones for 130$. These have great sound quality. I use them for music and gaming, and was blown away with the value of this purchase. I read about this unit in several online magazines and they are always listed as one of the best units for under 50$.

Puzzled by high rating, these are mediocre.. Sound is ok if playing games; music sounds hollow and lacks punch. My normal sized ears barely fit, a big-eared fellow or lady would not like these at all. Pay more for better headphones if you care at all about sound quality, learned the hard way.

Good for listening to movies on a plane.. I used these on a plane. They are comfortable.  The sound quality is pretty straightforward.  It's clear with normal highs and lows. Great for listening to movies.

Great sound quality but they pinch my ears. I have a fairly small head and these phones pinch my right ear. I tried moving them and loosening the cord and they still hurt. Sound quality is great so I will keep fiddling with them.

So near and yet so wtf were they thinking?. While the anticipated sound quality is as was anticipated/expected for a Sennheiser, the plastic over-head strap is WAY TOO TIGHT for my average-sized head. This headphone would probably be just fine for a nine-year-old's smaller skull, but for the average adult it is fiercely uncomfortable to wear for any length of time. I am literally astonished at Sennheiser for having released this product into the world with its egregious ear-to-ear clamping headband.

They cancel most outside noise out and they offer superior sound quality. I use these for my computer everyday and could not believe how well they work for the price.  They cancel most outside noise out and they offer superior sound quality.  I would definitely buy again.

Comfortable and Good Sound Quality. This headphone comes with a mini-plug (3.5mm) at the end of the cable and a mini-jack to 1/4" plug adapter for use with full sized phone jacks.

Fidelity is pretty good, although not excellent, but then you're not spending $100+ for these.

Comfort is reasonable with the cups fitting around my ears and being adjustable enough to fit my off-center ears.

We primarily use these for our digital pianos for silent practice at night.
but the sound quality is very good.. A little bit clunky, but the sound quality is very good.
Four Stars. Good product! Still functional and sound quality is still good after 6 months of use.

Durable as hell. I just bought a new nicer pair of Sony headphones but this pair of Sennheiser HD 202s lasted me 4 years! Amazing quality for the price. Some of the leather wore off but this was with 4 years of heavy use. The quality of the sound never faltered. Highly recommend for beginners or people that want cheaper headphones.
Just ok.. I have been using them for a few months now. Sound quality is not too good and it's not comfortable to wear for long periods of time.

Decent quality sound but uncomfortable to wear and they fall apart easily. Decent quality sound but uncomfortable to wear and they fall apart easily.  The cups fall off the headband.  The cord is way too long and even though it comes with a cord wrap its still too long for personal use.  The headband itself is tight and the cups have too little padding for any kind of extended wear.  They are also bulky and difficult to travel with.

True High Quality Headphones!. Another great Sennheiser product! These headphones provide outstanding sound quality at a very cheap price. Don't waste your money with overpriced headphones like Beats, these are true high quality headphones that are used by DJ's and sound engineers all around the world!
Love these. The sound quality with these headphones is terrific for my needs.  I'm very pleased with the quality.  Great value for the price!
Four Stars. Good sound quality, feels kinda cheap. Good travel headphones you wouldn't mind loosing.
The sound quality is fine but they eventually hurt my head after about an .... The sound quality is fine but they eventually hurt my head after about an hour of listening. Your results may vary.

Good sound, less comfort. I purchased the Sennheiser HD202 headphones from Amazon. I am not an audiophile so I won't judge sound quality which  was fine for me. I returned the Headphones because the ear pieces are intended to fit on, rather than over the ear. After about a half hour, the discomforting pressure on my ears was all I could endure no matter the TV program content.
Nice but big. I really like them but the cord is too long and they are big.  Sound quality is pretty good and worth keeping.  But cordless is the way to go.

This is definitely competition for the beats headphones.. This is definitely competition for the beats headphones. I compared the sound quality, and I could not beleive how defined the deep bass is along with the exceptional quality. I dare you to purchase these.
Four Stars. Good quality of sound and very nice isolation. For the price, it can't be beaten.
good sound quality for the price. these sound pretty good for being so cheap. the way the cups sit on the edges of my ear irritate them and i cant wear them for extended periods however.

Good but.... Not for noise isolation.  I ended getting the bose iq for that.  This one I just use on the computer at night, etc.  It is comfortable, a bit large though, and sound quality is very good.

Sennheiser generally has good quality but I wouldn't buy these again unless it .... Decent sound quality but the ear cups are TINY. Sennheiser generally has good quality but I wouldn't buy these again unless it was for a child.

i cut the long cable and now it's a perfect product. The quality is absolutely amazing, especially for the price. Doesn't feel cheap either. Super comfy too. Great entry level price headphones with high end sound. This is not my first pair of these.  No corded headphones last forever. Worked as expected.. They worked well for amateur radio Field Day.  They did get a little wet around the ears in the hot & humid summer weather, but they sounded great.

Great headphones, especially considering the price. Great headphones, especially considering the price.  This is my second pair in five years, only because I dropped the first pair just too many times on a hard floor and loosened something.  Probably could have been fixed, but it's easier to buy a second pair because they are so inexpensive.  I use them for my computer -- they are light and extremely comfortable.  Quality of sound and music is excellent.  There is virtually no sound leakage which makes my wife happy.

AMAZING Headphones for the price. When I first got these, I was blown away by the quality for the price. They even isolated some noise out- which is nice. The sound is clear and they're great headphones for both music and vocals. Highly recommended. The only problem I've had is that the ear-pieces can fall off when the headphones are stored in my laptop bag. They just snap right back in though.

Sennheiser Headphones. The headphones are great! the sound that is produced from them is great! This is was I needed for along time & the price was great as well. I only complaint would be the foam ear pads, my ears touch the screen inside,its needs to be a bit thicker but other than that, their great!

Great Sound. Really for the price perfect nice design for head and ears, nice sound included bass love it the HQ you can hear all sound stereo with hi bass , nothing more to say i highly recommended thing to buy another soon

Metal heads will love these. Ridiculous cost to performance ratio. Low price..but sound killer. Ear and head pads are plush super comfy, fit over my ears nicely. Instead of HD 202 II, Sennheiser should have named them HD EarSex II. I would recommend these to ANYONE.

great value at this price. I use these with my computer and it is a great upgrade from what I was using.  Long 3 meter cord gives me great ability to move about and the ear cushions work well to reduce external sounds. Great cost value to performance is great.

As expected with Sennheiser..... I have multiple units of Sennheiser ear buds and have not found any other brand that are better. So I was at ease when purchasing these head phones and I was right. Ok, but not great!!!!. I bought these as a gift for my sister and she liked them but said they do not drown out the sound of her TV! She has to lower volume on her TV in order to use them.

great headphones for the money. great headphones, comfortable around ears and excellent sound quality.

pretty good..but cord too long. Wish they would make them foldable so you could store them better.  The fit is good/comfort is very nice.  Blocks out outside sounds very well.

worth the money!!. These headphones are freakin awesome!! They work great, the sound it's Crystal clear, and the depth is fantastic. When watching an action movie they are great, and the bass it produces is phenomenal!!

Well worth it!. These headphones are well worth the money! Don't listen to all the negative reviews, these headphones sound good. They are comfortable to wear for hours at a time. The only complaint is the 10ft cord is a bit of a pain, but the cord winder works if you are on the move.
... THEY ARE NOT CIRCUMAURAL and the sound is not good.. Advertised as circumaural but THEY ARE NOT CIRCUMAURAL and the sound is not good.

no amount of "German Engineering" makes up for the Chinese manufacturing. sounds good. sound good for money BUT fatal flaw in plug. cord breaks internally every time (ive had 5 sets of these so far) near the plug. if it was L shaped they would last longer but of course in our throw away society this is more the norm. what do i ask for 30 bucks eh?
sound good.

but the sound quality is very good.. A little bit clunky, but the sound quality is very good.

The product does come with a cord wrap that helps a little with the cord length.

I also love the adjusting mechanism being built in on the back of the actual speaker holding compartment and not in the band. This makes them much more durable. Only reason I'm not rating it 5 stars is because of the ridiculously long cord which is tough to keep out of your way.

I have two other Sennheiser  headphones sets that are much better.

Clean bass with crisp highs. Good for dub. Not much midrange but the sound stays clean with almost no distortion. sounds more like a surround system "subwoofer, small mids and tweeters". For the price I would pick these over other cheap headphones. Who ever said these are not comfortable must have a warped head. If you want more mids go with JVC HA-RX500. AMAZON ROCKS!!

Seriously, these are a great value at $40. At $20 (today's price), assuming they bear any resemblance to the old models, they are a ridiculous value.

They work. They are simple. The sound is good. They are comfortable.

The cord is very long. We'd prefer a shorter cord, but we live with it.

Love. Amazing headphones for an amazing price.

I am always looking for good studio headphones with little to no boost and keep coming back to these.
They offer high quality sound, that doesn't clip or distort. The extra long cord is dourable, and is great for studio use.
My only complaint is that they are a little bit too small to be completely 'around ear' phones for me and partially rest against my ears. Not a problem for short use of up to 3 hours, but prolonged use can result in ear aches.

100% would recommend,  and plan on buying more.

 - Really long cord

Con:
 - Really Long cord

comments.comment: They're Sony, They're Satisifactory. I like these. They're cheap and great quality for the price. They'll make music pleasing to your ears, assuming you utilize equalizer settings properly (equalizer settings are just as important if not more important than speaker/earbud/etc. quality). They can handle quite a lot of bass and won't shake themselves out of your ears, but your ears might not appreciate having their insides shaken up for an hour or more each day. They seem to have a better make/quality compared to the 20 dollar Sony earbuds found in stores/Walmart.

comments.comment:
Correct the weak point yourself!?. I probably would have given these 5 stars (considering performance for price) except for the fact that I keep pulling the wire out of the 90 degree plug at the molded strain relief - a weak point in the design / construction.

After pulling the cord out of the fitting on my second pair, I managed to work the cord (partially?) back into the strain relief fitting, then took a lighter and slightly melted the strain relief fitting onto the cord.

Gave it a bit of a tug, and the cord now seems firmly connected!

I put them away for now and will use them when I really need them. Until then I am going to stick with Panasonic HJE120 earbuds, their much better at a cheaper price and have a much deeper bass. I use these to listen in bed, and they're very good at cutting outside noise because of the neoprene tips (you get three pair of different sizes with each set of earbuds, so you can pick the right size for you.)  Unless you want to pay a lot for high -end buds, these are well worth it.

comments.comment: These don't disappoint. These are without a doubt, some of the best IEMs I've ever used. good, but buy MDR-EX37B instead. If you're trying to buy some cheap/disposable headphones, you shouldn't buy these. Check them out, buy them instead. https://www.google.com/search?q=MDR-EX37B&rlz=1C1CHFX_enUS655US655&oq=MDR-EX37B&aqs=chrome..69i57j0l5.160j0j7&sourceid=chrome&es_sm=122&ie=UTF-8

comments.comment:
I can't believe I bought something else from Sony. I have bad luck with Sony products. I think all of my reviews state that I will never buy another Sony product.

I wanted some in-the-ear buds and these had good reviews, a low price (highly discounted), and the right color.

However, the left side bud has only a small fraction of the volume of the right one. The sound quality on the right bud is good, certainly better than the 99 cent ones I'm using now. I tried with several devices and never got the left bud to work correctly.

Excellent inexpensive use and abuse headphones.. Excellent inexpensive use and abuse headphones.

comments.discussion_name: Sony MDREX10LP/BLK In-Ear Headphones

ngram_comments: Good for the price. Sound quality is pretty good but transducer dBSPL/mW output a little low.

good for good price. not high end, not low end.  good for what they were purchased for which is to listen to streaming sporting events.  do not need high quality music sound, just need good clear play by play.  this fits the bill without spending the money for a pricey "i must hear each note clearly" item.
... a long time still works to this day highly recommend sound quality is great 5 stars. Lasts a long time still works to this day highly recommend sound quality is great 5 stars!!

Finally, Good Headphones. I've been buying cheep headphones from the corner store for a while now, and after a few weeks they always, ALWAYS stop working. Finally I decided to search for affordable quality earbuds online. These earbuds have surpassed the life of all my pervious corner store earbuds, and produces a better, crisper sound. They even take a beating and still work perfect. The cushions come off a little too easy for me, but not so easy that I wouldn't recomend thses earbuds anyone.

Cheap empty sound. Don't waste your money on these cheap sounding ear phones. They sound no better than the ear buds at a dollar store.  These are NOT like the Sony ear phones available here on Amazon a few years ago. If you're looking for a cheap price and poor sound quality ... then these a perfect match.

They don't go to 11.. Cheap and they work.
On a 1-10 I give the sound quality a 5.
These are easily blown away by even OEM Mac earbuds.
But if you just simply need some cheap earbuds that will work, these are a potential candidate.
These have great quality sound for a great price.. We are tough on headphones. Broken or Lost.  We buy a new set once every 6 mo at minimum.  These have great quality sound for a great price.

great sound, jack is prone to breaking. I love the sound quality for the price.  I am giving 4/5 because the connection at the headphone jack is prone to breaking; I work in a lab while listening to music.  If you are handy with a soldering iron then it is an easy fix.  Even knowing this, I still re-purchase these.

Good, cheap earphones.. I really like these. The sound quality is good and the connector is "L" shaped so I don't wind up shorting them out after a week like I do with straight connectors. They come with three sizes of cushion, which makes them easy to customize. I wound up just making a pair specific to my ears with Sugru so I could jog with them in.

Awesome. just saying these headphones last for ever. I had the same headphone set for a year now and its amazing. Sound is great and same for quality. I recommend this headphones. its the best out there for only 10 dollars
cheap, hurts my ear and sounds bad. I work in front of a computer for 10 hrs a day. Not a fan... they hurt my ear and the sound quality is terrible

Colors are fun. Sound quality is decent while it lasts. Ridiculously fragile.  Lasted just a few weeks, even with very gentle use.  Colors are fun.  Sound quality is decent while it lasts.  Inexpensive, but  should be sold in a package of 10, which would be a supply for a couple years.

Poor quality sound. Thin treble sound with almost no bass.. Thin treble sound with almost no bass. Seinhauser headphones blow these away. Why ruin your music experience with poor sound? It is not worth it. Also, those who like to sing along will hear their own voice very loudly with buds that block the ear canals.
http://www.amazon.com/Sennheiser-100-II-Ear-Miniheadphone-Black/dp/B002VPDOH8/ref=sr_1_14?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1353771520&sr=1-14&keywords=seinhauser+headphones
great sound but didn't last. sound quality was great they broke after a few months but i treated them like nothing whatever just spent a few bucks on them anyways
adequate earbuds. sound quality is ok but the buds keep falling out of my ears

Not bad, better options available.. Quality construction, good cord, fit my ears well, right-angle plug. These don't sound all that great though, they seem to be more of a mid-range driver, they cut off the high frequencies quite a bit. They sound fine for general utility but there are better options for less money. The Sony MDREX15LP sound far better, but the cord is not quite as high quality. I prefer Sony MDREX15LP Fashion Color EX Series Earbuds (White) to these.
Good product. Better than bose headsets.  It gives firm high quality sound, but it only last a year or two.  I have bought 3 sets.
color. I bought one pair an liked them so much I bought two more. All are different colors so everyone have there own . Sound  quality is good & stay in your ears .

Good sound quality and comfort. Wish they would last longer but what do you expect for the price.  Good sound
quality and comfort.

Very fragile. Inexpensive, colorful, with decent sound quality, but these headphones are exceptionally poorly made of flimsy materials.  Even babying this pair, one side stopped working within a few months and the other side started going right after.

Can't beat these ear buds for the price. For the price, it's hard to beat these ear buds. They are comfortable and I think the sound quality is pretty good, especially considering how inexpensive they are compared to Beats, Ear Candy, Bose, etc.
Nice price and sound. Bought these before from a local Target. Great sound quality at a fair price. the white ones are very nice
Good sound. These are a cute color although lighter than expected....not really the bright bubble gum pink as pictured. Sound quality is really good!
A good choice. These Headphones are comfortable, light and have a great sound quality, mainly the bass. It's a real good choice. I do recommend that!
Average at best. In all aspects including sound quality. Average at best. In all aspects including sound quality. Volume level is no good in anything louder than a quiet room.

Good but not great. The music quality of these ear buds is good, not great. Exceptional bass and good clarity, but the major flaw of these earphones is that they break often. Don't get me wrong, I'm rough with earphones, so these would break pretty often. However, there are plenty of durable earphones out there that have better sound quality than these. So if you're looking for a durable pair of earbuds, these aren't for you. I'd suggest checking out Sennheiser's earbuds

Decent in-ears.. Great bang for the buck. Sound quality is not so bad but definitely not Bose/Senheisser quality. That's why I give it only 4 out of 5 stars. But for everyday use it's fine if you're OK with not a 100% concert sound. And come on, it's for less than ten bucks.

Nice Headsets and Great Color. Good sound, fit, color and quality. I like the way the the cables are evenly spread with adjustable cable separation. The headsets can be used in the spa as long as the ear buds are not immersed in water. The price is right.
Great Purchase. I've had these for almost 2 years now & they're amazing. The sound quality is great & they've lasted me quite a while!! I highly recommend them.

Hate the way they fit. I used to order Sony's "Sweet Little Buds" but they have been discontinued and these are apparently the replacement. The sound quality is really pretty good for the money. For less than $10 you really can't complain.  I really have a problem with the way these fit. They are just a little too big for my ear canal, making me feel like they are going to pop out most of the time. Even using the smallest of the earbuds, they aren't comfortable.
Fit very well. Sound quality is ok.. Fit very well .Sound quality is ok .
hurts my ear and sounds bad. I work in front of a computer for 10 hrs a day. Not a fan... they hurt my ear and the sound quality is terrible

Very good sound quality. This product really does what it is made for, and that is to enjoy your music with a good quality, and block off annoying and unnecessary sounds. I sometimes have a hard time hearing people calling my name while wearing these.
But beware, if you get those things wet, it might ruin them, depends on how much moister came in. I had to learn that the hard way, but that was due to my clumsiness.

Just Meh...Quality and Color. The quality of these earbuds did not meet my expectations given Sony's reputation and brand. They're really lightweight, feel cheap and tangle easily. The color was also misleading, I bought the blue thinking they were like the tiffany blue depicted, but when they arrived they were baby blue. However, you can't beat the price and they do the job (sounds alright). Will just throw these in my gym bag.
Excellent Quality. These buds have excellent sound quality, a low price tag, and look and feel great!  Sony does a great job with their earbuds.  Highly recommend these!

Good for 3 months, then the static caused by the malfunctioned left ear bud is actually painful on your ear drum. Like many of the other reviews, the sound quality of these ear buds deteriorate after a few months of use. The left ear bud went out and the static it produces is actually painful on the ear drum. I used to own Skullcandy Inkd, but they tend to do the same thing. The quest for a functioning ear bud continues.

Sound quality is great. I particularly like that the left and right .... Sound quality is great.  I particularly like that the left and right phone are different so that I can tell the difference without having to read the little letters, which is difficult for me being very nearsighted, and because I walk at night and listen using them.

Great for the price.... ... but you get what you pay for.

I've been through way too many expensive headphones... and just decided to get a few of these to leave in my bag, home, etc.  This way I can always have in-ear headphones when I need them.

The quality of sound is WAY better than I imagined for the price.  But having had them for a short time,  they are starting to malfunction.

But for the price?  So what.  LOL
sound quality awesome and stay in my ears without trouble. sound quality awesome and stay in my ears without trouble, like them so much I bout two more pair for my sons

Nice but cords are too long for active wear.... The quality of sound is fine and the additional ear bud sizes offer a good selection to fit in your ear comfortably.  My only complaint is that the cords are too long.  I use these connected to my Nano when I'm working-out and I have 4 feet of cord I'm constantly fighting with.  I'm going to have to get some wire strippers and cut a section out and rejoin.

Cute but short length. Ideal for use on desk at work, but too short for using on your desktop computer if the CPU is on the floor. Sounds does cancel noise a lil bit, enough to block out loud co-workers...we all have those...yeah. But i digress. The sound quality is mid range, but again you are not expecting Bose sound on this little thing. Gets the job done. I like!

Don't waste your money. Very poor sound quality. No bass and damping total volume. Very disappointed. I have owned and enjoyed 3 pairs of SONY MDR-E10LP Lightweight Earbuds, which have great sound and fit. They don't seem to be available anymore.

Good sound quality, but only lasts so long. One side started to sound weird after a while and then one side died on me completely. The sound quality was good but they last me how long I expect ear buds to last, I am guilty of pulling on the cord to unplug them from my ears though
Good sound quality. I ordered these and the JBuds to compare the two. These sound much better than the JBuds, with decent bass.

Great deal.. These headphones aren't waterproof and are very inexpensive. But they produce a very good quality sound and one was submerged in a glass of tea for a few minuets and after a few shakes and a good drying works like a charm. Good purchase.

Value for money.. I was expecting better sound quality from these. I am little disappointed with these Sony headphones. Value for what you pay, good alternative for travelers who keep loosing headphones.
Buds. This itme is fairly good quality as i have purchased quite a few different types of ear phones.  Nice sound.

Very good sound quality and snug fit.. This product comes with replaceable rubber pieces to customize the fit, which is great because many other competitive products don't fit my ear well.  Great price for very good sound.

listen to me is really good prodcut. I really love the earpuds. I been using for the past two years with no any major issue. As student i through and put my earbuds everywhere, and still working great. As sound quality goes are fine. I mean you get what you pay for if you want something with very high quality then you have to aim for something more expensive

product not as described. From the description and Sony's reputation I had expected an excellent product. I compared it with several other ear buds and there was a marked difference in the sound quality. These ear buds had a tinny sound. I ended up returning these.

Ear comfort and surround sound. What a concept.. I have gone through around thirty ear buds in the last ten years. None of them had the ear comfort of these speaker pillows. The sound quality seems like full room speakers. These sound better than Bose sound systems.

I can't believe I bought something else from Sony. I have bad luck with Sony products. I think all of my reviews state that I will never buy another Sony product.

I wanted some in-the-ear buds and these had good reviews, a low price (highly discounted), and the right color.

However, the left side bud has only a small fraction of the volume of the right one. The sound quality on the right bud is good, certainly better than the 99 cent ones I'm using now. I tried with several devices and never got the left bud to work correctly.

3rd pair. I love these so much I'm on my 3rd pair. One pair I wore out, the other I keep at work and this pair I use at the gym. They stay in when I run. they're comfy and have a good sound quality. I'd definitely purchase again.

Nice Pair. I always had trouble with similar products with similar prices from Skullcandy.  They never lasted more than 2 weeks without one ear bud failing.  Since I've switched to Sony, the quality of the sound and durability has been an excellent value for the price.  I'm very happy with this product.

Hey it works!. Worked so far up until the point they accidentally got ran through the washer + dryer. They lasted about 3 months but i'm sure these would've lasted much longer than that. Sound quality was average. A decent set for the price.

Poor sound quality.. I'm not really picky about sound quality, but this product was so poor, I had to say something.  I ended up tossing these guys out.  I just couldn't bear it!  Even though these guys were incredibly cheap, I feel that they were a waste of money and time.  Sony should be ashamed!

Recommended.. Excellent Buds. I had another pair and lost them. I switched to regular earphones, and they were never the same. I finally purchased this and have been using them a couple of months. No regrets. The quality of the product, and the sound they produce, there's no comparison.

Uncomfortable. These headphones are still going strong after I've had them for about a year. They have good sound quality and fit snug in the ear to drown out background noise. The only downside is that they can become uncomfortable after wearing them for a bit, even just 15 minutes.

Good sound. I always read the negative reviews first before purchasing. Most was about going dead a few days after receiving product. So far it's been more then a week and still going strong. Sound quality is very good as those mentioned in 4 and 5 star reviews. I did get an email from vendor requesting for my satisfaction feedback. Which I feel if product was really inferior, they would only send it and hope you don't complain.

Love these, have been buying them for years. I love these headphones, and I have been buying them for years.  I bought my first set in 2007 when I bought my first i-Pod. My first set lasted three years before one of the earbuds started to crackle when I moved. I heavily abused them (shoved into my tennis bag every day before matches, shoved into my book bag after walking across campus).  They block out sound and have a great quality without being ridiculously expensive like other earbuds out there.

Mixed feelings, maybe a bad pair?. This is my second pair that I have owned. My first pair, I had lost after having for a verryyy long time with no problems. However, this one in particular, the left bud went out within a year of regular use. Other than that, they are very good ear buds with great sound quality.

Decent for the price. Sound quality is good for the price.  Good quality considering the price I paid for them.  Comfortable, stays in the ear well (3 different sizes of ear buds included).
It's been over a year now and I found these earbuds to be much more durable than the Frogz earbuds.  The Frogz earbuds last me anywhere from 1-3 months, but these Sony buds have lasted over a year.  The Frogz buds definitely have much better sound quality, but lack the durability of these Sony buds.
OK. these headphones are ok.... the highs are good the mids are ok and the bass is ok not to overpowering...  overall great sound quality.. i would recommend these for an average consumer
Good sound quality. Very cheap good sound quality.  Remember if you want something extraordinary you have to pay more than usual
Five Stars. Sound quality is good and have had no issues with these headphones.

Quality control ? falling off. They feel nice and quality seems ok, i wish i could compare sound quality too, but i could not: they came in a non-working condition.
And yeah, they fall off... what a shame.

I love the "L" shape design so it doesn't mess up .... I personally have always bought these because I put my phones in my pockets and sit down a lot with the jack still plugged into my phone. I love the "L" shape design so it doesn't mess up the jack of the earbuds and the phone itself. Great quality and very good sound reproduction.

Inexpensive, but do not last long.. I get these about once every two months because they are cheap.  They only last that long for hard sweaty workouts every day.  I should probably splurge and get the more expensive sport ones, but at least if I lose these, no worries.  The sound quality is excellent, while they work.

Lasted about 5 months.. One side stopped working after about 5 months. I expected it to be longer-lasting as a Sony product, so I was pretty disappointed. You should know, though, that I used it on my bike rides to school, stuffed it into my bag pretty aggressively, etc. So maybe if you don't use it like I did, it'll last longer. ;) When it WAS working, it was amazing!! SO much better sound quality than cheaper ones I've bought.

there are better choices out there. Sound quality it's... OK, They are really light.
I purchase them because I read in several places that it must be a choice for audiofiles. BUT THIS IS NOT TRUE, there are better choices out there.

Also wiring seems to be their Aquiles Talon. My earbuds like many others have bad wiring and each side sounds different. This is really annoying I only use them once and toss them with the old ones drawer.

I also give away a pair that seems to work right so... Good luck finding the good quality pair in your purchase.
nice head phones. A very good headphone for the price. The leads are long and that helps out a lot. The ear buds are OK. A very good value

Cute and comfy. My old earbuds died, or I lost them, or something I can't remember...but I needed a new pair and these were cute so I got them. I use them all the time at work. I like that you can change out the size of the ends to fit your ear holes perfectly. They mostly sit on my desk and get popped in and out several hundred times a day... and they're been great so far!

Love the Sony Eardud & Priced Right. I love the Sony Earbud.  I especially like they added the little nub on the left side.  While get set up to listen to my MP3 player at night is easy, even when the lights are out.  I am very happy with the sound reproduction.  I am also happy that they include more than one set of the rubber buds.  I fall asleep listening and get the cords wound up a bit and have not had one tip come off yet!

good headphones for the price. good headphones for the price, but I have found that any earbuds with the clear rubber tips are made from harder rubber than the black tips. These are great headphones but don't buy the red/clear tip ones. But a color with black tips and youll get softer/gummier rubber that stays in your ear better.
Best nighttime earbuds.. Inexpensive but not cheap... I don't care that they wear-out due to nighttime/sleeping use.  Sound great. Pretty good at noise canceling.

Good. They're good. I didn't realize that I didn't like earbuds until I tried these. I don't like how they block my hearing. It's like plugging your ears with your fingers. You can hear your internal breathing and sometimes your heartbeat.

Great sound for cheap earbuds. Great sound for cheap earbuds. They lasted me about 2 years the first time (daily abuse at the gym eventually snapped one of the wires), just ordered a new pair. Comfortable fit, good color selection.

Awesome for the money. I've been buying Sony earbuds for years because they have always had the best sound and the best fit for the money and these don't disappoint. If you are looking for big sound this isn't for you, but if your want really good sound for a low price then buy these.
Buds are not a good fit for this earphones. Good sound. The buds are just too weak. They come off easily and are difficult to put in.

Finally, Good Headphones. I've been buying cheep headphones from the corner store for a while now, and after a few weeks they always, ALWAYS stop working. Finally I decided to search for affordable quality earbuds online. These earbuds have surpassed the life of all my pervious corner store earbuds, and produces a better, crisper sound. They even take a beating and still work perfect. The cushions come off a little too easy for me, but not so easy that I wouldn't recomend thses earbuds anyone.

I bought these because the JVC earbuds I have been .... I bought these because the JVC earbuds I have been buying for a few years were discontinued. They lasted 1 day and the right ear went out. I used them for a total of about 3 hours, kept them in a jeans pocket for about 30 minutes, and stored them on a desktop overnight.

Cheap empty sound. Don't waste your money on these cheap sounding ear phones. They sound no better than the ear buds at a dollar store.  These are NOT like the Sony ear phones available here on Amazon a few years ago. If you're looking for a cheap price and poor sound quality ... then these a perfect match.

Great earbuds for the price. Great earbuds for the price. I go through these things like water, and this type of Sony seems to hold up longer than most. I tend to end up getting shorts in the wiring or at the plug, just because of the way I use them. Sometimes I lose the silicone earpiece. So, I stick to the cheaper end of the price spectrum, and keep spares. They just plain do the job.
Great!. Ordered for my wife and she really likes them. Listens to her baseball team on her little radio and loves the ear buds.

Ideal for sitting down and relaxing. I'm not crazy about these earbuds. They're okay for $10, deliver the sound they're supposed to produce. The detail is that they feel cheap (they are) and you feel when something's gonna break soon. I've already noticed the left speaker occasionally looses connection to the jack somewhere along the cable.

But if you're not active and only use them while sitting down, these earbuds are for you. Good noise canceling and ndecent sound.

They don't go to 11.. Cheap and they work.
On a 1-10 I give the sound quality a 5.
These are easily blown away by even OEM Mac earbuds.
But if you just simply need some cheap earbuds that will work, these are a potential candidate.

I expected more from Sony. Not bad, but I expected a better sound.  I had a similar pair of headphones, I bought almost 10 years ago, earbuds were a newer deal back then.  They had a phenomenal sound.  I lost one of the earbuds and figured I would get a new set, it turns out I am still using the 10 year old set with the buds from these earbuds.

Good price but should last longer then 3 months. 2-3 months life spam before one of the earbuds starts to lose sound. I have purchased 5 of these over the years and every single one has the same problem. Good price but should last longer then 3 months. I use these for music only, while in the office.

No Bueno.
Ear Buds. I have owned them before and damaged my last set, so I had to replace them with the same thing.

Can't beat the price. Good quality for the price.

It obviously doesn't beat those Bose $150 earbuds, but that's really not what I was looking for!
Extremely disappointed. I couldn't hear out of one of the earbuds just 2 days after I opened the package. Extremely disappointed

Poor quality sound. Thin treble sound with almost no bass.. Thin treble sound with almost no bass. Seinhauser headphones blow these away. Why ruin your music experience with poor sound? It is not worth it. Also, those who like to sing along will hear their own voice very loudly with buds that block the ear canals.
http://www.amazon.com/Sennheiser-100-II-Ear-Miniheadphone-Black/dp/B002VPDOH8/ref=sr_1_14?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1353771520&sr=1-14&keywords=seinhauser+headphones
adequate earbuds. sound quality is ok but the buds keep falling out of my ears

Not bad, better options available.. Quality construction, good cord, fit my ears well, right-angle plug. These don't sound all that great though, they seem to be more of a mid-range driver, they cut off the high frequencies quite a bit. They sound fine for general utility but there are better options for less money. The Sony MDREX15LP sound far better, but the cord is not quite as high quality. I prefer Sony MDREX15LP Fashion Color EX Series Earbuds (White) to these.

Fantastic quality for a few more bucks. An upgrade from the JVC Gumys I was loyal to for years. The jack is more protected and sturdier. Ear buds are even more comfortable. Permanently making the switch!

They Are Cheap For a Reason. They broke after <6 months use. One earpiece is silent while the other is muted. And I've tried other earbuds with the same device and it's not the jack on the device, it's the headphones.
A Great Purchase!. I think the sound through these is perfect for my needs.  The ear buds are soft and comfortable and I can listen for hours, barely noticing them in my ears.

Great Headphones. Bought them for my nephew as a gift. He loved them and explained to me that the sound was very clear. You can never go wrong with Sony.

On the flip side, I wish Sony made their earbuds with less chance of shortage. I guess for the price I shouldn't complain, right? Lol.

Decent sound, cheap and affordable. These are much better than the skullkandy headphones you will normally encounter in a retail store. Sony makes wonderful cheap earbuds like these, which is great if you need something that will give you good sound for cheap. Now of course you won't be getting thumping bass, but if you get a decent enough seal, you will be decently surprised about the bass you can get from these little affordable headphones. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase. And I will buy again if I ever need to replace one of my cheap headphones.
They're earbuds. They do the job.  I don't love them.  But, like I said, they do the job I bought them for.
Sounds great. I really liked these earbuds. Great value, it sounds great, not very durable though when they encounter a vacuum cleaner!

Solid day to day earbuds. i love the sound these deliver. I do find myself buying a new pair every 2-3 months since the wire within the cord tends to break but these are still the best bang for the buck I've found for sound vs daily use without breaking the bank.

Can't beat these ear buds for the price. For the price, it's hard to beat these ear buds. They are comfortable and I think the sound quality is pretty good, especially considering how inexpensive they are compared to Beats, Ear Candy, Bose, etc.
Great earbuds. I bought these as replacement buds for my daughter's iPod and she loved them so much she wanted a second pair.

Not Bad. I tried these headphones in lieu of the normal panasonic brand that I buy, these don't sound as good as the panasonic ear buds but their decent. The price and shipping were great. I would purchase from this merhcant again.

These earbuds are my personal favorite!!!. I prefer the Sony In-Ear headphones a lot better because I don't have to worry about them falling off my head anymore! These are so good, I bought three other earbuds in three other colors! I recommend these to everyone!!!

I have two pairs!. I love the Sony ear buds! Their small pair is perfect for my tiny ears. Lots of other ear buds give my pain after being in for a while but I can wear these for hours! (airplanes & work) This is my third pair. After loving my first pair for years I decided cleaning wasn't enough and got two new pair, one for my desk at work and a pair for my purse.

Died after just two months. These low quality cheap headphones suddenly stopped working (while listening) after about two months of light use.  Very disappointing.

Why Sony stopped making the better MDR series earbuds for about twenty to forty bucks I will never know.  They lasted a few years, not a few weeks.  :-(
Decent. Decent little ear buds. Would of been nice if they came with a built in mic as well.

sound is tinny, but good for price. sound is a bit tinny, but what would you expect from a 13$ earphones? the earphones look good and are pretty comfortable. i like that they are from a reputable brand like sony. sony has been in the industry for a long time, and knows how to make good earbuds. I enjoy listening to these as basic earbuds, but keep in mind that they do block outside noise pretty well. i found that out when i was listening to music and i couldn't hear my mom calling out to me.
Fantastic. I have many pairs of these earbuds. For the price you can't go wrong, they are sturdy and they sound great.

Great Headphones, Great price... The seller got these to me within 3 days.. and the headphones are amazing. The quality is something I'd expect from a pair of 80-100 dollar ear-buds, I have no complaints. The seller also included paperwork with all of his info for any questions or complaints, very professional all around.

Good sound, low price. I go through lots of ear buds and bought these to support my music habit. They fit my ears nicely and the sound is comparable to the $129 pair I bought before it went through the washer and dryer...
They're earbuds and they do the job.. In ear, economically priced, buds aren't expected to meet the aural quality of high dollar studio headphones.  That said, these "do the trick".

Terrible ear buds. These are horrible. They broke within two weeks. Every Sony ear buds or headphones I have bought break so fast it's not worth buying Sony ear buds ever again. I do not recommend any Sony head phones or ear buds. Other Sony products seem to work well but not headphones/ear buds. DO NOT BUY THESE!!!!!!!
Wonderful sound. This ear buds are wonderful to use and have great sound. I bought another pair at an electronics store and paid more for them.

Good but not great. The music quality of these ear buds is good, not great. Exceptional bass and good clarity, but the major flaw of these earphones is that they break often. Don't get me wrong, I'm rough with earphones, so these would break pretty often. However, there are plenty of durable earphones out there that have better sound quality than these. So if you're looking for a durable pair of earbuds, these aren't for you. I'd suggest checking out Sennheiser's earbuds

Good Headphones Like the 3 different sized ear pieces. Update:  We got these on the March 15, 2014 and had to get them ready for return on April 5, 2014 because the left side earbud stopped working.

My 17 yr old is happy with these headphones and likes the fact they ship with different size ear pieces because she needed the small size.  She says they sound good and that says a lot coming from her.  The earbuds also come with a 90 day limited warranty.

They're Sony, They're Satisifactory. I like these. They're cheap and great quality for the price. They'll make music pleasing to your ears, assuming you utilize equalizer settings properly (equalizer settings are just as important if not more important than speaker/earbud/etc. quality). They can handle quite a lot of bass and won't shake themselves out of your ears, but your ears might not appreciate having their insides shaken up for an hour or more each day. They seem to have a better make/quality compared to the 20 dollar Sony earbuds found in stores/Walmart.

Nice Headsets and Great Color. Good sound, fit, color and quality. I like the way the the cables are evenly spread with adjustable cable separation. The headsets can be used in the spa as long as the ear buds are not immersed in water. The price is right.

Hate the way they fit. I used to order Sony's "Sweet Little Buds" but they have been discontinued and these are apparently the replacement. The sound quality is really pretty good for the money. For less than $10 you really can't complain.  I really have a problem with the way these fit. They are just a little too big for my ear canal, making me feel like they are going to pop out most of the time. Even using the smallest of the earbuds, they aren't comfortable.

Ear headphones. I am so amazed at the tremendous bass and sound coming from these
headphones. Great price, and finally buds that fit my ear properly. I plan
to purchase two more pair before they are all out.

Not Happy. I am so disappointed with Sony right now. I received these a few weeks ago, tried them out then put them away. The sound isn't as good as my old Sony earbuds (discontinued) but their ok. The bass isn't as deep and there seem to be a bit static. I put them away for now and will use them when I really need them. Until then I am going to stick with Panasonic HJE120 earbuds, their much better at a cheaper price and have a much deeper bass. If bass isn't your thing then get these Sony earbuds.

Real Crapola. Not only is the wire so flimsy that I fear to use it outdoors, but I have tiny ear canals and they shipped with only one small fitting.  Sort of useless.  The sound from my HTC solidly built earbuds is far better and after a year, they are still like new. I bought these overpriced commodity buds because people with auditory challenges appeared to praise them in the main.

Just Meh...Quality and Color. The quality of these earbuds did not meet my expectations given Sony's reputation and brand. They're really lightweight, feel cheap and tangle easily. The color was also misleading, I bought the blue thinking they were like the tiffany blue depicted, but when they arrived they were baby blue. However, you can't beat the price and they do the job (sounds alright). Will just throw these in my gym bag.
Performs as the price would suggest.. They perform as expected. Nothing special, just ear buds.
Excellent Quality. These buds have excellent sound quality, a low price tag, and look and feel great!  Sony does a great job with their earbuds.  Highly recommend these!

Good for 3 months, then the static caused by the malfunctioned left ear bud is actually painful on your ear drum. Like many of the other reviews, the sound quality of these ear buds deteriorate after a few months of use. The left ear bud went out and the static it produces is actually painful on the ear drum. I used to own Skullcandy Inkd, but they tend to do the same thing. The quest for a functioning ear bud continues.

Good for the cost. These ear phones work well and are holding up well. My daughter uses them at home so we have not tried them when doing activity yet but the sound is good and they fit well. They came with extra buds.

Best earbuds I've found. The only thing that would make these better might be if they included an Apple style volume control/mike on the cord.  But that would increase the price.

I use these to listen in bed, and they're very good at cutting outside noise because of the neoprene tips (you get three pair of different sizes with each set of earbuds, so you can pick the right size for you.)  Unless you want to pay a lot for high -end buds, these are well worth it.

Sony Ear Buds. Love this gadget.  Stay in my ears much better and the sound is great.  Carry them with me wherever I go.  I recommend these earbuds to any and everybody who likes hands free communication or listening to your favorite music while you exercise.

Don't waste your money. Very poor sound quality. No bass and damping total volume. Very disappointed. I have owned and enjoyed 3 pairs of SONY MDR-E10LP Lightweight Earbuds, which have great sound and fit. They don't seem to be available anymore.

good, but buy MDR-EX37B instead. If you're trying to buy some cheap/disposable headphones, you shouldn't buy these. Two Stars. another if the price is cheap then it won't last ear buds.
Buds. This itme is fairly good quality as i have purchased quite a few different types of ear phones.  Nice sound.

Decent for the price. Sound quality is good for the price.  Good quality considering the price I paid for them.  Comfortable, stays in the ear well (3 different sizes of ear buds included).

Reedeeming Aspect is the Price. Sound for the price isn't bad. They're comfortable, good bass, but the treble is splashy and overpowering and bleeding out over other tones. Nice headphones for the price, but Im having to crank down the treble in iTunes by ALOT when listening over half volume.

Good sound quality and comfort. Wish they would last longer but what do you expect for the price.  Good sound
quality and comfort.

sound is tinny, but good for price. sound is a bit tinny, but what would you expect from a 13$ earphones? the earphones look good and are pretty comfortable. i like that they are from a reputable brand like sony. sony has been in the industry for a long time, and knows how to make good earbuds.
