Good sound, low price. I go through lots of ear buds and bought these to support my music habit. They fit my ears nicely and the sound is comparable to the $129 pair I bought before it went through the washer and dryer...

Nice Headsets and Great Color. Good sound, fit, color and quality. I like the way the the cables are evenly spread with adjustable cable separation. The headsets can be used in the spa as long as the ear buds are not immersed in water. The price is right.

Not Happy. I am so disappointed with Sony right now. I received these a few weeks ago, tried them out then put them away. The sound isn't as good as my old Sony earbuds (discontinued) but their ok. The bass isn't as deep and there seem to be a bit static. I put them away for now and will use them when I really need them. Until then I am going to stick with Panasonic HJE120 earbuds, their much better at a cheaper price and have a much deeper bass. If bass isn't your thing then get these Sony earbuds.

Best earbuds I've found. The only thing that would make these better might be if they included an Apple style volume control/mike on the cord.  But that would increase the price.

I use these to listen in bed, and they're very good at cutting outside noise because of the neoprene tips (you get three pair of different sizes with each set of earbuds, so you can pick the right size for you.)  Unless you want to pay a lot for high -end buds, these are well worth it.

Good sounding very affordable headphones.. The headphones are very nice for the price.

These fit comfortably and have surprising sound. I would definitely buy these again.

Very good sound quality and snug fit.. This product comes with replaceable rubber pieces to customize the fit, which is great because many other competitive products don't fit my ear well.  Great price for very good sound.

Great Sounding Headphones for a Low Price. I've bought 4 pairs of these headphones sound great and have good bass. My only gripe is that the 3rd pair I got broke after a couple weeks. My favorite SONY earbuds are these: Sony MDREX58V/BLK EX Series Earbud Headphones
They keep outside noise at bay WITHOUT using sound cancelling technology.
Sony Ear Headphones. I love Sony products. These head phones are crisp and clear.

I don't treat them the best. Normally I just shove them in my pocket .... I don't treat them the best. Normally I just shove them in my pocket or backpack. I wouldn't say I abuse my headphones, but one of the earbuds will eventually stop working after one or two months of usage. This is why I buy about 3 or 4 of these at a time. But of the price, I guess it's expected.

I'm not looking for superior quality or anything, but I was hoping they'd last a bit longer...
color problem. It is very good ear headphone but in the image it have another color. it is dark pink, like dirty color.  I was excepted peach color in hear head phone but it is darker.

My go to headphones. These ones are my favorite I have bought them in several colors and keep them as back ups for running, The quality is great and price is better! I don't have huge expectations for headphones, that run on the cheaper side, but these were perfect I cant hear any thing else other than what i want to when im running in these.

Will and have continue to buy these!

It's okay, its decent.. I thought it would provide more bass. My headphones did not come with various ear bud sizes or options. But you can't complain for its price. I would much rather have and have had these headphones: Panasonic RPHJE120K In-Ear Headphone (B003EM8008 Slightly cheaper and much better, and comes with various ear bud sizes or options.

Ear comfort and surround sound. What a concept.. I have gone through around thirty ear buds in the last ten years. None of them had the ear comfort of these speaker pillows. The sound quality seems like full room speakers. These sound better than Bose sound systems.

I can't believe I bought something else from Sony. I have bad luck with Sony products. I think all of my reviews state that I will never buy another Sony product.

I wanted some in-the-ear buds and these had good reviews, a low price (highly discounted), and the right color.

However, the left side bud has only a small fraction of the volume of the right one. The sound quality on the right bud is good, certainly better than the 99 cent ones I'm using now. I tried with several devices and never got the left bud to work correctly.

Nice Pair. I always had trouble with similar products with similar prices from Skullcandy.  They never lasted more than 2 weeks without one ear bud failing.  Since I've switched to Sony, the quality of the sound and durability has been an excellent value for the price.  I'm very happy with this product.

Excellent inexpensive use and abuse headphones.. Excellent inexpensive use and abuse headphones.
Pros:
They have really crisp and clear sound.
They fit comfortably in my ears no discomfort even wearing them while sleeping.
Inexpensive, use them, abuse them, buy a new pair.
Cons:
Slightly flimsy, they will not last forever, but at that price you can hardly expect that.

Poor sound quality.. I'm not really picky about sound quality, but this product was so poor, I had to say something.  I ended up tossing these guys out.  I just couldn't bear it!  Even though these guys were incredibly cheap, I feel that they were a waste of money and time.  Sony should be ashamed!

Recommended.. Excellent Buds. I had another pair and lost them. I switched to regular earphones, and they were never the same. I finally purchased this and have been using them a couple of months. No regrets. The quality of the product, and the sound they produce, there's no comparison.

Uncomfortable. These headphones are still going strong after I've had them for about a year. They have good sound quality and fit snug in the ear to drown out background noise. The only downside is that they can become uncomfortable after wearing them for a bit, even just 15 minutes.
alright. worked for sometime but after 6  months I can hear the crackling in the phones in my ears no bueno sony, not impressed

Great value. Considering their price, these earphones are a great value. No, they don't sound as well as my Sennheisers, which cost me more than ten times. They fit nicely in my ears but I don't like the unequal length of the left/right ear cables. I find this design to be a nuisance.

Disappointed. I usually have good experiences with sony products, but I purchased these in February of 2014 and they were broken by mid April of 2014. One ear started to sound muffled and distorted, then stopped working altogether. I regret purchasing this product.
Headphones. The color is beautiful, and the earphones were a gift. They were a big hit, and were loved, when given.

Love these, have been buying them for years. I love these headphones, and I have been buying them for years.  I bought my first set in 2007 when I bought my first i-Pod. My first set lasted three years before one of the earbuds started to crackle when I moved. I heavily abused them (shoved into my tennis bag every day before matches, shoved into my book bag after walking across campus).  They block out sound and have a great quality without being ridiculously expensive like other earbuds out there.
good ear buds. no they aren't the best in the market but for the price they are hard to beat.. I have 2 pairs. I leave one at work and the other travels with me in my car..

Mixed feelings, maybe a bad pair?. This is my second pair that I have owned. My first pair, I had lost after having for a verryyy long time with no problems. However, this one in particular, the left bud went out within a year of regular use. Other than that, they are very good ear buds with great sound quality.
less than a year. I have bought two of these in the last year. On both sets, the right earphone slowly dies until it is completely dead. Not the old Sony I used to know.
Pretty durable for cheap headphones.. Super cheap, and they're still going more than a year of exercising 5 days a week.

Lightweight and does not get tangled like the other costly brands out there. I am a fan of these small symphonic ear phones.  Lightweight and does not get tangled like the other costly brands out there.  The sound is sufficient for my listening pleasure.

Good product for the price.. These are nice and comfortable headphones.
However, the cheap quality is a synonym of poor durabilty, in fact I had to throw them away after less than a year of use.

If you're sick of cheap headphones, these are a little bit better. If you don't want to spend $250 on headphones that fit in your ear and are sick of buying the cheap imitation knockoffs that cost $0.01 with $.99 shipping charges, you might be satisfied with these product. They kind of hurt my ear at first but then I realized I hadn't put on the little clear/white ear fitting covers on. Once I put those on they didn't hurt my ear as much and it was easier to hear the music.

I love the "L" shape design so it doesn't mess up .... I personally have always bought these because I put my phones in my pockets and sit down a lot with the jack still plugged into my phone. I love the "L" shape design so it doesn't mess up the jack of the earbuds and the phone itself. Great quality and very good sound reproduction.
The Ears are alive, with the sound of Muuuuu-sic!. A stonking set of ear buds for cheap money.  I've bought many pairs and given them to friends with earbuds less worthy.
Good sound and good price, but they break too easily. These stopped working after less than one month of usage. Both ear pieces stopped working. I don't recommend them.
Disappointed: shortly after using it. Disappointed:  shortly after using it, the sound in one ear quit...

Great for the price.. Really nice sound and comfortable.

but after heavy use i began to lose sound on the left earbud. the volume was a lot lower than the right one and eventually the left side stopped working. there was no kinks or cuts on the cable i figured it just must have been the driver in the bud itself.

i will be getting another pair because they are really good for the price.

there are better choices out there. Sound quality it's... OK, They are really light.
I purchase them because I read in several places that it must be a choice for audiofiles. BUT THIS IS NOT TRUE, there are better choices out there.

Also wiring seems to be their Aquiles Talon. My earbuds like many others have bad wiring and each side sounds different. This is really annoying I only use them once and toss them with the old ones drawer.

I also give away a pair that seems to work right so... Good luck finding the good quality pair in your purchase.

Nice deep green color. I already have the blue and red ones and ordered these in case I lose a pair of the others.  I like the deep green color.  I have some hearing loss in the right ear and found out that the Sonys are better for me than the other pairs I have.

These are great. Ok, I know these aren't the most expensive headphones, but for $8 I got a pair for my office at work and they are great.  Bought a second pair of these for the same price and keep them in my travel stuff for when I go out of town.  I did have a pair of these about 2 years ago, and although they only lasted for a year before one of the buds stopped working, it was well worth the $8 they cost me at the time~!

Comfortable, but one side dead after 2 months!. I bought these in December and I've already had to retire them because the left ear bud has stopped working entirely. I wish the company would replace them; it seems like there should be some sort of warranty for such a short period of time.
Five Stars. sound is great and they are a good brand
Five Stars. Great headphones, good size, easy to store and great color!
Five Stars. Work great and fit the ear better than others we have tried.
Five Stars. they last forever. I lose them and reorder them.
Five Stars. Looks sharp in blue too, but sounds about the same as the black ones, works as expected.
Five Stars. I accidentally put it through the washer and dryer..... it still works!!!!
Five Stars. Good sound. The plug has multiple reinforcement so you won't have issues with cord breakage due to strain.
Five Stars. Great price.  Fast shipping.  Exactly what I was looking for.
Five Stars. Great just what I was looking for.  Excellent sound!
Five Stars. Sound quality is good and have had no issues with these headphones.
Five Stars. Best ear buds I've had!  Comfortable when wearing on long walks and running.

Cute and comfy. My old earbuds died, or I lost them, or something I can't remember...but I needed a new pair and these were cute so I got them. I use them all the time at work. I like that you can change out the size of the ends to fit your ear holes perfectly. They mostly sit on my desk and get popped in and out several hundred times a day... and they're been great so far!

Great sound for cheap earbuds. Great sound for cheap earbuds. They lasted me about 2 years the first time (daily abuse at the gym eventually snapped one of the wires), just ordered a new pair. Comfortable fit, good color selection.

Awesome for the money. I've been buying Sony earbuds for years because they have always had the best sound and the best fit for the money and these don't disappoint. If you are looking for big sound this isn't for you, but if your want really good sound for a low price then buy these.

good for good price. not high end, not low end.  good for what they were purchased for which is to listen to streaming sporting events.  do not need high quality music sound, just need good clear play by play.  this fits the bill without spending the money for a pricey "i must hear each note clearly" item.
Buds are not a good fit for this earphones. Good sound. The buds are just too weak. They come off easily and are difficult to put in.

Very good earphones for the price. Very good earphones for the price. They fit my ears well, which I think is key to both comfort and good sound. For some reason the green ones are cheaper than the other colors. I'm sure there's no effect on the sound!
Five Stars. Work great and fit the ear better than others we have tried.

Not bad, better options available.. Quality construction, good cord, fit my ears well, right-angle plug. These don't sound all that great though, they seem to be more of a mid-range driver, they cut off the high frequencies quite a bit. They sound fine for general utility but there are better options for less money. The Sony MDREX15LP sound far better, but the cord is not quite as high quality. I prefer Sony MDREX15LP Fashion Color EX Series Earbuds (White) to these.
Good fit. Good fit in the ear and does block outside nose. Cable is plenty long enough for computer or iPad use.

Sony MDREX10LP/BLK In-Ear Headphones. WOW. Exactly what I've been looking for. It is an exact fit for my ears. I'm no sound expert, but the music is perfect. I use this at the gym and they haven't fallen out once during hard cardio sessions.
ear phones. This was given as a gift to my child and she/he loved the sound that it produces.  Also likes how they fit the ear.
I love these headphones. I love these headphones, I keep buying them. Problem is they don't seem to last very long. One ear always ends up dying on me. I love the fit so much I keep coming back.

Good sound, low price. I go through lots of ear buds and bought these to support my music habit. They fit my ears nicely and the sound is comparable to the $129 pair I bought before it went through the washer and dryer...

Nice Headsets and Great Color. Good sound, fit, color and quality. I like the way the the cables are evenly spread with adjustable cable separation. The headsets can be used in the spa as long as the ear buds are not immersed in water. The price is right.

Hate the way they fit. I used to order Sony's "Sweet Little Buds" but they have been discontinued and these are apparently the replacement. The sound quality is really pretty good for the money. For less than $10 you really can't complain.  I really have a problem with the way these fit. They are just a little too big for my ear canal, making me feel like they are going to pop out most of the time. Even using the smallest of the earbuds, they aren't comfortable.

Ear headphones. I am so amazed at the tremendous bass and sound coming from these
headphones. Great price, and finally buds that fit my ear properly. I plan
to purchase two more pair before they are all out.

Real Crapola. Not only is the wire so flimsy that I fear to use it outdoors, but I have tiny ear canals and they shipped with only one small fitting.  Sort of useless.  The sound from my HTC solidly built earbuds is far better and after a year, they are still like new. I bought these overpriced commodity buds because people with auditory challenges appeared to praise them in the main.

Good for the cost. These ear phones work well and are holding up well. My daughter uses them at home so we have not tried them when doing activity yet but the sound is good and they fit well. They came with extra buds.

These don't disappoint. These are without a doubt, some of the best IEMs I've ever used. They fit perfectly, they can be used for basically any genre of music, they're clear, have surprisingly notable bass capabilities, and, for the price, cannot be beat by many other IEMs on the market. Kudos to you, Sony.

Nice but cords are too long for active wear.... The quality of sound is fine and the additional ear bud sizes offer a good selection to fit in your ear comfortably.  My only complaint is that the cords are too long.  I use these connected to my Nano when I'm working-out and I have 4 feet of cord I'm constantly fighting with.  I'm going to have to get some wire strippers and cut a section out and rejoin.

Don't waste your money. Very poor sound quality. No bass and damping total volume. Very disappointed. I have owned and enjoyed 3 pairs of SONY MDR-E10LP Lightweight Earbuds, which have great sound and fit. They don't seem to be available anymore.

Good sounding very affordable headphones.. The headphones are very nice for the price.

I can be very hard on headphones that I wear to work; I always seem to catch the cord on something and it rips them from my ear. Eventually they quit working; imagine that. I needed a headphone that was affordable enough to not cause me anxiety when I ruined them.

These fit comfortably and have surprising sound. I would definitely buy these again.
Backwards?. Work great!  Sound awesome, and the length is ideal for what I use them for...but found that the L fits much better in my right ear, and the R in my left.  Strange!

2 years and going. I got these in 2013 I think. Writing this in 2015. Just yesterday I was cleaning them and I messed up and the left side stopped working. So I went like s***, 2 years, gota order new ones. So I ordered some other brand and just this morning discovered they're still working fine.
No question there about durability.
Sometimes I forget they are on because they fit so nicely.
Bass is good, just the right amount. The highs get kinda tweazy on highest volumes. Mids are great.
Very nice pair of ear buds. Very nice pair of ear buds.  They sound great and fit great and are good to sleep with as well.. bought for my husband and he loves them.

Very good sound quality and snug fit.. This product comes with replaceable rubber pieces to customize the fit, which is great because many other competitive products don't fit my ear well.  Great price for very good sound.

Excellent inexpensive use and abuse headphones.. Excellent inexpensive use and abuse headphones.
Pros:
They have really crisp and clear sound.
They fit comfortably in my ears no discomfort even wearing them while sleeping.
Inexpensive, use them, abuse them, buy a new pair.
Cons:
Slightly flimsy, they will not last forever, but at that price you can hardly expect that.

Uncomfortable. These headphones are still going strong after I've had them for about a year. They have good sound quality and fit snug in the ear to drown out background noise. The only downside is that they can become uncomfortable after wearing them for a bit, even just 15 minutes.

Great value. Considering their price, these earphones are a great value. No, they don't sound as well as my Sennheisers, which cost me more than ten times. They fit nicely in my ears but I don't like the unequal length of the left/right ear cables. I find this design to be a nuisance.

If you're sick of cheap headphones, these are a little bit better. If you don't want to spend $250 on headphones that fit in your ear and are sick of buying the cheap imitation knockoffs that cost $0.01 with $.99 shipping charges, you might be satisfied with these product. They kind of hurt my ear at first but then I realized I hadn't put on the little clear/white ear fitting covers on. Once I put those on they didn't hurt my ear as much and it was easier to hear the music.

comments.comment: This product is OK - you can buy similar quality .... This product is OK - you can buy similar quality at a cheaper price.  I would not spend this much for these headphones again.

comments.comment: Lasted for about 2 years. Product was "5-stars" for about a year, but then the stitching on the leather covering the foam on the part that touches the outside of your ears started to come apart.  I looked to see if this was covered by the warranty, and based off the length of time that I've had them, it is not.

comments.comment:
Very good at NC. Disclosure: I didn't purchase this on Amazon.

Pros: I have been using this for about 2 days.  The noise reduction is really good.  The audio quality is very good, able to pick up the softer tones as well.  The carrying case is very good to have.

Cons: Price is an obvious negative.  Comfort is not as I expected.  I can feel the slight soreness / tug on my ear.

comments.comment:
piece and quiet on the airplane Very comfortable to wear for extended periods of time (e. Finally, piece and quiet on the airplane  Very comfortable to wear for extended periods of time (e.g., 13 hour flights to Tokyo).

The only two complaints are:  1.  your ears get very HOT due to no air circulation; 2. the battery is not rechargable so you are SOL if you forget to pack an extra battery.

comments.comment:
A legendary product. I got my QC almost 7 years ago and it still works like a charm. I use it almost every day. I use it at work, on planes, for leisure, etc. I've scratched it up and abused it to no end, but it still works like it was fresh out of the box. I love the detachable wire. I bent my first one accidentally but got it replace easily.
I'd gladly pay double for something this high quality. I hope the new edition lives up to this ones reputation.

comments.comment: Lifesavers for the frequent flyer. I don't use these much at home, but they really are wonderful on an airplane.  Flying is a much less miserable experience with my Bose headphones.  Even if there's a screaming baby 3 seats away, I simply pop these on and crank up the volume until the little monsters just sound like a faint, distant echo very far away.

comments.comment: Good noise canceling, but not great sound.. I tried these because the Sennheiser Momentum didn't fit my ears.  But once you've heard the sound from the SMs, few can compare, and these just didn't stand up in that department.  Otherwise, they were fine.  Good big ear cups, good build quality, can fold for easy storage and travel, and can keep unwanted sound out like no one's business.

comments.comment: Super Awesome Sounds. Could Be Louder. Tend to Slide Off Head When Leaning. One word: BOSE!  If I had ANY complaint it would be that I'd like them to go a bit louder. Oh, and if you're in ANY sort of leaning position, they seem to slide off real easy... no matter what adjustment I make.  Got pretty annoying on a recent plane ride to Dallas, TX from Boston but overall not that big a problem.

comments.comment: LOVE LOVE. Some of my friends have already bought these headphones for themselves after I raved about them. I fly almost weekly and grew weary of crying babies and sinus-snorting neighbors. These fit comfortably and block most of the noise. They fold neatly into the carrying case which has enough room for my Ipod and reading glasses.

comments.comment: Trial will get you. I decided to try them for the 30 days.  1 flight I was hooked.  Noise pollution greaty diminished.  Changeable battery is the way to go, seems to last a long time.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: best noise cancelling headphones. I purchased these after much debate and more than a few recommendations.  I am glad I finally pulled the trigger on them.  They make flying on a plane so much easier as all that engine noise just goes away.  Now these are not "noise isolating" so they won't really drown out voices since the cancellation algorithm doesn't see that as "noise." Nut even so it will mute them a little bit so they aren't as noticeable.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: cushions start falling apart after a while.. I love these besides the fact that you have to replace the cushions every few years and the Bose brand replacements cost $30. So in addition to a $300 up front cost, there is an average $15 cost each year for new pads. At least the pads are replaceable. I'd like it if they could make them more durable though. It would be nice if they were USB rechargeable instead of requiring AAA batteries. It looks like even the newer models don't do that...

comments.comment: AWEOME!. Words cannot describe how great these headphones are.  They were a lifesaver on the plane and I some of the best money spent.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Perfect. I purchased for my husband to use when we fly.  He has had numerous mastoid surgeries and can hardly hear out of one ear.  He was so amazed that when he tried them, he was able to hear with both ears.  Needless to say it was music to his ears :-)

comments.comment:
Breaking down after a couple years.. As an owner of the QC-15's for over two years, I can say the sound quality is good overall.  When the ambient noise is too great to overcome, the constant popping on and off is annoying.

Additionally, the ear pads are falling apart, the cords are breaking, and the sound quality has diminished over time.  I started noticing the degradation about a year ago.  Keep in mind though, I've used them a LOT.  Not worth $250, but they are decent.  I'd try as many as you possibly can before settling.

comments.comment: Four Stars. Nice but a bit overpriced. You're paying for the noise reduction. If purchasing just for wired sound quality there are other good brands at half the price.

comments.comment: Perfect for Office Environment. We purchased these headphones for a paralegal in a legal office so she could transcribe tapes more easily.  She can no longer hear the copier, her radio, or people talking around her, and the voices on the tapes come out much clearer.  She is very, very happy with the results.

It won't save you from someone shouting nearby.  The plug wears out fast, but is detachable and therefore replaceable.  I go through about 1 AAA battery a month.  I can't leave it on for extended periods because even when it isn't playing it is canceling noise.  I end up with a pressure headache.  Sound quality is very good.

requires batteries to work.. spend ~300$ on a headset and having the spend as much on battery is not a good investment.

Great but....!. First off don't get the idea that these will block out all noise no matter how loud, because they wont, especially if in close proximity to a boom box.
+ Very comfortable for long term wearing.
+ flexible and adjust to a wide variations of head shapes and sizes
- Drains batteries quickly
- the cable it comes with is very poor quality and I had to purchase a more expensive one from a 3rd party
- seems a little overpriced

Purchased for flying, you know, crying babies, people playing music and video games without head phones, etc.  You can also just wear them in noise cancelling mode and they definitely quiet things down.  Very pleased.  A little bulky for traveling but lightweight and comfortable.

comments.comment:
Very nice headphones. Noise-canceling function of these phones is the best around at this price point, if you read online review sites. Over-ear cups fit great, even over my freakish, giant ears. Very light and comfortable. Battery use seems minimal; I haven't had to replace it yet. Most important, hey sound great! Worth the price.

Other notes:
I use in conjunction with an Inada Sogno massage chair, and I can wear these comfortably while my head is in the neck/shoulder unit of that chair.

comments.comment:
Noise cancellation 5 star; sound 3 star. Great for NYC traffic. The noise cancelation will block out most (not all) disturbing sounds of subway.  It will definitely cancel the conversations that you have no business listen to anyway. However, the sound is not up to par with the klipsch or the beats. I still prefer them though b/c none of the competitors can block out noise and be as comfy as these bad boys.

It's OK!

comments.comment: Cord failed within six months. Seriously, Bose, the cord looks awfully flimsy for a $300 item. And it turns out, it actually IS that flimsy. With light use, and no cordwrapping of any kind, the thing started cutting out within six months. Now it's unusable, the internal wire apparently cracked or severed (looks fine on the outside). I'll look into my warranty options, but I Am Not Pleased. Won't by Bose again.

comments.comment: Good Headphones. The headphones are extremely comfortable on the ears. When you turn on the noise cancelling switch, it blocks out nearly all of my surrounding sound so that I only hear what's playing on my mac or phone. When I'm not playing music and I use it for complete silence, I can still hear some things. If I'm in a coffee shop, I will still hear people talking, however I can't understand their entire conversation, it'll just sound muffled. Of course for the price I would've thought the noise-cancelling would be better, but I still like the headphones.

These headphones are really good at noise canceling which will help with hearing all the little sounds that you usually don't hear with other headphones, but the bass isn't as good as beats but I suggest these over beats, Its just better if you like silence when you listen to musics. They cancel out all the sounds on a plane its like your not even on one!!!

comments.comment: Astounding!. I bought a decent, lower-priced set of sound-cancelling earphones by another manufacturer a few years ago. What a waste! The sound quality of these Bose earphones is truly amazing. If you listen to serious music, aka "classical," please don't waste your money on other products. This is as close as it gets to being there. I'm hearing things I just assumed one could not hear outside of the concert hall. I am so glad I finally bought these.

comments.comment: Entering the cone of silence. The more I buy/use Bose products, the more impressed I am. Noise cancellation is phenominal; you can't even hear yourself breathing. Combined with the standard Bose sound quality, listening to music is all the more amazing. It's true that you'll hear things you've never heard before in music you've heard several times before. Well worth the money.

comments.comment: Great!. These headphones are great. The noise-cancelling is awesome. I can still hear someone talk, but I cannot hear the fans on my tower system. Great for focusing on coding. At first, I regretted not getting the wireless version, but now I think I made the right choice, as wireless has issues of its own. This unit lasts about a week or so on a single AAA-battery, and let's you know the battery's dead with a sort of "popping" sound. Just keep a package of fresh batteries near your desk & you'll be fine.

comments.comment: Superb sound reproduction, coupled with active noise reduction. Though a bit pricey, these are the best headphones I've ever tried.  It's really awesome to put them on, even with no audio device connected, then switching them on, and listening almost in unbelief as noise drops by an impressive amount.  Connecting them to my iPod made for an incredible listening experience.  It was as if I were hearing the music for the first time.

comments.comment:
Makes me dizzy.. The Bose QC 15 is the first noise cancellation headphones I've tried out. After trying them out for couple of hours today, I was feeling uncomfortable with it. I read some articles regarding noise cancellation technology causing dizziness and nausea due to low frequency sounds causing sensitive inner ears to vibrate.

Well, I'm going to return this headphones since they were causing discomfort.

comments.comment: Perfect travel / office headphones. Very effective noise isolation - lightweight & comfortable. Compact and well protected when stored in the included case. Tremendous audio quality, very balanced. I have owned Dr. Dre Studio headphones and found them to sound very artificial, lacking in mid-range fidelity, these are much more natural. My only criticisms are the length of the cord (too long) and the battery life (not long enough). However the comfort, convenience, effective noise isolation and great audio quality make these highly recommended. Worth the money.

I also use this set as a headset while flying with an adapter and the noise cancelling doesn't do much, though they are very light and comfortable.

I'm glad I purchased them, use them daily and would definitely recommend.

Best headphones on the planet !!!. When you put those headphones on you feel like in another world.
Noise canceling is amazing. You hear nothing but uninterrupted music.
No outside noise bother your listening experience.
Just the best headphones on the planet.

I even use it on the plane to sleep. I remove plugin cable from the headphones, turn noise canceling on and it's so quiet the I fall asleep like a baby. What an experience. This is the only way I can get a decent sleep on overnight flights.

At home there is no better way to listen music then on this Bose Headphones.

Enjoy.

I've never been much of an audiophile but I wanted these because it's the only way I was gonna get any peace & quiet at my house with the kids & dogs. comments.comment: Excellent product. Mainly use the headphones while traveling on airplanes. Does an excellent job of cancelling out the constant drone of the jet engines and the miscellaneous noises in the cabin. When used in conjunction with an ipod, almost all the noise is eliminated. However, if they announce that the plane is about the crash, you may not hear it.

comments.comment: I generally take very good care and do not handle my electronics (or any .... The left ear pad broke within a month of purchase. I generally take very good care and do not handle my electronics (or any goods) disagreeably. My neighbors upstairs are very noisy folks, and i invested a lot in this headset. Was really low when the ear pad fell apart. Other than that, it user-experience has been average. I am only continuing to use it since i spent so much on it.

comments.comment:
Great sound and SO comfortable to wear. Comfortable and great sounding, these headphones are the best!

They are so effective at blocking out background noise that your kids will NEVER hear you again while wearing these. That's annoying, but the headphones deliver on the heritage of Bose sound quality very well and are so comfortable, you'll forget you have them on.

Everyone in our household has their own pair now, and Bose includes a great case to store/protect the headphones and store accessories.

comments.comment: Oldie But A Goodie. My old QC15's lasted me more than 10 years (although I had to do some padding replacement over that time).  I lost them when I left them on an airplane.  I tried my son's QC25's before deciding to buy the older model again.  I just find them more comfortable.  Glad there are still a few left to buy.

Why do you not have these?!. Fantastic Headphones, probably the best I have ever had the pleasure of wrapping my head with! I wish the cord was a more durable rubber flex one like the sennheiser pc350, but it is a replaceable cors, so I can't complain!
The only complaint I have is that the price went $20 cheaper shortly after I purchased it... always seems to be my luck when buying tech...still.. awesome condition and sound!

comments.comment: Make the world go away. I have had these for about two years now and they have really come in handy for myself and my wife.  They really do cancel out most background noise.  Great for long plane trips, vacuuming the floor, putting the other person's TV show off your radar as you browse the web, etc.  Pretty conspicuous for use in public places but when you have to have a break from what is happening with sound around you, these headphones work.  Sound quality for music is fine, as expected from Bose.

comments.comment:
Great comfort, Good Sound, Bad Design. These headphones are probably the most comfortable headphones I have ever used. Although the sound is fine for me, the bass on this is a little overdone. My friends loved  the noise cancellation but hated the exaggerated bass. I rarely wear these around school because they lack aesthetics completely.
I would recommend these to anyone listening to music at home or on an airplane.

comments.comment: Just buy this FIRST!. Okay, for years I've wanted the Bose noise-cancelling headphones, but I kept buying cheap, and not so cheap knockoffs. I must have 4 sets of noise-cancelling headphones in a rubbermaid tote labelled "headphones". Finally, before my last trip, I just went for it. What a difference! I wasted a lot of dough on the rubbermaid tote phones, but I've found my thrill at last. And the case they give you for storing the phones is awesome. 6 stars!

comments.comment:
Disappointed. I have seen these Bose headphones on airplanes for many years. The alleged benefit was very appealing to me - cut out the continuous background noise.

I finally bought a pair. They do cut out the background noise, but they are so tight that they hurt my head after a few minutes. I can't wear them. $300 down the rat hole !

comments.comment:
Excellent headphones!. I debated for awhile about the Beats Studio by Dr. Dre and the Bose.  The one thing that put me over the edge is the noise cancelling quality and the remote iPhone/iPod control for volume and functions.  I'm very glad I did, as I couldn't be happier with the Bose purchase.  As for quality for a $300 headphone, it's hard to tell right now, as it is plastic, but the sounds quality is superb!

High recommended!!!

Frankly, Bose has done a great job of finding a jet's audio frequency and drowns it out very well but I was hoping the new model would do a better job with other noise like kisds and babies. Disappointing there.

comments.comment: best headphones I've ever owned. Fantastic noise cancelling capabilities.  Any constant noise is eliminated.  Voices not as much, but turn on some music and you're in your own world.  I can't compare against any competitors since I haven't tried them, but the reviews when I bough this indicated it had the best noise-cancelling qualities.  I occasionally forget to turn off the switch and it runs through a battery, so I recommend getting some eneloop batteries and a lacross bc700 charger, so you don't feel like you're wasting money on batteries.

comments.comment: As expected. I have read reviews and viewed reviews on Youtube and so far the Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic is everything I expected.  It comes in a nice case and cords are packaged in durable plastic.  I decided to keep both cords in the plastic package.  The little pocket inside is a nice touch for storing batteries.  I let me my wife try the headphones and she was amazed at the noise canceling feature.  The headphone feels cheap but holds up when I stretch apart. Very light weight.  Hardly tell you are wearing them!

Certainly the look of the Bose is dated and nothing fancy - but like a Toyota Camry it does its job - and well.  You can wear these with little comfort.  They feel nice and noise cancel well.  In fact my wife will use them on long trips to drown out the whining kids.

comments.comment:
Sounded good, but I can't wear noise canceling headphones.  Docking two stars for puny cord.. These did sound pretty good and felt good on my head.  I couldn't keep them though since I discovered that noise canceling headphones give me a headache and put a lot of pressure on my ears.

For $269 headphones though, I really didn't expect the cord and L-shaped connector to be on par with the $4.99 earbuds you can buy at the gas station.  Even if the headphones hadn't hurt my ears, I still would have returned them for this reason.

comments.comment:
Sound is fantastic, but noise cancellation is pure bliss.. I understand that the sound quality is not up to the mark for audiophiles. But if you do not own a BW or Paradigm reference speakers or $500 headphones, Bose will be a big leap for you in terms of sound.
But what makes these headphones a joy to use is the noise cancellation. Its black magic. its that good! Everything sounds better, because you can hear it properly. Even at home, its a big help. Humming refigerators, rattling dishwashers, mixer blenders, all of it just disappears. Its awesome!

comments.comment: Great sound, awesome on airplanes and everyday listening.. Bought these to replace the previous generation Bose headphones I had.  Supposedly better noise cancelling and sound quality.  I guess it does seem to do a better job of cancelling outside noise, but I'm don't have an audiophile ear to really make out better sound quality.  No complaints so five stars from me.

comments.comment:
Drowns out static, but adds interference.. I can't recommend these headphones: They pick up a TON of interference. I can't use them in some environments because my music will be interrupted by the clicking and buzzing. They also chew through batteries like no other. Leave them on overnight and they'll be near dead by morning. Oh, and the cord is awful short.

When they do work as intended, it's pretty blissful. Comfy fit, static is canceled out. The cancellation felt a bit weird to my ears at first, but I got used to it quickly.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment:
Needs some BASS. Best headphone I have ever owned but they are severely missing some bass. When I say some I mean some, even a little would be appreciated but they have almost no bass what so ever.
The noise cancelling is very effective, on flights I often just have them on with no music playing just so that I can get some quiet.
If you listen to music that thrive on good bass then I would not recommend these.
But if you don't care about bass then any other headset would be the wrong choice!
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment:
Battery Required. Please be aware that you can't listen even *without* the noise cancelling if your battery dies.

The battery that came with them (I know, I should have used a fresh one) died twenty minutes into a three hour flight.

Not cool.

Also, it's such a *small* battery.

Would be so much better if they looked into solar powering these things...

Wish I had returned these even though they work great *with* the battery because I have enough to remember in my everyday life without having to worry about a battery for my headphones, but alas, I missed my window.

comments.comment: Great sound quality. Love the sound quality, very clear.  I think calling any headphone Noise Cancelling is a little deceptive, but Bose probably does the best job out there.  Engine noise fades to the background.  Loud announcements are muffled enough so they're not so obnoxious.  Can still hear squealing children, but at least it's not so grating.  Really a bonus when traveling by air.

comments.comment: Good passive headphones are better.. It's ok.  But not _nearly_ as good at noise cancellation as these much cheaper passive headphones:  3M Peltor X-Series Over-the-Head Earmuffs, NRR 31 dB, One Size Fits Most, Black X5A. You can put earbuds under the passive ones and you get great music and huge sound reduction.  Much better effect and much better price than these Bose active phones.

Great Product!!!. I have had these for roughly 24 hours and let me say they are superb! I initially bought the Audio Technica ANC7B and sent them back due to poor sound quality, these are miles apart in sound. The bass on these headphones is perfect, not overbearing like those of Beats by Dre. I also love the ability to talk and change songs on my Apple products. The remote works seamlessly.

The old adage that says you get what you pay for is so true! Stop thinking about the price and just buy them, you will not regret it!

comments.comment:
I like it.. Noise cancelling is great and it's the most comfortable pair I recall ever having.

The biggest drawback I see is that they don't work as regular headphones when the noise cancelling is turned off, like another brand of nc headphones I've had.  These build up pressure and emit a slight hiss that I don't want to put up with when there's no background noise.  It's also a power hog.  Get a lot of batteries or rechargeables.

I got mine used for a big discount, and highly recommend Unclaimed Baggage Center for their customer service.

Occasional flight and some occasional listening at work.  :(  I will be shopping around more carefully this time.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment:
If you can afford these, look no further.. Forget Beats by Dr. Dre, no matter how hyped up they are.

Nothing beats these headphones. From their sound quality to unsurpassed noise cancellation... From their comfort to their battery life... I am a Bose QC QuietComfort guy for as long as they exist.

The extra cable that can open iTunes on Apple devices, control their volume while providing a built-in mic is an excellent perk. Especially if you do a lot of videoconferencing.

comments.comment: Great sound and excellent noise cancelation. Great sound and excellent noise cancelation. Buy some cheap batteries at the dollar store as it uses one a  2 weeks if you use it every day.

comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Bose QuietComfort 15 ANC. This is a great ANC headset.  Its very light and truly performs and totally dampens the noise in the A/C cabin where I used it.  Did not try at home, however, in aircraft, you will hardly even notice that the engine is on and the aircraft is flying.  Would not recommend it for pilots as you would not notice if your engine is running or not!!

comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Excellent headphones. I already own a pair of Bose Around ear headphones(AE2) and wanted to give this a try. These headphones beat my expectations. They are very comfortable to wear,sound the best i heard till date and most of all, the noise cancelling is awesome. These take just one AAA battery as opposed two by Beats and Souls..and the battery life is amazing. Overall these headphones are worth their price and are the best you can get in this price range. Get this one and you won't be disappointed!

While traveling on airplanes and using them you literally experience a whole new world of clarity and sound.  If you are considering a set of noise cancelling headphones you won't go wrong with these super performing ones.  Enjoy.

Bad - no option to listen without noise cancelling feature.

comments.comment: Work great but. Had to replace my Sony headphones that I broke so went ahead and upgraded to Bose. They work great but not any better than my Sonys did for the difference in price.

comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: I gotten mine at 2013 (you can check my purchase .... I gotten mine at 2013 (you can check my purchase history) and now (after a mere 2.5 years of usage), the right speaker fail to function properly. This is supposed to be a premium product based on the price we are paying but the quality just isn't there. I've a friend who complained that he was encountering the same issue with his QC-25! What's BOSE doing?
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Not sure it's worth the price but still very happy with these. I love how they did NOT hard wire the cord into the headphones. I did not realize I'd belted the cord into my airplane seat so somehow I managed to pull the cord out of the headphones. Much better than stressing it. Love how they nearly eliminate airplane noise but I was disappointed how vocal frequencies were easily discernible yet not intelligible. So, true noise is virtually eliminated but not all sound as I would prefer.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: IDEAL for travelling!. No complaints whatsoever!!! These things rock on planes and anywhere you want to drown out the idiots around you. Bose did an outstanding job designing these. I truly love them.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment:
Best.. Best there are, I live on a plane and these things are a life saver..........

Don't expect them to fully block noise though, I think you have to have the right expectations for these things, they will block the low humming engine noise of the plane by themselves (noise canceling) then as soon as you play any music even at low volume noise starts to disappear.

Highly recommend.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment:
What's all the fuss about?. They're quite comfortable--sort of: they're loose, and they move around, so it feels like they're going to fall off. They do a decent job with mid range. Bass is dramatically overdone. Trebble reproduction is an odious, smeary cacophony and the reason I returned them.

Update:

Twelfth time's the charm... Got a pair of Sennheiser HD25-1 II. They sound great (even with a lousy source like a smart phone) and block noise quite well without "noise cancelling". They're also quite a lot cheaper than the QC 15 and all parts are replaceable!
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Great sound with no background. I use the Bose headset to kill the noise on long airline flights.  It does an unbelievably good job of producing the recorded sound and blocking the extraneous noise.  Worked so well I tried it in the dentist's office but found the noise there is generated internally and can't be blocked.  The set is comfortable for wearing hours' on end and seldom requires battery replacement.  Expensive, but worth the price if you have a need for noise cancellation.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Nice. Nice. Does require AAA batteries to operate, or it's useless. Also note that the phone jack needs to be properly configured. Remove it from the headphone to do so. You will see what I mean.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Five Stars. wear on the airplane all the time, can't travel without them!
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Fell apart after 2 years light use. Bought two pair of these a couple of years ago.  Both have started to fall apart with light use.  The phone ear pieces on both units have completely fallen apart with the cheap green foam sticking out.  They are useless at this point.  Paid $600 for 2 headphones that are junk.  Do not buy!

comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Five Stars. The best noise canceling headphones I've tried.  They work well on a plane or car ride.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Peace and Quiet. FINALLY, peace and quiet when I'm on an airplane or laying by a pool......or when the twin grandsons are yelling.  The case and compartments are awesome.  Easy to take when traveling.  Love it.
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment:
Padding flakes after six months, can't get replacement. The headphones are good - maybe not the best - but solid noise cancelling functions and comfortable.

The padding material (ear piece and across the headband)are of a very poor quality and start flaking after about 6-12 months.

You can buy replacement ear piece padding but not the headband, which means you end up looking like you have terrible black dandruff as the vinyl headband padding gradually works it's way off onto your head.

Really poor effort not having a replacement for this component Bose!!!
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

comments.comment: Airline jet noise disapears.. Works great on airplanes, almost eliminates the jet noise. The plug in adaptor also provides clear audio from airplane sound system
comments.related_to: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
comments.discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

discussion_name: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

ngram_comments: Great product.. I looked at an number of other options for NC headphones and ended up going with the Bose.  The noise cancelling is incredible and they are very comfortable.  I don't know a person that owns these and is disappointed in the performance.
Eh. Noise cancelling feature is nice, but the sound sucks

best noise cancelling headphones. I purchased these after much debate and more than a few recommendations.  I am glad I finally pulled the trigger on them.  They make flying on a plane so much easier as all that engine noise just goes away.  Now these are not "noise isolating" so they won't really drown out voices since the cancellation algorithm doesn't see that as "noise." Nut even so it will mute them a little bit so they aren't as noticeable.

requires batteries to work.. spend ~300$ on a headset and having the spend as much on battery is not a good investment.
The device work well though, but they should have made it work without the battery as well, even it the noise cancelling if off.

Great for air travel.. Very good noise cancelation.  Better than average sound, not quite as good sound quaility as my HiFiMan but not in the same price category.  These are just great for travel.  Purchased for flying, you know, crying babies, people playing music and video games without head phones, etc.  You can also just wear them in noise cancelling mode and they definitely quiet things down.  Very pleased.  A little bulky for traveling but lightweight and comfortable.

Good Headphones. The headphones are extremely comfortable on the ears. When you turn on the noise cancelling switch, it blocks out nearly all of my surrounding sound so that I only hear what's playing on my mac or phone. When I'm not playing music and I use it for complete silence, I can still hear some things. If I'm in a coffee shop, I will still hear people talking, however I can't understand their entire conversation, it'll just sound muffled. Of course for the price I would've thought the noise-cancelling would be better, but I still like the headphones.

good sound not as comfortable as i remember. I tried on several of these headphones in the stores. They were the most comfortable I had ever worn.  Sound is great and noise cancelling is excellent but after wearing for 20-30 minutes they start to hurt my ears.  I do have big ears and they stick out from my head so I guess it is partially my fault.

Great!. These headphones are great. The noise-cancelling is awesome. I can still hear someone talk, but I cannot hear the fans on my tower system. Great for focusing on coding. At first, I regretted not getting the wireless version, but now I think I made the right choice, as wireless has issues of its own. This unit lasts about a week or so on a single AAA-battery, and let's you know the battery's dead with a sort of "popping" sound. Just keep a package of fresh batteries near your desk & you'll be fine.

Fantastic!. Bought these before a long international flight and was very impressed.  The sound quality is good, but the noise cancelling is almost magic.  It almost completely eliminates engine noise when on an airplane.  I also use them in my office to eliminate the noise from the large vent directly above my desk.

I was also impressed with the various cables and adapters included with the headphones.  The case also includes a small mesh pocket - presumably for extra batteries, but my ipod Nano fits in their perfectly as well.

Pretty Good. Pretty good headset.  I use them on my computer and they are quite a bit louder than my other ($50 headphones).  This is nice, the sound cancelling isn't anywhere near as effective as I expected.  They basically remove a lot of the ambient noise but you'll still hear even relatively quiet sounds happening around you.  I also use this set as a headset while flying with an adapter and the noise cancelling doesn't do much, though they are very light and comfortable.

I'm glad I purchased them, use them daily and would definitely recommend.

Excellent product. Mainly use the headphones while traveling on airplanes. Does an excellent job of cancelling out the constant drone of the jet engines and the miscellaneous noises in the cabin. When used in conjunction with an ipod, almost all the noise is eliminated. However, if they announce that the plane is about the crash, you may not hear it.

The Greatest. I really enjoy these although they are pricey.  I use them in a communications environment.  The noise cancelling works very well.  I wish someone would come up with some headphones that could be powered via the audio cable.  I end up going through a lot of batteries.

Just buy this FIRST!. Okay, for years I've wanted the Bose noise-cancelling headphones, but I kept buying cheap, and not so cheap knockoffs. I must have 4 sets of noise-cancelling headphones in a rubbermaid tote labelled "headphones". Finally, before my last trip, I just went for it. What a difference! I wasted a lot of dough on the rubbermaid tote phones, but I've found my thrill at last. And the case they give you for storing the phones is awesome. 6 stars!

Excellent headphones!. I debated for awhile about the Beats Studio by Dr. Dre and the Bose.  The one thing that put me over the edge is the noise cancelling quality and the remote iPhone/iPod control for volume and functions.  I'm very glad I did, as I couldn't be happier with the Bose purchase.  As for quality for a $300 headphone, it's hard to tell right now, as it is plastic, but the sounds quality is superb!

High recommended!!!

best headphones I've ever owned. Fantastic noise cancelling capabilities.  Any constant noise is eliminated.  Voices not as much, but turn on some music and you're in your own world.  I can't compare against any competitors since I haven't tried them, but the reviews when I bough this indicated it had the best noise-cancelling qualities.  I occasionally forget to turn off the switch and it runs through a battery, so I recommend getting some eneloop batteries and a lacross bc700 charger, so you don't feel like you're wasting money on batteries.
awesome. I saw some videos compare this headphone with Beat on Youtube. then I think this is the right one I should buy. noise cancelling is so good!

VERY GOOD. this is a very good headphones,noise cancelling and sound is very quality. BOSE is very good.
I like this product very much.

Great sound, awesome on airplanes and everyday listening.. Bought these to replace the previous generation Bose headphones I had.  Supposedly better noise cancelling and sound quality.  I guess it does seem to do a better job of cancelling outside noise, but I'm don't have an audiophile ear to really make out better sound quality.  No complaints so five stars from me.

Needs some BASS. Best headphone I have ever owned but they are severely missing some bass. When I say some I mean some, even a little would be appreciated but they have almost no bass what so ever.
The noise cancelling is very effective, on flights I often just have them on with no music playing just so that I can get some quiet.
If you listen to music that thrive on good bass then I would not recommend these.
But if you don't care about bass then any other headset would be the wrong choice!

Battery Required. Please be aware that you can't listen even *without* the noise cancelling if your battery dies.

The battery that came with them (I know, I should have used a fresh one) died twenty minutes into a three hour flight.

Not cool.

Also, it's such a *small* battery.

Would be so much better if they looked into solar powering these things...

Wish I had returned these even though they work great *with* the battery because I have enough to remember in my everyday life without having to worry about a battery for my headphones, but alas, I missed my window.

Amazing!. Bought it as a gift for my brother! He fell in love with it. Could not believe what great sound it has as well as the noise cancelling feature that is ideal for his travels and love for music. Great gift!

Flaking earpieces and headband. Noise cancelling is good, and I like the sound, but considering how much it costs, you think Bose would use better material when constructing the unit.  The headband and earpieces essentially "flaked" apart, leaving black crud everywhere..sad...

Great sound quality. Love the sound quality, very clear.  I think calling any headphone Noise Cancelling is a little deceptive, but Bose probably does the best job out there.  Engine noise fades to the background.  Loud announcements are muffled enough so they're not so obnoxious.  Can still hear squealing children, but at least it's not so grating.  Really a bonus when traveling by air.
but the best noise cancelling I've heard. Eats up batteries a bit quickly, but the best noise cancelling I've heard; wear all day every day at work.

I like it.. Noise cancelling is great and it's the most comfortable pair I recall ever having.

The biggest drawback I see is that they don't work as regular headphones when the noise cancelling is turned off, like another brand of nc headphones I've had.  These build up pressure and emit a slight hiss that I don't want to put up with when there's no background noise.  It's also a power hog.  Get a lot of batteries or rechargeables.

I got mine used for a big discount, and highly recommend Unclaimed Baggage Center for their customer service.

The best headphones on the market!. I tried many different types of headphones and earbuds. Looking for the best quality audio response and and noise cancelling.

These headphones just work for me.

Pros- Great quality audio and noise canceeling, Lighweight. Easy to use
Cons - No Android phone adapter (works only on Iphone). Audio not the loudest I've heard. Price.

as advertised. If you have never heard the noise cancelling feature of these headphones you are missing something!
The sound from background noise is totally muffled whether you are listening to music or not.
Very relaxing!
The actual speakers are as good or better than other non noise cancelling headphones
A bit expensive, but worth it!

Nice but the ANC hurts my eardrums. I had these for a year and liked them at first. But over time I noticed that my eardrums sometimes hurt from the active noise cancelling, but there was no way to turn it off without still getting audio. I just couldn't use these anymore for regular music listening.

I went with the Sennheiser PXC 450, and think they are superior to the Bose.
... -but the noise cancelling and sound quality are very good.. Makes my ears "sweat" after an hour or so -but the noise cancelling and sound quality are very good.

Not Impressed. I read so many glowing reviews. I was expecting fantastic noise cancelling. I am not impressed. The noise cancelling is not that much better than my $70 Audio Technica earbuds. The construction of the earpiece mounts looks weak. The battery compartment seems flimsy. For as much as these cost, they should be better. I returned them for a refund.
needs batteries!  cannot recharge.. what?  noise cancelling headphones that i can't charge?  what the hell is that?  i had to buy a boat load of triple a batteries.
Great Noise Cancelling Headphones. Wife uses them on all our trips. Comfortable for long term use. Cuts out outside noise really well. No problems yet.
Five Stars. Best noise cancelling headphones I've ever used.  They even work with my iPhone.

Excellent headphones. I already own a pair of Bose Around ear headphones(AE2) and wanted to give this a try. These headphones beat my expectations. They are very comfortable to wear,sound the best i heard till date and most of all, the noise cancelling is awesome. These take just one AAA battery as opposed two by Beats and Souls..and the battery life is amazing. Overall these headphones are worth their price and are the best you can get in this price range. Get this one and you won't be disappointed!

Best of the Best!. These Bose Headphones set the standard for quality and performance. While traveling on airplanes and using them you literally experience a whole new world of clarity and sound.  If you are considering a set of noise cancelling headphones you won't go wrong with these super performing ones.  Enjoy.

The best noise cancelling headphones out there. Good - Well designed, great dynamic sound and noise reduction is the best out there.
Bad - no option to listen without noise cancelling feature.

What's all the fuss about?. They're quite comfortable--sort of: they're loose, and they move around, so it feels like they're going to fall off. They do a decent job with mid range. Bass is dramatically overdone. Trebble reproduction is an odious, smeary cacophony and the reason I returned them.

Update:

Twelfth time's the charm... Got a pair of Sennheiser HD25-1 II. They sound great (even with a lousy source like a smart phone) and block noise quite well without "noise cancelling". They're also quite a lot cheaper than the QC 15 and all parts are replaceable!

Padding flakes after six months, can't get replacement. The headphones are good - maybe not the best - but solid noise cancelling functions and comfortable.

The padding material (ear piece and across the headband)are of a very poor quality and start flaking after about 6-12 months.

You can buy replacement ear piece padding but not the headband, which means you end up looking like you have terrible black dandruff as the vinyl headband padding gradually works it's way off onto your head.

Really poor effort not having a replacement for this component Bose!!!

Spendy but worth it. Blocks out almost all background noises like crying kids, nearby conversations and engine noise. Wore these on a flight to Hawaii and got there with a much better piece of mind. Excellent sound quality for the in flight entertainment

Good noise canceling, but not great sound.. I tried these because the Sennheiser Momentum didn't fit my ears.  But once you've heard the sound from the SMs, few can compare, and these just didn't stand up in that department.  Otherwise, they were fine.  Good big ear cups, good build quality, can fold for easy storage and travel, and can keep unwanted sound out like no one's business.

Breaking down after a couple years.. As an owner of the QC-15's for over two years, I can say the sound quality is good overall.  When the ambient noise is too great to overcome, the constant popping on and off is annoying.

Additionally, the ear pads are falling apart, the cords are breaking, and the sound quality has diminished over time.  I started noticing the degradation about a year ago.  Keep in mind though, I've used them a LOT.  Not worth $250, but they are decent.  I'd try as many as you possibly can before settling.
Four Stars. Nice but a bit overpriced. You're paying for the noise reduction. If purchasing just for wired sound quality there are other good brands at half the price.

I haven't found a better set. Cancels most background noise. Expensive, but effective.  I haven't found a better set.  Cancels most background noise.  It won't save you from someone shouting nearby.  The plug wears out fast, but is detachable and therefore replaceable.  I go through about 1 AAA battery a month.  I can't leave it on for extended periods because even when it isn't playing it is canceling noise.  I end up with a pressure headache.  Sound quality is very good.
Only 4 stars. I have to go with 4 stars, because the sound is excellent,  but the cables for it are too thin to match the price and quality!

Astounding!. I bought a decent, lower-priced set of sound-cancelling earphones by another manufacturer a few years ago. What a waste! The sound quality of these Bose earphones is truly amazing. If you listen to serious music, aka "classical," please don't waste your money on other products. This is as close as it gets to being there. I'm hearing things I just assumed one could not hear outside of the concert hall. I am so glad I finally bought these.

Entering the cone of silence. The more I buy/use Bose products, the more impressed I am. Noise cancellation is phenominal; you can't even hear yourself breathing. Combined with the standard Bose sound quality, listening to music is all the more amazing. It's true that you'll hear things you've never heard before in music you've heard several times before. Well worth the money.

Perfect travel / office headphones. Very effective noise isolation - lightweight & comfortable. Compact and well protected when stored in the included case. Tremendous audio quality, very balanced. I have owned Dr. Dre Studio headphones and found them to sound very artificial, lacking in mid-range fidelity, these are much more natural. My only criticisms are the length of the cord (too long) and the battery life (not long enough). However the comfort, convenience, effective noise isolation and great audio quality make these highly recommended. Worth the money.

Great product! Highly recommended!. Great product! Highly recommended! Best noise canceling out there. Period! You can argue all day long about sound quality etc... but at the end of the day if you want great noise cancellation with good or close to great sound quality, Bose is the best!

Noise cancellation is good, sound quality is average, wired-only is so 90-ish.. Like it, but do not use it so often because of lack of wireless option. I've attached it to portable BT music receiver but it still looks a bit bulky. Native solution from Bose would be really appreciated.

Solid headphone. Works as described. Noise reduction is good but probably not that much better than a Kensington headphone that I had at a fraction of the price. Sound quality good but not compared to wired headphones I have owned. A little bit muddy  in the middle.

Fantastic!. Bought these before a long international flight and was very impressed.  The sound quality is good, but the noise cancelling is almost magic.  It almost completely eliminates engine noise when on an airplane.  I also use them in my office to eliminate the noise from the large vent directly above my desk.

I was also impressed with the various cables and adapters included with the headphones.  The case also includes a small mesh pocket - presumably for extra batteries, but my ipod Nano fits in their perfectly as well.

Disappointed. Very Disappointed. Disappointed. Very Disappointed. For first 2 weeks I really liked the sound quality and Noise canceling. However, after 2 weeks suddenly Music sound ripped at random point. If it was s***ty 40 ~ 50 dollar headphone, I would just ignore it, but if it is $ 299.99 headphone, I will not accept this situation.

Very comfortable and very high quality build. Very comfortable and very high quality build. Excellent sound quality, and very good noise reduction. It was not clear to me when I purchased this, but you cannot listen to music without turning these "on" and using the battery and the noise reduction feature. It's all or nothing with these. The noise reduction alone is very good, but when you play some quiet music, the effective noise reduction is almost total.

So good I can't hear my kids crying. Awesome! I've never been much of an audiophile but I wanted these because it's the only way I was gonna get any peace & quiet at my house with the kids & dogs. The sound quality is impressive for sure but the noise canceling is amazing. Way better than I expected. I literally can't hear my kids crying. Golden.

Great sound and SO comfortable to wear. Comfortable and great sounding, these headphones are the best!

They are so effective at blocking out background noise that your kids will NEVER hear you again while wearing these. That's annoying, but the headphones deliver on the heritage of Bose sound quality very well and are so comfortable, you'll forget you have them on.

Everyone in our household has their own pair now, and Bose includes a great case to store/protect the headphones and store accessories.

Bose is boss. Best headphones you can buy!  I got rid of my beats and got these.  It's amazing to use them on an airplane.  You take them off and it seems so loud!  Really blocks out the sound and has superior sound quality.  I am a Bose fan for life.

Make the world go away. I have had these for about two years now and they have really come in handy for myself and my wife.  They really do cancel out most background noise.  Great for long plane trips, vacuuming the floor, putting the other person's TV show off your radar as you browse the web, etc.  Pretty conspicuous for use in public places but when you have to have a break from what is happening with sound around you, these headphones work. Excellent headphones!. I debated for awhile about the Beats Studio by Dr. Dre and the Bose. VERY GOOD. this is a very good headphones,noise cancelling and sound is very quality. BOSE is very good.

Sound is fantastic, but noise cancellation is pure bliss.. I understand that the sound quality is not up to the mark for audiophiles. But if you do not own a BW or Paradigm reference speakers or $500 headphones, Bose will be a big leap for you in terms of sound.
But what makes these headphones a joy to use is the noise cancellation. Its black magic. its that good! Everything sounds better, because you can hear it properly. Even at home, its a big help. Humming refigerators, rattling dishwashers, mixer blenders, all of it just disappears. Its awesome!

Great sound, awesome on airplanes and everyday listening.. Bought these to replace the previous generation Bose headphones I had.  Supposedly better noise cancelling and sound quality.
