the best. Best headphones ever. Bose is the best quality of any type of audio device. I have multiple bose products from Bluetooth headset to a bose sound system. You can never go wrong with bose. A true luxury brand.

Amazing headphones. This was a birthday gift for my husband. He uses it everyday now and absolutely loves it. The headphones are very comfortable and cover the entire ear. The sound quality are exceptional.

Bose Quiet Comfort 15 Headset. Arrived well packed and in good shape. Used these for a trip to Peru from the U.S. Midwest. They worked very well in my opinion. Sound mitigation was great. Sound quality was very good.  Were comfortable even while they were on my head during a nap. Will use them for all of my long distance flights.

Great sound quality. Love the sound quality, very clear.  I think calling any headphone Noise Cancelling is a little deceptive, but Bose probably does the best job out there.  Engine noise fades to the background.  Loud announcements are muffled enough so they're not so obnoxious.  Can still hear squealing children, but at least it's not so grating. Breaking down after a couple years.. As an owner of the QC-15's for over two years, I can say the sound quality is good overall.  When the ambient noise is too great to overcome, the constant popping on and off is annoying.

Other notes:
I use in conjunction with an Inada Sogno massage chair, and I can wear these comfortably while my head is in the neck/shoulder unit of that chair.
Nothing but the best from this company each and every time!. You just cannot beat them. A little pricey but well worth it. Great sound and or use for noise reduction.

The set is comfortable for wearing hours' on end and seldom requires battery replacement.  Expensive, but worth the price if you have a need for noise cancellation.

Solid headphone. Works as described. Noise reduction is good but probably not that much better than a Kensington headphone that I had at a fraction of the price. Sound quality good but not compared to wired headphones I have owned. A little bit muddy  in the middle.

So good I can't hear my kids crying. Awesome! I've never been much of an audiophile but I wanted these because it's the only way I was gonna get any peace & quiet at my house with the kids & dogs. The sound quality is impressive for sure but the noise canceling is amazing. Way better than I expected. I literally can't hear my kids crying. Golden.

Battery Required. Please be aware that you can't listen even *without* the noise cancelling if your battery dies.

The battery that came with them (I know, I should have used a fresh one) died twenty minutes into a three hour flight.

Not cool.

Also, it's such a *small* battery.

Would be so much better if they looked into solar powering these things...

Wish I had returned these even though they work great *with* the battery because I have enough to remember in my everyday life without having to worry about a battery for my headphones, but alas, I missed my window.
Best Noise Canceling headphones. My favorite headphones.  The noise cancellation is much better than other fancier brands I've tried.  I take this every where I travel.

Flaking earpieces and headband. Noise cancelling is good, and I like the sound, but considering how much it costs, you think Bose would use better material when constructing the unit.  The headband and earpieces essentially "flaked" apart, leaving black crud everywhere..sad...

Good passive headphones are better.. It's ok.  But not _nearly_ as good at noise cancellation as these much cheaper passive headphones:  3M Peltor X-Series Over-the-Head Earmuffs, NRR 31 dB, One Size Fits Most, Black X5A. You can put earbuds under the passive ones and you get great music and huge sound reduction.  Much better effect and much better price than these Bose active phones.
Three Stars. great on planes.  not as quiet as I had hoped but much better than nothing

Great Headphones for Air Travel. This is my second set of Bose headphones. While I love my QC3's, an ear injury meant I could no longer use an "on the ear" type of headphone. These were a good replacement, but not a perfect one. QC3 definitely sound better than these. these have more of a "tinny" sound to them, and heavy bass drum make then sound almost like a blown car speaker....not the excellent quality I've been used to with Bose over the years. Excellent for movies and music without much bass.

Not Impressed. I read so many glowing reviews. I was expecting fantastic noise cancelling. I am not impressed. The noise cancelling is not that much better than my $70 Audio Technica earbuds. The construction of the earpiece mounts looks weak. The battery compartment seems flimsy. For as much as these cost, they should be better. I returned them for a refund.

Not sure it's worth the price but still very happy with these. I love how they did NOT hard wire the cord into the headphones. I did not realize I'd belted the cord into my airplane seat so somehow I managed to pull the cord out of the headphones. Much better than stressing it. Love how they nearly eliminate airplane noise but I was disappointed how vocal frequencies were easily discernible yet not intelligible. So, true noise is virtually eliminated but not all sound as I would prefer.
Four Stars. Nice but a bit overpriced. You're paying for the noise reduction. If purchasing just for wired sound quality there are other good brands at half the price.
Four Stars. Good quality overall but would not purchase again unless they were Bluetooth enabled
Four Stars. Brought a used one. It was a bit more used then advertised. I had to replace the cushions.
Four Stars. use regularly but occasional go in and out  if move head  too much
Four Stars. These are great headphones. But you should get the new ones (QC 25) at bose.com.
Four Stars. Superb sound and very good at blocking out background on a plane.  Well worth the cost.
Four Stars. these are nice but like the completely over the ear ones better
Four Stars. Wife uses them everyday, only problem the headphones uses up batteries fast
Five Stars. Great at repetitive noise cancellation (airline engines, fans, etc.)  A bit pricey but comfortable and work well

Spendy but worth it. Blocks out almost all background noises like crying kids, nearby conversations and engine noise. Wore these on a flight to Hawaii and got there with a much better piece of mind. Excellent sound quality for the in flight entertainment

best noise cancelling headphones. I purchased these after much debate and more than a few recommendations.  I am glad I finally pulled the trigger on them.  They make flying on a plane so much easier as all that engine noise just goes away.  Now these are not "noise isolating" so they won't really drown out voices since the cancellation algorithm doesn't see that as "noise." Nut even so it will mute them a little bit so they aren't as noticeable.

Excellent noise reduction!. I got the headset for travel and to use at work. On the aircraft, it significantly cuts down on the engine noise. Works as advertised! I can listen to movies at normal volume.

Fantastic!. Bought these before a long international flight and was very impressed.  The sound quality is good, but the noise cancelling is almost magic.  It almost completely eliminates engine noise when on an airplane.  I also use them in my office to eliminate the noise from the large vent directly above my desk.

I was also impressed with the various cables and adapters included with the headphones.  The case also includes a small mesh pocket - presumably for extra batteries, but my ipod Nano fits in their perfectly as well.

Excellent product. Mainly use the headphones while traveling on airplanes. Does an excellent job of cancelling out the constant drone of the jet engines and the miscellaneous noises in the cabin. When used in conjunction with an ipod, almost all the noise is eliminated. However, if they announce that the plane is about the crash, you may not hear it.

Great product from Bose. You have to have this head phones from Bose if you are a frequent traveler, especially for long haul flights. I'm from Asia and I frequently travel in the US. It cancels the noise from the airplane's engines and gives you a clear sound from the movie that you are watching. Dozing off while in flight won't be a problem, this one will do the trick - giving you a nice & clear sound of music from your mp3 player. Its worth every dollar.

Great sound quality. Love the sound quality, very clear.  I think calling any headphone Noise Cancelling is a little deceptive, but Bose probably does the best job out there.  Engine noise fades to the background.  Loud announcements are muffled enough so they're not so obnoxious.  Can still hear squealing children, but at least it's not so grating.  Really a bonus when traveling by air.

Recommended. Definitely worth the extra $$$. I was hesitant, as I've owned about three other brands of noise canceling headphones, but none compare to these. Great for the airplane at drowning out the plane engines, A/C and passenger side conversations!

Bose QuietComfort 15 ANC. This is a great ANC headset.  Its very light and truly performs and totally dampens the noise in the A/C cabin where I used it.  Did not try at home, however, in aircraft, you will hardly even notice that the engine is on and the aircraft is flying.  Would not recommend it for pilots as you would not notice if your engine is running or not!!

Best.. Best there are, I live on a plane and these things are a life saver..........

Don't expect them to fully block noise though, I think you have to have the right expectations for these things, they will block the low humming engine noise of the plane by themselves (noise canceling) then as soon as you play any music even at low volume noise starts to disappear.

Highly recommend.

comments.comment:
A very nice, polite headphone. A very nice, polite headphone. This is my go to travel headphone. Not just commuting but vacation, etc.
If you keep the volume at a 3/4 level from your personal Loud setting, you will have a great listening
experience. At louder levels they do begin to distort and become harsh. They are not quite Audiophile level,
but do great at a lower volume level. The noise canceling is very good, and help to make loud rooms/spaces
sublimely quiet again. Very comfortable, compact, well suited for the road.

comments.comment: Great unless you have hair.. I wanted to like these.  They are comfortable, lightweight and sound good.  They continue to work at a reduced volume when the battery dies.  There is however -what is to me- a fatal flaw.  The design grabs your hair where they pivot.  I have ripped out countless strands of hair taking them off and Im sick of it.  I won't use them anymore.  I give them two stars because I suppose they are usable by someone without hair.

comments.comment:
QC should stand for Quality Control. On my first pair, no audio came out of the right speaker. I called Bose and they determined the headset was defective. My replacement pair (brand new from Amazon, not a refurb from Bose) had the exact same problem.

I then googled "Bose qc25 one speaker not working" and found pages of results from people with the same issue. Some claim the issue was resolved after 2015, but both of my pairs were purchased in 2017.

Sadly, I'm going to have to look for a different brand.

comments.comment:
Wonderful sound quality, top notch noise canceling, burns through batteries.. These are great headphones, and the noise canceling is top quality. When my cat gets annoying and starts meowing really loudly, I just flip the switch and hear total silence. My one issue is that the noise canceling burns through batteries like nobody's business, and I wish they could just charge by plugging in to a USB or something like that. Otherwise, amazing sound quality, bass is great but not overbearing, and comes with a handy carrying case.
I have not tried the microphone, but I'm sure it's wonderful.

comments.comment:
Noise cancelling very effective but not perfect. Noise cancelling works very well no only on white noises but also on speech and music.  However, at high frequency the cancelling is less effective.

Music playback quality is good.  The frequency response is different when noise cancellation is turned on or off.  Overall, high frequency response is lacking, making the sound a bit muffled.

The headset is light and comfortable.  The carrying case is a plus.  However, mechanical design can be improved to make the headphone more compact when folded.

Can wear all day. Replacing my disintagrated quiet comfort 1that I had for 7 years. Very very comfortable which is the primary reason for sticking with Bose. Good enough for day to day use. Not recommended for studio work.

comments.comment: Poor build quality, widespread reports of failures.  Look elsewhere.. The headphones are great while they work.  Unfortunately, Bose's build quality is poor, and there are widespread reports of dead speakers.  I only learned this after my Bose QC25s, with no physical damage or rough treatment, stopped working.  These things have maybe ~100 total hours of use, though over a period of time that puts me just outside the warranty window.  Bose customer service offered me a replacement set for $225.  Hahahaha.  Take your business elsewhere, as I will for my replacement headphones.

comments.comment:
Best headphone... until it lasted. Best headphone I ever head. Use it mostly for airplane and listening music, sometimes I forget how noisy the ambient can be.

Edit: So just over 1 year, the right headphone stopped working. If I put pressure on it sometimes it works. By quick googling I saw lots of people have the same problem.

comments.comment: Left Ear Stopped Working A Year In. The left ear stopped working a little after 1 year.  I found a fix online where you need to create a paper shim and insert it into inside of the electronics so that a copper wire will once again be in contact with the speaker membrane.  So it's temporarily solved for right now, but this shouldn't be happening.

comments.comment: A couple of caveats. The earphone are excellent for sound and sound cancelling, as have been the previous versions and as many others have noted.  The  folding design is somewhat cumbersome, however, and the cushions are an issue.  One of mine started coming apart after about two years. As one can see, replacements sets are sold, confirmation that there is a quality control problem here.  I super-glued mine back together, but it was tedious. Except for these two concerns, the 25's are fine.

ngram_comments: Great on a plane. I was skeptical of this entire genre of headphones.  #1 the sounds is great.  #2 the noise cancelling on a plane or in an office not only works but works really well.  I could not hear the plane but could have a conversation without shouting.  ONly reason they are a 4 is after a few hours of straight use they get hot.  Might be expected but I was unhappy to have to take them off and listen to the rest of the world while cooling off my ears.

Best Noise Cancelling Headphones in this price range. Incredible headphones. These headphones are so comfortable and fit well on my head. Noise Cancelling is amazing, in fact we played the "whisper challenge" where we use these headphones, listen to music and someone tries to talk to you, and you have to say what that person said. Let me say no one could get a word correct even though they were right in front of you. The only con to these headphones is the price, $300 will put a small dent in your pockets.

These are my most favorite product EVER. These are my most favorite product EVER. I have multiple bose headphones but this headphone blown my mind away when I used the noise cancelling. It is a truly amazing product and I hope whoever wants to purchase them purchase it. It is truly an amazing product. I wanted a headphone that allowed me to change batteries unlike the 35s. This fit the bill.

These are absolutely amazing. The noise cancelling is reported to be the .... These are absolutely amazing. The noise cancelling is reported to be the best in the market. I am happy to report that it is! While audio quality is not the best and neutral sounding (it has some rolled off highs), the clarity of it is amazing. When anything is playing over the headphones, the outside world is tuned out.

Sorry Bose. I'm a Huge Bose fan!  I wanted these headphones for a couple of years and then bought them for my birthday.  I was really disappointed... the sound quality was not what I expected.  Yes, there was enormous noise cancelling capabilities, but the music sounded like I was using a very cheap pair of headphones.  I hate to be critical of Bose... but these just didn't do these for me.

The best noise cancelling on the market.  I tried 15 different kinds.. Tried many noise cancelling, and while these are too expensive, they are hands down the best.  I cannot believe that no other vendor can even come close.  I really hope they will so we can get a less expensive but viable option.

many cross country/international trips under my belt with these I can say these do an excellent job of noise cancellation and mu. With many, many cross country/international trips under my belt with these I can say these do an excellent job of noise cancellation and music reproduction.

I've heard (from a pilot) that the in-ear Bose are even better but I've not tried them yet.  I do have a pair of in-ear noise cancelling ear buds but have yet to dig them out of my backpack which tells you how much I like the QC25.

Fantastic!!. Fantastic!!! We bought cheaper noise cancelling headphones before, but I guess you get what you pay for. Those are so much better and the listening quality during our last flight was great. I will buy a second one when they are back on sale.

I love these! They sound good and the noise cancelling .... I love these! They sound good and the noise cancelling is second to none. I'm very satisfied!

I also picked up this bluetooth adapter, which has made these even better! https://smile.amazon.com/Wireless-Bluetooth-Adapter-Comfort-Headphones/dp/B077VVNCGL/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_product_top?ie=UTF8
Great sounds and noise cancelling. Wore these on a plane for over 30 hours so far. I like them however for the price it is very disappointing that they are not bluetooth.
hurt my ears. Hurt my ears to wear them. Felt way too much pressure in my ears. Had to return them. The noise cancelling function seemed good though.

Terriffic sound, falls short not having bluetooth.. Great noise cancelling and sound (best on the market) but it is not bluetooth wireless for music. I don't see the point of a product that needs a wire in todays electronic wireless world, not for this price, I sadly returned it. FYI, I'm a huge Bose fan and I have their systems in my home and cars. Folks should also know that noise cancelling is more like noise muffling.

Stopped working after 2 years....consider another brand. Great noise-cancelling headphones but after two years of usage the left ear bud stopped working due to a poor solder joint. Spending $300 on headphones and having this issue occur right outside of the extended warranty period has left me bitter on the quality of products Bose is producing.
I would recommend buying another vendor for noise-cancelling headphones...as Bose is more focused on volume of products over quality.

Very valuable for discounted price!. I loved the nosie cancelling technology from the bose.
I`m not expert in that field but I had purchased several headphones with noise cancelling and product from bose is the best.
If this is too much budget for someone, i recommend the headphones noise cancelling from jbl.

Noise cancelling very effective but not perfect. Noise cancelling works very well no only on white noises but also on speech and music.  However, at high frequency the cancelling is less effective.

Music playback quality is good.  The frequency response is different when noise cancellation is turned on or off.  Overall, high frequency response is lacking, making the sound a bit muffled.

The headset is light and comfortable.  The carrying case is a plus.  However, mechanical design can be improved to make the headphone more compact when folded.

A must have for Commuters. I bought the QC15 back in 2010 and I was immensely disappointed at the Sound Quality. After trying the QC25 at bestbuy for a few minutes, I was more than impressed with the Quality of the sound. The build quality is also superv, the Noise Cancelling feature is a MUST for those of us that commute to work on a daily basis,  A must have for music lovers!

Great Noise-Cancelling, Faulty Connection. This is the 2nd pair of Bose headphones I've gone through. I bought the newest model and returned because the Bluetooth connection was bad across devices even using their software. This pair I thought would fare better with wired connection as a fail-safe, but within about 6 months the right earcup has a faulty connection, outside of warranty of course.
Never using Bose again; would not recommend this brand.

Can wear all day. Replacing my disintagrated quiet comfort 1that I had for 7 years. Very very comfortable which is the primary reason for sticking with Bose. As far as audio quality, there is some markedly difference between powered and bypass. In bypass, ie noise cancelling off, it sounds rather flat and very low.
With noise cancelling on, the audio is very bright and articulate. There are some amplifier artifacts notable.
Good enough for day to day use. Not recommended for studio work.

Great noise cancelling headphones.. These are fantastic headphones.  The audio quality is great, and the noise cancelling really works.  I use them at work to not hear my coworkers and they work great.
Five Stars. The best noise cancelling headphones in the business.  Bose winds over Beats.

very very quiet on the place/good noise cancelling!. can't believe these noise cancelling head set until I put it on... much better than my previous one (which was bought at Costco, for $60), you get what you pay for!  could not be happier.

Almost perfect, but overpriced.. I love these. I've owned many pairs of noise cancelling headphones, Bose is by far the best. Bose is the only pair that I haven't destroyed in 3 months. They feel cheap but are not in any way. I work in a factory and I truly feel I am saving my hearing (and why im so hard on these). Recently used these so I could sleep in the car on a long road trip where the driver was cranking dance music. If they fit tighter, theyd work better (pushing in on them makes them work better)

Great noise cancellation headphones.. These headphones are great.  The noise cancelling is amazing.  No wonder the NFL coaches use Bose headsets.  I moved into a crowded office environment where you can hear people talking anywhere in the room.  This headset greatly reduces the noise and allows me to concentrate while at work.
Five Stars. OMG these are awesome! Noise cancelling is amazing.

I think these headphones were really designed for someone who is using them sitting down (like on an airplane).
Four Stars. Noise Cancelling works great on bus. Good sound also.

Noise cancelling works great! Sound is phenomenal. Noise cancelling works great!  Sound is phenomenal, as to be expected from a Bose product.  I'm not used to headsets over my ears and I found after an hour or so that they were not comfortable for me.  They felt tight over my ears, even though they're nice and padded and soft.
Five Stars. Great sound and comfort, just as one might expect from Bose.

Great sound, but the ear pads are destroyed after 2 years. The sound of this noise cancelling headphone is of unparalleled quality. However, the ear pads are completely destroyed by use after 2 years. Are there any replacements available? For the price of this product, it should be much more robust.
Five Stars. Great quality! sound is good and noise canceling is what I needed
Five Stars. The best noise cancelling headphones in the business.  Bose winds over Beats.
Five Stars. I don't know how I ever traveled on an airplane without these!
Five Stars. OMG these are awesome! Noise cancelling is amazing.
Five Stars. I love them but be careful you use them with only I phones or apple products.
Five Stars. Great noise cancelling head phones.  My husband travels a lot and has had no complaints.  Would highly recommend.
Five Stars. Sound quality is great. Noise Canceling is outstanding
Five Stars. Love the compact design and carrying case. Noise canceling was perfect.
Five Stars. Sound is perfect. The ear cups are so comfortable.
Five Stars. wife loved them, just before she lost them
Five Stars. I was very surprised by the quality of these headphones. I really didn't expect this from Bose.
Five Stars. These headphones sound great with or without the noise cancellation!
Five Stars. My favorite headphones yet.  The noise cancelling on these is awesome if you travel a lot.
Five Stars. Works really well. Used a few times on long flights and feel worth it.
Five Stars. Great sound and comfort, just as one might expect from Bose.

Stopped working after 2 years....consider another brand. Great noise-cancelling headphones but after two years of usage the left ear bud stopped working due to a poor solder joint. Spending $300 on headphones and having this issue occur right outside of the extended warranty period has left me bitter on the quality of products Bose is producing.
I would recommend buying another vendor for noise-cancelling headphones...as Bose is more focused on volume of products over quality.

Stopped working, bad whistle noise. I have expensive taste in headphones as I use them professionally and personally every day.  I fall asleep with them so they need to be comfortable and quiet.  Before these I had a $300 pair of sennheiser's which I liked much more.  These feel cheep.  the actually give feedback in one ear from the noise canceling microphone.  So if you put your head in a pillow with these on, you hear a loud whistle like a microphone feedback.  Then one ear stopped working.  No thanks.

Broke after six months. This is a fantastic product when it works. I wouldn't take my chances with it again though. After about 6 months one ear stopped working. I fixed it and the same issue happened a week later. I did a little research to see if this was an isolated incident and it looks like it has happened to a lot of people.
Questionable Manufacturing Quality. Stopped working on one of the ear after 18 months. Bad manufacturing quality for a pricy headphone and this issue is reported by multiple people.

Poor build quality, widespread reports of failures.  Look elsewhere.. The headphones are great while they work.  Unfortunately, Bose's build quality is poor, and there are widespread reports of dead speakers.  I only learned this after my Bose QC25s, with no physical damage or rough treatment, stopped working.  These things have maybe ~100 total hours of use, though over a period of time that puts me just outside the warranty window.  Bose customer service offered me a replacement set for $225.  Hahahaha.  Take your business elsewhere, as I will for my replacement headphones.

Best headphone... until it lasted. Best headphone I ever head. Use it mostly for airplane and listening music, sometimes I forget how noisy the ambient can be.

Edit: So just over 1 year, the right headphone stopped working. If I put pressure on it sometimes it works. By quick googling I saw lots of people have the same problem.
I'm very disappointed especially since I was always careful on using them - given how much they cost.

Left Ear Stopped Working A Year In. The left ear stopped working a little after 1 year.  I found a fix online where you need to create a paper shim and insert it into inside of the electronics so that a copper wire will once again be in contact with the speaker membrane.  So it's temporarily solved for right now, but this shouldn't be happening.

Good when works. Too Bad :(. After two months of having it unit has stopped working. It appears the input on the left headphone has gone bad. If I play with the cord it will work. Otherwise its just dead silent. Really is unfortunate as they were great when worked

Difficult to listen to anything with them.... Cable is flimsy, and it gets disconnected if you turn your head, so you end up listening only on the left ear, so you adjust it, then you move your head again and you lose sound, you adjust it again, you get some noise and then your music... then you move  your head and starts all over again...

Stopped working after 2 years....consider another brand. Great noise-cancelling headphones but after two years of usage the left ear bud stopped working due to a poor solder joint. Spending $300 on headphones and having this issue occur right outside of the extended warranty period has left me bitter on the quality of products Bose is producing.
I would recommend buying another vendor for noise-cancelling headphones...as Bose is more focused on volume of products over quality.
Left channel imbalance. Great comfort, build is great but headband felt flimsy, left earcup louder than right, returned. YMMV.

Pathetic!!. The left speaker can barely be heard after less than a month and I baby these things!!! I use them to study at home and in the library that is it. Pathetic quality and I would not buy them if I were you. Think about. You will say to yourself well thats just one instance. Well thats a $300 chance.

I believe they would have gone bad much sooner had I used them more often. Had these for almost 4 years before the left side went out.  I seldom used these headphones.  I believe they would have gone bad much sooner had I used them more often.  I was expecting a much longer life considering I have not used them much.  This is unacceptable considering the price tag of over $300 when I bought them.  They still look brand new but will be going to the trash.

Left Ear Stopped Working A Year In. The left ear stopped working a little after 1 year.  I found a fix online where you need to create a paper shim and insert it into inside of the electronics so that a copper wire will once again be in contact with the speaker membrane.  So it's temporarily solved for right now, but this shouldn't be happening.
After a few months, the left earphone went out. I'm not the only one with this issue; I'll be contacting customer support. Left earphone--quality control failure.
Sounded ok. Developed a buzz In left ear after .... Sounded ok. Developed a buzz In left ear after about four hours use. Sending back.  Will try another brand.

Great headphones until they break. Great until they're not

My left ear cup broke after medium use. I always used the padded carry case. And the company I bought them from won't repair them. And neither will Bose. Be wary of buying

Left Ear Started Crackling. Within one week of usage the left ear started crackling whenever noise cancellation was turned on.  I returned for a replacement but if it happens again I will return for refund.

Jack connection is flimsy. Very disappointed. The jack connection to the left earphone is very loose and signal cuts out with slight movement. My wife got these for me as a gift about 9 months ago. It wasn't so bad at first but now it is ridiculous. How can Bose put out such a crappy product for this price?

Good when works. Too Bad :(. After two months of having it unit has stopped working. It appears the input on the left headphone has gone bad. If I play with the cord it will work. Otherwise its just dead silent. Really is unfortunate as they were great when worked

Great on a plane. I was skeptical of this entire genre of headphones.  #1 the sounds is great.  #2 the noise cancelling on a plane or in an office not only works but works really well.  I could not hear the plane but could have a conversation without shouting.  ONly reason they are a 4 is after a few hours of straight use they get hot.  Might be expected but I was unhappy to have to take them off and listen to the rest of the world while cooling off my ears.

Great headphones!. If you can afford these, get them! I bought them for an overnight 8-hour trip to South America.  I knew the flight would be loud (can't stand the sound of engines or annoying, reluctant, job-hating-please-do-something-else flight attendants).  Needless to say, these headphones cancelled all noise and I slept like a baby!  Great for airplane travel and doing work involving heavy machinery.  I recently used these while pressure washing a roof and it was a surreal experience. Also, got a loud spouse you want to block out?  I will say no more!
Five Stars. Great quality! sound is good and noise canceling is what I needed

Great Deal on BOSE. I bought these at a huge discount Amazon was having on some p[roducts. I normally would not pay up0 for Bose products but could not pass this deal up. The phones work while mowing the lawn. Can barely hear then the tractor. Great product and As a Sound Studio owner, I love these although I only use Sony MDR 7506 in the studio

The noise-canceling feature is pretty amazing and is really great for blocking out noise .... Everyone I know who has these loves them. The noise-canceling feature is pretty amazing and is really great for blocking out noise in cafes in addition to planes etc. Bought these for my dad for christmas and he loves them. Quality sound Bose is known for.

They are comfortable to wear for long periods and produce great sound. I travel often and these are a God send!  I can put these on and instantly the noisy terminal, the sounds of the plane, the crying children in a waiting room... all instantly gone replaced by my music of choice.  They are comfortable to wear for long periods and produce great sound.  I have noticed sounds in my favorite songs that I had never noticed before.  I highly recommend these.

Great headphone, except for little base and bad AAA battery design... can't recharge it. 3.5 stars would be more appropriate

Pros:
Great noise cancellation
Beautiful Premium Design
Very light and comfortable

Cons:
No Base... Sounds bland
AAA battery??!! For $300, I'd expect to be able to recharge the headphone battery

I'll keep these because they have the best NC at this price range, but the base and battery issue are extremely disappointing.
Loved them. Great sound and comfortable. Loved them.  Great sound and comfortable.  Quick delivery.

They work great to cancel out surrounding sounds. I bought these for my husband and he LOVES them. They work great to cancel out surrounding sounds, like our kids, when he's listening to music or working.

Great unless you have hair.. I wanted to like these.  They are comfortable, lightweight and sound good.  They continue to work at a reduced volume when the battery dies.  There is however -what is to me- a fatal flaw.  The design grabs your hair where they pivot.  I have ripped out countless strands of hair taking them off and Im sick of it.  I won't use them anymore.  I give them two stars because I suppose they are usable by someone without hair.

A little too tight on the head, otherwise excellent!. Very happy with these headphones. Exceptional noise canceling and very good sound quality. I was hesitant spending so much for headphones but the fact that the noise canceling works so well makes it well worth it. The lateral pressure on the head is a bit too tight for me. While it does hold the headphones securely to the head, it is a little uncomfortable. Would be great if the amount of pressure on the cranium was adjustable.
Great sounds and noise cancelling. Wore these on a plane for over 30 hours so far. I like them however for the price it is very disappointing that they are not bluetooth.

Awesome sound canceling with great music being heard.. WOW. Ive never been able to own Bose products before, but these Bose
QC25 have made my world of listening to music a pure joy. Noise cancellation is Awesome. And to be able to hear the highs and lows of music. Its never been better.  TRON Legacy sound track has never sounded so Great. Thanks for the purchase at a price I could afford.

Terriffic sound, falls short not having bluetooth.. Great noise cancelling and sound (best on the market) but it is not bluetooth wireless for music. I don't see the point of a product that needs a wire in todays electronic wireless world, not for this price, I sadly returned it. FYI, I'm a huge Bose fan and I have their systems in my home and cars. Folks should also know that noise cancelling is more like noise muffling.

Garbage. If I could give 0 stars, I would. I treat these headphones better than most people treat their children. As a consumer, you spend $300+ on  headphones that don't last more than 60 hours; it sounds like a great investment. I recently purchased a set for my girlfriend which I will proceed to return. I think the most frustrating part of this experience is that I now have a 9 hour flight without headphones. I will need to purchase something else at the airport. Thanks Bose!!

Wonderful sound quality, top notch noise canceling, burns through batteries.. These are great headphones, and the noise canceling is top quality. When my cat gets annoying and starts meowing really loudly, I just flip the switch and hear total silence. My one issue is that the noise canceling burns through batteries like nobody's business, and I wish they could just charge by plugging in to a USB or something like that. Otherwise, amazing sound quality, bass is great but not overbearing, and comes with a handy carrying case.
I have not tried the microphone, but I'm sure it's wonderful.
White noise. Weird white noise sound when i turn on the noise canceling function and the sound dosent sound as good with it on. but other than that it is a great product.

Great sound-a tight fit. Excellent, compact a little small-after x-country flight my ears were a little sore (and I don't have a big head).
Great sound, though.

Best damn noise canceling out there.. This is the 3rd pair of noise canceling headphones I have tried and there is no contest, these are absolutely the best.  They are waaaay more comfortable (nicer, softer pads) than the Klipsch and the audiotronics and the sound quality is great as well.  Without noise canceling on, there are better headphones out there, but I found I use the noise canceling every time I use them.
Four Stars. Great sound. Noise cancelling feature works nicely. But ear feels uncomfortable when wearing it for too long.
BOSE the gold standard in sound. Great battery life and sound! Can be a little pricy but you get what you pay for.
Five Stars. Sound quality is great. Noise Canceling is outstanding

Sound great...broke after 1 minute. I received these and they broke within 1 minute.  For that minute, they sounded great and noise cancelled very well.  However, the connector into the headphone would cause the ear phones to cut in and out when you touched or turned them.  I hope this is not an indication of the quality.  I have sought a replacement from Amazon and will let you know of my new review based on the new pair.

Great sound, terribnle microphone. Very comfortable, and for listening they have been great -- I've fallen asleep with them on in bed and on planes, and they are very durable.  The sound is notably better than any of my other headphones as well.

However, they have been terrible for making phone calls.  People cannot hear me well - the microphones used in speaker phone built into the iPhone has much higher quality, and I end up not being able to use the Bose for call.

Good headphones. Does virtually nothing for reducing crying baby noise.. Pretty good headphones. Good, but not great sound quality. Greatly reduces constant noise sources (road noise, engine noise, airplane noise). Does virtually NOTHING to the noise generated by the crying baby seated near you.

Mediocre sound at the best. Honestly, the only great feature of this headphone is the noise cancelling.  Everything else is mediocre at the best.  Very little sound stage and the volume sounds muted, suggesting that I might need an amplifier as suggested by some comments here.  Not worth the $300 price.

Couldn't be happier with these headphones. Wirth the price.. Can't rave more about these headphones. The sound quality, especially base during movies such as The Hobbit, exceeds my expectations. Great for watching late-night movies without disturbing anyone yet still having a theatre quality experience.

The noise cancellation blocks out the sounds of my home hvac unit so I can watch movies and still keep cool/warm.

NOTE: It does tend to go quickly through the AAA battery that is required for the noise cancelation. Be sure to have a spare battery in the wonderfully durable case that comes with it.

Awesome, Pure Awesome!. Best headphones ever for the gym! They are so lightweight it's unreal. Sweat on them-wipe the ear cushions off, whatever. They block out the chatty person next to you on the elliptical or treadmill. I wear them for mowing and lawn work. The case with them is great. People can hear you just great on the microphone cable- for phone use. They can't tell you are not on the phone and you hear them clearly. The sound-music is so clear it's great. Very lightweight too.
Great sound. Too hot on the ears no it .... Great sound. Too hot on the ears no it has no give. Squeezes too hard on the head. I used them maybe 5 times.

Great sound but not a great fit for above average head and ear size.. I bought these as I have wanted a nice set of headphones. On the plus side they arrive quickly, looked great but didn't fit my head or ears I am large in size and these are made for normal sized people. The girlfriend and my son loved them, however, they were for me.
Great noise cancellation and sound!. Great headphones! Anyone who has an issue or a defect should just contact Bose directly for warranty service.

It hurts my ears :(. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is that headphones start to hurt my ears after aprox. 30 minutes of listening. Sound is great, noise cancelling great, but comfort of wearing is poor. Im in love with Bose, but didn't expect this unpleasant annoyance.

Good headphones, poor value.. Sound is great, but build quality could be better. Headphone folding issue and the ear pads come apart easily even with careful use. For the money the build quality should last longer.

Great noise cancelling effect, great sound!. Bought for my 12-ur old daughter for the noise cancelling component for test taking in school.  Does not eliminate noise but muffled nicely for her to focus appropriately.  The bonus, the sound quality of the headphones for music and streaming video!!

Great headphones. These headphones are great.  They're my first over ear headphones and they're nothing but wonderful.  The sound is great and the noise cancellation is nice.  The noise cancellation works best for deeper background noises like an air conditioner or on a plane.

Best Bose headphones yet. I used to have Sennheiser noise-canceling headphones and while they sounded great, the base was terrible and the volume never got loud enough. These Bose headphones blow them out of the water - and they cost $200 LESS than the Sennheisers! My only gripe is that Bose regressed a bit and made the batteries non-rechargeable. But that is a minor gripe compared to how much they get right with these!
... will not believe the sound you get with these great muffs.. You will not believe the sound you get with these great muffs.
Five Stars. These headphones sound great with or without the noise cancellation!

Great noise cancellation, but mediocre sound quality. Noise cancellation is great, but the sound quality is only mediocre. It's too sharp, sometimes overwhelmingly sharp, in the midrange, with a distinct lack of deep bass. I mainly use this on airplanes, especially for listening to movies. I wouldn't buy it as an audiophile piece; you can get MUCH better sound for less money with most of the Sennheiser headphones going for $100-300.
Great sound!. I got this for my wife, she loves it.  I listened to it and found that it is better than the older Bose headset that I have been using.  I may have to get one of these for myself.

The headphones work great for noise cancelling but if you move too much. The headphones work great for noise cancelling but if you move too much, the wire comes loose from the headphones and you lose sound.  I think these headphones were really designed for someone who is using them sitting down (like on an airplane).
Four Stars. Noise Cancelling works great on bus. Good sound also.

Noise cancelling works great! Sound is phenomenal. Noise cancelling works great!  Sound is phenomenal, as to be expected from a Bose product.  I'm not used to headsets over my ears and I found after an hour or so that they were not comfortable for me.  They felt tight over my ears, even though they're nice and padded and soft.
Five Stars. Great sound and comfort, just as one might expect from Bose.

Great sound, but the ear pads are destroyed after 2 years. The sound of this noise cancelling headphone is of unparalleled quality. However, the ear pads are completely destroyed by use after 2 years. Are there any replacements available? For the price of this product, it should be much more robust.
Four Stars. Quality product and good value for the price!
Four Stars. Arrived in a timely manner and met my expectations.
Four Stars. These are great if you fly a lot. Very performant otherwise too.
Four Stars. Great sound. Noise cancelling feature works nicely. But ear feels uncomfortable when wearing it for too long.

Other than that, they're perfect.

Four Stars. Noise Cancelling works great on bus. Good sound also.

A must have for Commuters. I bought the QC15 back in 2010 and I was immensely disappointed at the Sound Quality. After trying the QC25 at bestbuy for a few minutes, I was more than impressed with the Quality of the sound. The build quality is also superv, the Noise Cancelling feature is a MUST for those of us that commute to work on a daily basis,  A must have for music lovers!

Poor build quality, widespread reports of failures.  Look elsewhere.. The headphones are great while they work.  Unfortunately, Bose's build quality is poor, and there are widespread reports of dead speakers.  I only learned this after my Bose QC25s, with no physical damage or rough treatment, stopped working.  These things have maybe ~100 total hours of use, though over a period of time that puts me just outside the warranty window.  Bose customer service offered me a replacement set for $225.  Hahahaha.  Take your business elsewhere, as I will for my replacement headphones.

but build quality seems very good, so I expect to have them for a .... Sound quality is just average (as with all Bose products) but I bought it for the noise canceling, which works VERY well. Couldn't hear anything at all on the plane. When I got off my friends even said a baby was crying, I didn't hear it. A little pricey, but build quality seems very good, so I expect to have them for a long time.

Good headphones, poor value.. Sound is great, but build quality could be better. Headphone folding issue and the ear pads come apart easily even with careful use. For the money the build quality should last longer.

Go with Bose if you're looking for quality.. You can't go wrong with Bose. Ever. And these headphones are light and make listening to music or a audio book a pleasure. Disappear into exercise and go with the flow.

Best noise canceling. Spectacular noise cancellation.  I work in a noisy environment adjacent to areas with lots of very loud kids.  These replaced another brand and have made my life way happier there.  Excellent clarity and definition for music listening too, though if you want really heavy bass, these might not be the best for you.  Well balanced enough to clearly hear bass parts for learning/transcribing.  For an over-the-ear headphone, they're also quite comfortable - I'm able to keep them on a pretty long time before needing a break.

They work great to cancel out surrounding sounds. I bought these for my husband and he LOVES them. They work great to cancel out surrounding sounds, like our kids, when he's listening to music or working.

Difficult to listen to anything with them.... Cable is flimsy, and it gets disconnected if you turn your head, so you end up listening only on the left ear, so you adjust it, then you move your head again and you lose sound, you adjust it again, you get some noise and then your music... then you move  your head and starts all over again...

Awesome sound canceling with great music being heard.. WOW. Ive never been able to own Bose products before, but these Bose
QC25 have made my world of listening to music a pure joy. Noise cancellation is Awesome. And to be able to hear the highs and lows of music. Its never been better.  TRON Legacy sound track has never sounded so Great. Thanks for the purchase at a price I could afford.

The best, now even better. How do you improve on the original classic that makes bus, train, and air travel so much more bearable, and even makes for great gaming headphones? You reduce the size and weight, and make it so that they work even if the batteries go dead. I never travel without these (I take a lot of trains and planes), and at home, they're the answer to my wife's prayers when I'm listening to music or blasting mutants.

bought it as a gift this is the 4th bose .... bought it as a gift this is the 4th bose product I buy. been using mine daily for 3 years. the cushions were worn out so I bought new cushions for mine 2 months ago. comments.comment:
Acceptable for the price. I got these headphones to use at work as my wired headphones were starting to fall apart.

Pros:
Good range on the wireless
Excellent battery, I just charged for the first time after almost 2 months (use about 2-3 hours a day)
Price

Cons:
I wear glasses and this doesn't fully wrap around the ear so it still pushes against my glasses
The sound quality isn't great, especially when transitioning between songs or when picking up notifications
Microphone is muffled

comments.comment:
Decent, inexpensive bluetooth headphones.. Decent, inexpensive bluetooth headphones. These will charge in less than 2 hours; despite repeated use, I have not had to recharge them yet!
The headphones have a strong bass sound and amplify the volume well. Two minor things: 1) the headphones may be too small for some people.
They don't expand very much. 2) the ear cups do tend to get a tad hot and may make you sweaty. I suggest removing them from your ears from time to time to cool off.

comments.comment:
The Best inexpensive Bluetooth headphones you can buy right now.. These pair well via Bluetooth. Main Pros: Inexpensive ($20), high playback time (40 hours - so I haven't ever had it die on me, in need of charging), snug (a bit low-profile), over ear design, rugged.

Cons: Sound quality can get a little tinny on the treble. Handles BASS pretty well, though.
Tight headpiece - My ears hurt after wearing these for a couple of hours. The headpiece is too tight and even though they can be adjusted, they will probably always be too snug.

comments.comment:
Good Value. Reporting back for a friend who received these over the holidays.

Pros:

1. Battery life is great, can go a couple days without charge.

2. The bluetooth connection is stable, and theres no cutting out.

3. Durable for gym workouts and cardio; also fits well.

4. Loud and clear sound, good casual headphones.

Cons:

1. Button placement on the headphones could use some work.

** Not so much a knock for the headphones, but USPS lost these in the mail, but amazon sent out another pair**

Great for PC/Gaming/TV. Great value/price. Good, but not great for music.. These are great for the price. I got them on a Lightning deal for $24.  I would buy them again.
They are a bit heavier than expected, so not as comfortable wearing them around the house all day.
I use them occasionally, but after dropping hundreds on Beats Studio's (mostly marketing $$) I can see the short comings of the Bluedio.
At 1/10th the price of wireless Beats, I would have been quite happy to work with these for a long time.

comments.comment:
Unrealistic Expectations - I Admit It.. Unrealistic Expectations - I Admit It. The headphones feel cheap. Ie: fake chrome plastic etc. But in reality what should I expect for $29.00 dollars?

The sound is fair, slightly muffled. Treble is almost non existent. Honestly if you use the headphones for 6 months on a regular basis something is going to snap off and/pr stop working.

The good news is, where as can you find full featured headphones with decent sound for $29.00 dollars? There almost free.

Great disposable headphones!

***********UPDATE************UPDATE************UPDATE************UPDATE************
I found that the iPhones have an internalized EQ under Settings>Music>EQ here you change the EQ for the Music app I used Bass Reducer and it helped to hear the mids better and they maltipal others too chooses from! UPDATE************UPDATE************Cheers!

ngram_comments:
Great for Price; Okay. Packaged well and comes with extra AUX cord and a USB cord to charge.
The plastic it's made of feels a little flimsy. The ear pads are comfy
The bass is a little more muted than I like in my seinhiesers (can't spell it) but that perfectly fine considering the price.
If you're looking for a good sound quality Bluetooth headphones these aren't bad.

Acceptable for the price. I got these headphones to use at work as my wired headphones were starting to fall apart.

Pros:
Good range on the wireless
Excellent battery, I just charged for the first time after almost 2 months (use about 2-3 hours a day)
Price

Cons:
I wear glasses and this doesn't fully wrap around the ear so it still pushes against my glasses
The sound quality isn't great, especially when transitioning between songs or when picking up notifications
Microphone is muffled

Very poor quality headphones do not buy unless you want to waste your money.. Junk, do not buy. Poor quality sound, very tinny. And I am not even that particular about headphones. The pairing was difficult on three different devices and the range is only about 12 feet. I could have done better had a researched a little more. The voice indicating power on or power off is next to impossible to understand.

The sounds quality is ok... for the .... The sounds quality is ok... for the price. A bit muddy but works for pre-teenage girl.
Overall comfy and decent looking to my daughter liking.
The real problem is the quality of building materials - headband cracked after a while rendering headphones unusable - had to open to see - the headband plastic is really thin and breakage prone i think. Have to look for some new ones again ;-(

Great headphones.. I love the fact that it gives you 30hrs of music. I can work out all week long in just one charge. The sound quality is really good. I have bought 4 more after the first one as gifts to my family members.

Good bluetooth headphones Bad construction. These guys pair with my transmitter quickly and the sound quality is great. They are comfortable to wear and the controls are easy to access. However, they are cheap. I have three pairs and all have broken. The headband is made of cheap plastic. That's what breaks!

Best value for money. Outstanding value for money. Bettery lasts all week. No issues with bluetooth. Great sound. Sturdy build quality, they get beat around in my gym bag and still look great after 6 months

Best $35 you will spend, PERIOD!!!!!!. These headphones are AWESOME!!!! Needed wireless headphones for trips/workouts/etc. REFUSED to pay $300 for headphones of any brand. Did research here and saw lots of good reviews....was not disappointed!!! Sound quality is EXCELLENT, little to no distortion at high volumes, music and movies sound wonderful! Although I don't use headphones for phone calls, I gave it a try even that was great! Other party seemed to hear me clearly. Very good purchase, you will not regret it!!!!

Works well with One Plus One phone. Amazing quality and sound for so cheap! Im sure being rough could break them (like anything else) but still worth it since the cost is so low. Paired up and works perfect with my one plus one phone.

ok blue-tooth headset. Sound Quality is OK. Got these on sale for around $25-30. I seen they were originally $100.. Ive found these same headphones regularly priced on GEEK app on my Android cell phone at $28 so I think the $100 price tag is bogus. ,

VERY easy Bluetooth set-up
Pretty comfortable to wear.
USB charger only cable(NO wall outlet) so be prepared for that (I used my SAMSUNG note5 charger and it works great)

Low price, high quality.. Weird  fit, but great sound. Im a gymrat and this does a good job blocking out sound even though it's not built for noise cancellation.

Poor mic quality. Also works on the Xbox One. (Mic doesnt however)

Decent. Works well for about a month but not all the buttons and switches are not working. sound quality is decent considering I got it for $20. Not designed for moist condition like heavy sweating or steam room.
Must buy!. Nice looking, great comfort. Sound quality is pretty descent. Great bass! Once you have them on, all surrounding sounds are blocked. Music is all you hear!
Awesome. Son's headphone. Awesome. Son's headphone. No more broken wires. Charge holds about a week with constant use. Very acceptable sound quality. Will definatel

Sound quality is mediocre, about on par with other .... Sound quality is mediocre, about on par with other $25-$30 headphones. Everything about the headphones is on par with other non-branded headphones in this price range , the fit to head, manufacturing, etc. The one real plus that is unique is the fact that you can use them as Bluetooth headphones or corded headphones. .  .

Very good quality for the price.. I ordered these earphones after using the earbuds from the same manufacturer for three months.  The headphones have met our needs perfectly.  The sound produced by these earphones is very good.  I am an avid listener of different types of music from rock to classical but certainly not an audiophile. The headband is not of exceptional quality so I wonder about its lifespan.

Good sound, not so great construction.. Headphones only lasted about 30 days before breaking. The headband adjustment on one side stopped holding the earpiece in place after just two weeks of use, then the power button stopped working. I bought these as a gift for my nephew and while he loved the sound, the quality of the headphones doesn't seem up to daily use.

A+++ price, soubd, quality, battery life and pirtabiluty all get an A++. Love em. Cant get better for price...Ive tried several.. For the price I paid these are AWESOME. sound great, plenty loud and have great bass. They're Bluetooth so wireless when you want for up to just about 3.5 hours or plug into headset cable and use nor.ally. they work great on the 1-760_201-9530 through BTW and it's in stereo and respond perfectly  to OK Google or Hey Sirius. For what I paid. I'll be getting a second pair.

great looking headphone for the cheap price. great looking inexpensive headphone .
sound quality is unexped great quality headphone.

Comfortable, affordable and great looking over the ear wireless headphones. These are great so far. I've only had them a few weeks, but for affordable wireless headphones they are great. So far they hold their charge and sound awesome. I also like the look of the black ones. I didn't want to spend money on beats by dre or bose if I didn't like the look and feel of the over the ear headphones. I feel like I got a quality product at a affordable price.

My son loves them. I purchased these headphones for my son for his 11th birthday , he absolutely loves them he says they are boss whatever that means. He also thinks they sound better than my bluedio R+ legend that I have but what ever float's his boat. I think they have a sturdy build quality then my R+.They also sound pretty good as well. It would be great if bluedio would  make replacement head bands for there R+ legend head phones because mine has cracks in them for some reason.

The Best inexpensive Bluetooth headphones you can buy right now.. These pair well via Bluetooth. Main Pros: Inexpensive ($20), high playback time (40 hours - so I haven't ever had it die on me, in need of charging), snug (a bit low-profile), over ear design, rugged.

Cons: Sound quality can get a little tinny on the treble. Handles BASS pretty well, though.
Tight headpiece - My ears hurt after wearing these for a couple of hours. The headpiece is too tight and even though they can be adjusted, they will probably always be too snug.

not the worlds greatest, but not terrible. Battery life is nuts on these. I can only recall charging these up a grand total of 8 times in 8 months, with at least 1 hour of use per night average. Sound quality is what you paid for, not the worlds greatest, but not terrible, especially considering bluetooth.
Snapped heard strap. I'm pleased with sound quality but irritated that the head strap broke.  My daughter got some good use out of them but gee whiz. Bought in August.

Bluetooth Headphones. Impressed with the sound quality. Nice comfortable fit. They are as described. The one downfall are the function button as they are a bit flimsy and built with a low quality material.

I love the product and the sound quality. I love the product and the sound quality,  the fit is excellent, i also love the fact you can lidt the ear piece without removing the head set and have a conversation. Will buy again

Good product for $20. Good product for $20.  Connects super fast and has excellent battery life.  HOWEVER, they should be classified as "on-ear" and not "over-the-ear".  They are uncomfortable as they press against your ears to your head.  They work for me as I just use them for a break occasionally from my earbuds.  Sound quality is less than average but I don't expect Beats or Bose for $20.  If you do, keep looking.  They work fine for what I need.
Three Stars. Got broken so easy, the quality is too bad but the sound quality is so good. It's okay.

sound quality is not that great. sound quality is not that great and also the range...but ok for the price i guess, maybe there is a better one out there
in this price range

Great sound!  ...are a bit tight on the ears.. Awesome sound quality!  2 thumbs up for the sounds.  They are a bit tight though.  I actually broke the plastic band which is inside the leather casing, when I dropped them one day.  It still holds up okay, but they slide off my head easily now.  That was totally my fault.  I still love the sound even though I made a mistake.  My only complaint is.. they are SUPER tight at first.  Maybe in time they would get more comfortable. (?)

The Bluetooth connection is pretty impressive. The ear cups also do not pivot .... Not expecting much due to the affordability aspect of these headphones, but the sound quality is muddled with bass and highs are very weak. The Bluetooth connection is pretty impressive. The ear cups also do not pivot to conform to the round shape of your head, which can provide for a rather uncomfortable wearing experience if not positioned perfectly on your head.

Great Product!!. I love these headphones!  The bass is great and the sound qualitythey produce is great.  The battery life is good, and the bluetooth capability works well.  It connected to my android tablet without a problem.  These heaphones are well worth $35, and if I ever need a second pair, I would definitely buy tthem again.  It also shipped pretty fast.

Decent. Battery life is ridiculously awesome, very comfy.. Not the best sound quality, a lot of white noise as they aged, but very comfortable and the battery life is amazing - didn't have to charge for at least a week, using all day every day. Broke in half trying to stuff in a backpack in a hurry after 6 months, still think I got my money's worth.
Good quality sound. Good quality sound. Easy to pair, but FLIMSY. I broke the top part within a week of getting them. Tried to fix it with some tape. Kind of worked.

Worth more than its being sold for.. Better than Beats. I have had a set since December and decided that I liked them so much I had to buy a set for my wife and daughter. They last for ever in a charge don't know what the spec is but it gives it no justice. Sound quality is great and works as a head set so you can talk with it as well. I'm a simple guy and like a simple review this product works flawlessly

Bluedio. These headphones are good for the price. The sound quality is not as good as expensive headphones but they work well. The battery life on them is extremely good and I can use them for a long time before having to charge. I do not listen to headphones very often but they are great to have at a good price.

These are decent for the price.. These are decent for the price. Sound is pretty good, but I'm not happy with the way these one's fit. The one's that don't fold fit on my head much better. Outside of that they are pretty good. Battery life is great, sound quality is decent, but the build quality is a bit cheap. I would recommend the RevJams over these for sure, and the price is pretty close anyway. These are okay for around the house, but not for working out or anything like that.

... bit heavy and ill formed to fit th ear comfortably but am getting used to them. A bit heavy and ill formed to fit th ear comfortably but am getting used to them ... sound quality excellent (easily as good as MUCH higher cost units. Can get about 7 hours of "on" time between 2 hour charges

Easy to Pair, good quality sound.. Easy to pair, good sound. These are no Dres but they are very good, have a long charge and are easy to use. Purchased for tween & teen. They are very happy. Would purchase again.
But sounds good.. Long lasting battery' stylish' style. Built quality kinda low. But sounds good.

Like listening to a cassette tape through a tin-can telephone. The bluetooth pairing functionality works just fine... but the sound quality is dogs***. I have no idea what good these headphones are, but they're certainly not for listening to music.

Very uncomfortable, ear phones do not swivel to cover the ear.. Recommend staying away from these as sound quality is not that good and build quality is not there either, I am returning these for Sony or Panasonic another trusted brand.  I have never seen a person with ears perfectly parallel to each other whIch is the only shape these cans can fit.

Good sound quality. Very good sound quality. " What you may not notice is that we have adjusted the headband, based on Ergonomics theory, to fit all head sizes." But it does not fit my ears, after 15 mins. my ears begin to feel pain. I tried every way to adjust it but it would not work. I guess my ears are too big!

Update, I opened up the ear pads and cut out the inside pad part. Now they fit over my ears with no problem. Of course this voided the warranty.
... bit tight on my head but sound quality is excellent. A bit tight on my head but sound quality is excellent

they are just as good quality and sound better than other headphones that cost .... I was not a believer till I bit the bullet and ordered these...they are just as good quality and sound better than other headphones that cost hundreds of dollars. Bass response is almost silly, they sound like you just strapped two floor speakers to your head! Separate amp built in so you can turn up higher than the source and built in EQ if the bass isn't your thing...awesome!

Amazing sound !!!. Wow, the quality and sound from these headsets do not add up to the price. I'm very satisfied with the sound, design and price. I would of gave them 5 stars but, the picture makes them look like a shiney metal, but their actually a dull metal.
Incredible sound. Incredible sound quality. Careful use, head band is plastic & broke four months, careful. Not happy.
Awesome sound.. Awesome sound.. Booming bass.. I referred a friend. He enjoys them & I will definitely buy another pair very soon. And sound quality is clear when talking on phone........ Go Bluedio.

Love them. Love these headphones!  They are comfy so I can use them all day.  You do have to adjust every once in a while but they don't hurt you like a lot of others do after longer wear, even with glasses on.  Battery life is excellent, hubby and I share them and it takes a few days to run down the battery.  Sound quality is great, much more than I expected.  Color is the same as the picture.  Set up is easy.

Affordable and Durable Bluetooth Headset. I purchased this headset for the ability to adjust while on your head into multiple positions since the ear pieces are on a swivel as well in order to fold them up. They work great! They also are Bluetooth, which is another big win for me. The sound quality is acceptable, however the microphone isn't the best for phone calls in a noisy environment. However for everyday use, these are excellent. Additionally the battery lasts for days, literally days!!!

Great Sound Need a Better Build Quality!!!. These Headphone are GREAT SOUNDING!!!!!  But the head band is plastic and breaks too easily... If they change the headband to metal I'd pay $10 or $15 more for the durability...
Great Sound, Easy to Use. My 10 y/o son loves these.  They cancel noise without making him deaf to his parents and they provide excellent sound quality - at least by my son's standards.

Great sound,  poor design.. Excellent sound quality but they feel like they were made backwards. When you put them on the front way then they feel awkward but when you turn them around and put them on backwards they fit perfectly. It appears to be a design flaw that hurts my ears after about 10 minutes.

... changed my mind in many ways this product is excellent and the quality of sound is great better than .... I originally did a review on this headset but I have changed my mind in many ways this product is excellent and the quality of sound is great better than expected I was so happy with it that I even purchase a second set. Great job guys.

Good Quality headphones. Good Quality headphones, pairing is easy to Bluetooth devices. Only problem is sound quality. If you like the similar Beats head phones you will love these! ***********UPDATE************UPDATE************UPDATE************UPDATE************
I found that the iPhones have an internalized EQ under Settings>Music>EQ here you change the EQ for the Music app I used Bass Reducer and it helped to hear the mids better and they maltipal others too chooses from! UPDATE************UPDATE************Cheers!

Good sound, great battery life, average build quality.. Good sound, great battery life can go all week without charging, build quality could use improvements however. The head band has a plastic core and it snapped on me near the left ear piece. I tried to repair but it didn't hold. On the plus side they are cheap enough to replace compared to the more expensive sets. The fit was ok, not perfect. For $30 its a good value but don't expect it to hold up to much punishment.

Love hate relationship.. I got these for Christmas and bought 5 other pair because they sound amazing. However every single pair have broken in the same place on the headband. It makes me sick. I love these headphones but in the end I can't put them on my head to listen to them and I keep buying them over and over expecting a different result. Never happens. Wish I could get them replaced with a metal headband and no plastic. The sound is better than Beats. But the quality of the material is kmart.

So many great features for iphone users!. I bought these for my sister as a present. They are AMAZING! She loves them. The sound quality is good. Bass is great. AND she can press a button on them and talk to siri on her iphone. As a result, she can control the iphone while it is in her pocket. She is able to answer calls, voice dail, use siri commands, and of course...listen to music.

They fit perfect for my head and the sound quality is great .... Bluetooth where have you been all my life? They fit perfect for my head and the sound quality is great ( Not Sennheiser). The range is incredible for my needs. I can roam freely at work (50yds) as long as there are no walls between me and my phone.
Good sound for the price. Sound quality was good for the price. Very good battery life.
Four Stars. Good headphone very comfortable. Quality of sound is good but can improve.

Awesome headphones!. Bought these as a gift for my daughter and she loves them! I've bought her many other headphones and these by far are the best quality and have an amazing sound. Highly recommend, you will love these!

Decent design, bad sound quality.. Maybe mine are defective but there is a constant noise coming through.  Also I find that they do no sit flat on my ears.  If I wear them backwards they are much more comfortable.

Maybe i have a big head?. The sound was nice. They have a funky design that makes more comfortable to wear them backwards. The build quality is cheap.
